Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: travelm0m48
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a 2 double bed room. It was missing most of the furniture for 4 nights and then it was all rearranged while we were out. Not happy! The room renovations were right next door every day, nonstop 8-5. The help was very gracious. We only had a mini frig to use for juices, wines and snacks. Only the Shell owners have a nice kitchenette, not RCI exchangers.The late-night bar noise was extreme for 3 nights.The unlimited beverages were a nice touch. We would go again but after it's done construction mode.The manager was generous after hearing our complaints.Loved the central location!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with The Donatello”
Reviews.Author: Elvira777
Reviews.Content: We felt welcome from the moment we stepped in.The cleanliness of the room was surprising, the room was newly renovated and all the facilities were up to date. Location of the hotel is great, walking distance to Union Square, shops, restaurants, buses, cable car.The whole experience in San Francisco was very pleasant and complimented with The Donatello Hotel. I would warmly recommend this hotel to everyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town”
Reviews.Author: Goldielocks512
Reviews.Content: Great location, large room, comfortable king-sized bed, excellent price. I'm really glad that I shopped around before selecting a hotel. After looking up hotels all over town, both on Trip Advisor, and by actually going to each hotel's website, the Donatello won hands-down over all others. I couldn't be happier my selection. The location is convenient to Union Square. The room was spacious, had a very comfortable king-sized bed, a sleep sofa, a kitchenette with a coffee maker and a microwave, as well as some dishes, cups, glasses and silverware - and they don't charge extra for these amenities like many of the hotels in town do - they are included at the price. The staff was very friendly. My husband had an injury which required surgery to a tendon in his ankle/foot prior to our vacation, so we had a scooter delivered to the hotel prior to our arrival. The hotel staff held onto the scooter until we arrived, and then delivered it to our room upon our arrival. They put us in a handicapped accessible room, which was probably a little larger than a regular room. We were very happy with the room that they put us in. Upon reading many of the reviews on Trip Advisor, I saw many people complained about noise from the street and noise from the elevators. We were in a room right next to the elevators, and didn't have any issue whatsoever with noise from the elevator. In addition, our room was on the 6th floor and faced Post Street. We didn't have any problem at all with noise from the street. The first night, we heard sirens from an ambulance or firetruck, but other than that, no problems whatsoever. The windows are tightly sealed which helps to keep the sound from the street down. The hotel is currently being renovated - new carpeting installed, some painting, etc., so it will be even nicer for those who stay there in the future. The staff was very friendly. We were greeted by Jesus upon our arrival - he was very friendly and had a great sense of humor. Kara was also very helpful in telling us about places to go and things to see around town. There were several other people who worked the front desk, and several concierge team members, all of whom were friendly and accommodating. Even the cleaning people were friendly! I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family who plan to go to San Francisco. It really is the best deal in town! :o)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gael-abroad
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - well located close to Union Square. The room was plenty big and having the small kitchenette really was a bonus. We also found the staff very friendly. Only slight downside was that some renovation work is ongoing which led to some noise and water being cut twice. But that being said we would be very happy to stay there again. There is a very noise space at the top of the hotel where you can relax after seeing the sights. Overall happy to recommend this hotel with a 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Suse197
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great rooms, great location, we would recommend tho hotel to anyone wanting to stay near union square. Really nice renovated rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: randyt
Reviews.Content: Nicely located a block from union square shopping. The outside hall way and main room had been recently renovated. The room was spacious with a full size couch and comfortable bed. There was a small refrigerator, microwave oven, plates, cups, coffee maker, utensils and a separate sink. There was a reasonably sized closet with two luggage stands and hangers. The mitsubishi air conditioner was quiet. The bathroom was the only part of the room that was obviously not undated and there was some obvious patch job going on. I would assume with the rest of the renovations going on at the time this bathroom would eventually get completed. The other noticeable thing is the relatively thin main door as you can easily hear normal level talking right outside. Street noise through the single window pane was at a moderate level during the day and early night so if you are a light sleeper this may be a problem. Overall this was a good place to stay as it was conveniently placed and the staff was generally nice and helpful. The room was slightly above average but due to the still-in-the-works bathroom there is room to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel .. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: devonpilgrim
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at fishermans wharf before and was disappointed so this time we decided to stay centrally! Wow! The room was huge! The bed was really really comfortable .. Especially after the flight from England! Lovely piano bar to relax in and a great pool and jacuzzi. The guest services on the roof level with complimentary coffee etc. was a great place to get information and staff generally couldn't have been more helpful. Excellent central location .. Walking distance to most everywhere .. Being eruropean we walk. The price was exceptional and was far cheaper than many hotels of a much lesser standard!! Would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: charlielouisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on our way back from New Zealand.Lovely comfortable room on the 9th floor.Reception was very helpful nothing too much trouble.The 15th floor was a bonus with its comfy chairs and drinks especially the hot chocolate,but we found the service there stopped at 10.00 and not 10.30.as was advertised.The room was quiet except for sunday morning between 7.00 and 8.00 when it seemed as if the whole city was being awakened and called to prayer.Not what we wanted after a long sleepless flight.The bath was lovely after 4 weeks of only showers.A kettle in the room would have been nice but we did manage to boil water using the microwave.The hotel was very central and ideal for the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SportsmomNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two teenagers spent three nights at the Donatello recently. Our room was recently renovated and beautiful. It was spacious -- with four people we never felt crowded. The beds were most comfortable, (even the pullout couch.). The location was ideal - a short walk to the cable car. I have seen some posters complaining about noise. We were not bothered in the least. It is in the heart of the city, though. The price was reasonable. If we were to return to San Francisco, we would definately return to the Donatello! (And most impressive to a 13 year old, "Mom, there is a tv, in the mirror, in the bathroom!)

Reviews.Title: “RUBY @##%&*@ SKYE”
Reviews.Author: thegrayghost
Reviews.Content: Plusses are location (Union Square) and great concierge. Minuses are location (Ruby Skye) and ill thought room lighting design. Ruby Skye is nearby night club with a chucking out time of 0200 and the clean up crew rock up at 0600 to noisily throw empties in the skip. My experience of SF was soured by lack of decent sleep over 4 nights. Where I am currently in NY the room has double glazing and even though the traffic is insane I can sleep. Also outside Hotel Frank there is an ongoing demo that starts at 0700 on the dot. Staying around Union Square is great but if you value a good night's sleep you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, just a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: Josep V
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was our first hotel in a SF to LA trip. We stayed there for three nights and booked it based on the very positive reviews it gets on tripadvisor. The hotel is great: central location, friendly service and the rooms are large and spacious. The complaints of other reviewers regarding the construction noise did unfortunately also apply to us even though this was a moot issue since we spent almost every hour outside the hotel. I requested (twice) for an upper floor room to get away from the street noise and they could not grant it on either occasion and we were actually located in the floor just above the restaurant and two floors from street level. The double glass windows did a good job but I am light sleeper and could still hear the street noise; this was not an issue for my wife and 5-year-old kid.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Nellie_Nestle
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect! One block from the Union Square. The staff was very accommodating. At the moment unfortunately they are under going renovations and it was a little inconvenient in terms of the elevators, one elevator was reserved for the construction staff since their service elevator was out of order.... So it was a challenge getting one. We stayed at Donatello for one week, the went to Hawaii for a week than came back and stayed for two more days at the Don. Whe we first arrived we were put on the 7th floor but due to construction on the floor beneath us, and being on the corner near Post and Mason and also right about the patio it was quite loud on the Thursday. We requested a quieter room and the staff promptly switched us took care of moving all the luggage and everything. We were moved to room 911, was nice peaceful and quiet. If you are going during the construction, I would recommend asking for a quiet room from the day you check in at least two floors away from the construction and away from Post st. Downtown San Fran will always be loud so that is not the hotels fault, there were protestors at the frank hotel near by and they often started really friggin early....!!!! It woke me up (light sleeper) but not hubby. The room was awesome! Very spacious, had a microwave, sink, plates, mugs, utensils, glasses, coffee machine, fridge. There was a tv both in the bedroom and one in the bathroom mirror - that was such a hoot!! I loved that!!!! Go to the C (club lounge) on the top floor every morning for a free coffee! Also, on Fridays they have a wine and cheese for the guests check the binder in your room for times. We didn't make it so I can't comment. Also, did not eat at hotel restaurant, did order room service though, it's expensive with all the added on tax, but what room service isn't? Nice grilled cheese :-) The ballet parking was 28$. You may be able to find cheaper around, I'm not sure but everywhere we looked was comparable if not more when u add the crazy tax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - noisy outside”
Reviews.Author: loumsrea
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 days in this hotel with husband and 11 and 13 year old. Price was very reasonable, location was great. Our room was very spacious. The pull out couch (queen) was very comfortable. I just have to say that the windows are very thin and the noise outside the hotel was terrible. There is a nightclub on the next block and we were up most of the night Friday and Saturday. Between the drunks on the street and the garbage trucks starting around 3-4 AM, the noise was really incredible. We were on the 9th floor. You would have thought we were on the ground level with our windows wide open. The noise would keep me from staying here again, or recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveleatlove
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Donatello in January 2012 based on the TripAdvisor recommendation. The location was fantastic, room was large and very comfortable. The staff was unusually friendly and very helpful with restaurant suggestions. Great place to stay in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Donatello: not much quality behind the marble facade”
Reviews.Author: myoyster09
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, the website stated renovations would be complete by February 2012. Now the website says by April but I wouldn't count on it. Our room had been renovated, although there was no safe yet installed and one window didn't close properly. Combined with the very thin glass windows, this made noise a serious problem. On the 9th floor at the back of the building, we were awakened at 7 a.m. on our first morning by a very loud and long (2 hrs) protest. Workers at the nearby Hotel Frank have been picketing for over a year and they want everyone to hear them. Protests continued through the week, culminating in a day long siege that began at 7 a.m. on our date of departure. Best thing about this visit (aside from leaving) was the housekeeping staff -- friendly & efficient. Average things: Front desk service. Worst things: #1 - NOISE. In addition to outside noise, the plumbing is incredibly noisy. The toilets sound powerful but are not. Security personnel need to turn down their walkie-talkies while patrolling hallways. #2 - Showering was slightly dangerous as the water temperature fluctuated wildly depending on whether or not anyone else was using water. #3 - WiFi is hands down the slowest I've ever encountered -- anywhere in the world. #4 - Zingari Restaurant. Very average food & service and very overpriced. #5 - At check-in there is talk of a "welcome package". Aside from a map & some generally useless discount coupons, this is really a pitch to get guests to attend at 90-minute pitch about Shell Vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Oxfordfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello over the Easter break. Hotel is nice and clean and the beds are absolutely heaven! Staff are friendly and courteous. Must say there was construction work going on when we were there even though it said that all work would be finished by February! We did have one of the newer reconditioned rooms which was nice. Downside I would say that the noise coming from the street at 2am in the morning is no fun especially when it wakes you. Saying that I did have a faulty window which did not close fully so I guess that made it much noisier. Has a small kitchen area with sink and microwave which was really convenient especially for breakfast. On club level you can get free coffee and tea. There are plenty of coffee shops just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kerryntrevor
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The front desk staff are super friendly and the rooms are newly decorated and extremely clean. A very cool feature is the tv in the bathroom mirror. The Club floor is open to everyone with tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc... Location is perfect. 7 mins from the Bart train and the F train with cable cars right outside the hotel. Rental cars are also 3 mins from the door. I thouroughly enjoyed my stay here and have no trouble recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Anouschkar
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and will stay here again. The location is excellent, staff courteous and the rooms are large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: SdR08
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, right on Union square, and great shopping. We have stayed at this hotel from Wednesday to Friday, and it has been a very good experience. Our room was on the 9th floor, recently renovated, clean and spacious and in a corner, great view. Streets are very noisy, so prepare yourself for that, also be aware that there is a hospital close to this area, so you will hear the ambulances. Hotel offers free wi fi, which works great.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly central hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveW43323
Reviews.Content: Staff was incredibly friendly, and even if this is a stage effort, it results in a feeling of being surrounded by positive energy. Kudos to management. Reconstruction sounds start at 8AM, so don't plan on sleeping late, or ask for a room away from morning noise. Top floor has a bright, open lounge with a small exercise room, and wonderful TV/sitting area with a fireplace and free coffee and tea. Bar on mezzanine has a nice atmosphere and OK Happy Hour. Bedroom was clean, comfortable, and nicely refurbished, like much of the hotel. Location is one block from Union Square and felt very safe and surprisingly quiet. Fan was a bit noisy, but was nice "white noise" for sleeping. Great shower with shower-head with hose. Through online booking, average price of $150/day was great midline price. Nightly chocolates on the pillow were lovely, as were apples at the main desk. Half a block away, great breakfast or lunch place in tiny, friendly Encore Cafe on Post St. We are coffee snobs and they had great stuff, and something new each morning. The decor, food and treats (try the home-made samosas--yum) had a Parisian flare but prices were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ILJim
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, location was great, hotel was nice. We (1 adult & 2 teenagers) stayed two nights in a room with a King Bed and a pullout. Pullout was surprisingly comfortable, and King Bed was very nice. Room was ok, decent sized and clean. It had a mini fridge, microwave and sink along with glasses and silverware, but we didn't use any of that. Only negative was we were on the "5th" floor, which actually seems like the third floor, and there was a lot of street noise, including a 2am dump truck or something that sounded like it was in our room. There was a problem with the freight elevator so one elevator (of 2) in the lobby was shut down for a while, but the staff handled it so well it was not an issue. The free wi-fi never really worked well, speeds were so slow I couldn't really use it - it would get hung up whenever I tried to pull up a map. The good news is the staff was great - very outgoing, friendly & helpful. We had lots of exposure to the staff: making up the pullout bed, turndown service, we needed extra toothpaste, we ordered room service, suggestions from the front desk on restaurants, directions, valet parked our car - even the maintenance guys using the freight elevator were considerate and apologetic...all were great and made the stay wonderful. The location could not have been better for us. All-in-all, a very good stay, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Inauspicious start but good ending”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Donatello for a 6 night stay and were initially put into an accessible room because, we were told, it was the last room available. Given that we had a reservation this explanation didn't make sense. The room was horrible. The TV didn't work, the closets were unsatisfactory for hanging a long formal dress, the room smelled of cigarette smoke, there was not bathtub in the room and construction noise above us started at 7am. The good news was that we were moved to another room and comped for the bad situation the next day. The bad news is someone else is going to get this room. The new, renovated room was excellent. Spacious, clean, well appointed, comfortable and with everything working - this is what we had expected. The staff did everything they could to make things right and we are grateful. The jazz in the lounge downstairs was entertaining and the happy hour appetizers were substantial. The location of the hotel is excellent. The outside noise can be loud at times because of a night club down the street, garbage trucks and the protesters outside of another hotel woke us up at 7am on Saturday. This is not something the hotel can control and we understood that. In the end, we has a wonderful stay at this hotel and really enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “comfort and accessibility a definate plus!”
Reviews.Author: 72Kari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Shell Vacation members and always stay at the Donatello. The Staff is friendly, helpful and make us feel at home! The hotel is one block from Union Square with all the shopping, dining and theatre right at hand. The rooms are spacious and comfortable so we always get a good night's sleep! The Donatello is one reason our trip to San Francisco is always wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay overall”
Reviews.Author: lozlazza
Reviews.Content: I had been to SF 20 years ago for the weekend but this was my parents first trip. Enjoyed our stay in the hotel and San Francisco overall despite a few days of rain in the beginning of holiday. Just returned from a 1 week stay at The Donatello. One of the best decisions I made was to booking 2 studios via their website and was surprised that the rooms looked way better than the website. We stayed on the 9th floor, one of the renovated rooms/floors. Rooms were huge with a kitchenette area with microwave and fridge which came in handy for light snacks and also tableware for 2 people and coffee maker with Wolfgang Puck coffee. King size beds were so comfortable and also the sofa (which could be turned into a sofa bed but didn't use). The bathroom had marble sinks and a telephone and also an additional TV in the mirror! Bonus to have whilst showering and brushing your teeth! The Club Lounge was was a bonus with free coffee, tea, hot chocolate all day. We didn't use the fitness centre but did use the co-ed jacuzzi (and there is also a separate men and wmen sauna. The location was excellent, a block from Union Square, walking distance of Macy's, Westfield, cable car, bus stops, etc. Yes there were city street noises at nite but hey we were slap bang in the centre so expected this - we were overlooking the JW Marriott side. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, helpful and assisted us at every opportunity. The Concierge booked our Wine trip to Sonoma/Napa Valley as we requested and also booked our taxi on way back to SFO which turned out to be a limousine - an extra bonus at the end of a fabulous San Francisco trip! Will highly recommend this hotel. Thanks. (I'll be posting some pics soon)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sandra E
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times at The Donatello and are never disappointed. Beautiful, large rooms with kitchenette, great fitness center, large comfortable rooftop lounge with excellent concierge suggestions. Location is outstanding - you can walk to theaters, museums, shopping and restaurants as well as to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Donatello!”
Reviews.Author: kazk82
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The rooms really are surprisingly large - the kitchenette was very handy for storing food and snacks (loved the coffee perculator with Woflgang Puck coffee). The location is fabulous; a stone's throw to Union Square. We had no problems at all with noise. Wi-fi was mostly quite good. The top level tea and coffee was fantastic and Jesus behind the front counter was simply lovely. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Donatello again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a disappointing 40th birthday stay”
Reviews.Author: Mom2four2011
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, offered free wi-fi, the bed was comfortable and it was clean. Advanced arrangements to have a gift basket delivered to my room didn't happen. A second call to the manager had to be made before action was taken and the action that was taken was mediocre at best (4 days late) and not done as promised. Our room was to include free breakfast but we were not told that was "room service". It wasn't until the slip slid under our door that we knew and had to call to confirm that it was right. We NEVER received another slip and had to purchase breakfast elsewhere. No information was volunteered and it felt like not everyone was on the same page. Showers scalded you when surrounding rooms flushed toilets. Room was dated on the 11th floor. The television had constant reception issues and many channels unwatchable. High expectations quickly dwindled and happy that I did not have to spend much time in my room. High $$ for what we received. Offer sloppy service, drop your price.

Reviews.Title: “Great room! Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: azmove
Reviews.Content: Just returned with family..hotel exceeded expectations and reviews. Spacious room with king bed and queen sofa bed. Awesome location close to square and easy access to Bart, muni, cable cars..we had two rooms with toddler in each room. Convenient microwave, fridge and plenty of coffee! No internet charge! Great buy through Expedia! Really happy with decision to stay here with children rather than St.Francis ..

Reviews.Title: “Outside noise”
Reviews.Author: spunksmunks
Reviews.Content: The Donatello Hotel is a wonderful spot. Very comfortable room, great service, wonderful front desk staff. However, the noise at night from the nightclub across the street is problematic. Even worse are the protesters who shout through bullhorns, starting at 7 a.m. This is a chronic problem as they are picketing a nearby hotel, and have been doing so for a very long time. I suggest checking with hotel before making a reservation to see if the picketing is still going on.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cathycnh
Reviews.Content: If you want to sleep. I hate to say anything about the noise because we really liked this hotel. But and it is a big but, the first night we were at the Donatello, it was quite loud and after travelling west, we needed our sleep. We asked the staff to change our room and they did so immediately and the room was just as nice. We really appreciated the quick response. Unfortunately, the next two mornings, in our new quiet room, we were awakened by a woman with a bull horn protesting working (?) conditions. It was not necesarily directed at the Donatello, but it woke us up nonetheless. The room had recently been redecorated and the bed was really comfortable. Other than that, the location of the Donatello could not have been better. Close to the BART and the front desk advised against renting a car and they were correct, we didn't need it other than for one day.The staff was so friendly. We felt like they recognized us very quickly. The restaurant, Zingara's was delicious. I really wanted to eat there more than once, but we weren't always in the vicinity for dinner during our stay. I would stay there again, although I would request a room away from street noise and above floor 9.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right spot!”
Reviews.Author: jbigdude
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was in a perfect spot to walk or ride the Muni to just about anywhere in the city. The hotel staff was very friendly and bent over backward to make sure our stay was enjoyable. If you are planning to rent a car, be aware there is limited parking in the area. The hotel parking is expensive, but the concierge can get you a better deal on the car with parking included. There are some rental agencies that allow you to park in their lots, but you will have to ride the muni from there. The view from my hotel window was not great, but I did not go to stay in the hotel room. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel in all price ranges. If I were going to San Francisco again, however, I think I would rather stay outside of the city and rent a car to explore the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Location! location! location.”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Donatello three times. The location is great. You can walk to Chinatown,Bart station,downtown, and numerous great restaurants. The staff alway are very helpful. You can walk to several car rental places if you want to explore the Bay area..

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel. Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Seventyfour
Reviews.Content: We did not have any special deal, but simply reserved a room on the hotel website. It was not as expensive as I thought it would be for downtown San Francisco and I was pleasantly surprised by the care and attention shown by the entire staff from front desk, to bellman, to housekeeping, and especially the concierge on the Club Level upstairs. Be forewarned that this is part of the Shell Vacations group and we received a phone call at home before we left about sitting in on a sales pitch when we stayed at the hotel. We politely declined. We received the same invitation from the concierge in the lobby when we checked in, but again there was no pressure and we went about our visit with no further contact about this. Also, the hotel is currently renovating some of the rooms. We stayed in one of the un-renovated rooms and could have moved to one that was already done, but we were happy with what we had,so we stayed put. A good experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to the main shopping attractions”
Reviews.Author: ValKC3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent travellers and always select our hotels with great care. We picked the Donatello, because of the great price (booking.com) and location. We actually stayed in a Club Donatello room. Club Donatello was listed as a separate hotel and the rooms were much cheaper than the rooms listed for the Donatello hotel itself but these are just a number of rooms within the hotel. The room itself was extremely spacious, spotless, with numerous mirrors and a large bathroom. It is really close to the main shopping area and yet wasn't noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: R L
Reviews.Content: It's a great place, well-priced place to stay. Room is large by SF standards and well-appointed. Convenient location. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: nancy54058
Reviews.Content: a block from union square. Clean, nicely decorated room, with great roof garden for having a coffee or tea in the afternoon. I highly recommend it - will definitely repeat it as our San Fransisco hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumz_12
Reviews.Content: We went with another couple and had a great time. Great location with trolley access and went to the Warf several times. I got to see a ball game at ATT Park and went to some of the local Irish pubs...lots of fun except my Dodgers lost. I thought the rooms were nice and clean...and trust me for my wife to approve of a hotel is a big thing. You are in the shopping district so my wife was in heaven. Overall a great location and nice hotel. Perfect for a short vaction.

Reviews.Title: “A new family Christmas tradition!”
Reviews.Author: mdemartini
Reviews.Content: Every year at Christmas time my family tries to spend at least a weekend in San Francisco. The last two years we have stayed at the Donatello and it has become part of our family tradition. It is a combination of old world charm and modern conveniences. The location is ideal, within walking distance of charming restaurants, really rowdy bars and, of course, great shopping! We have a two-year old in the family now, and the accommodations were child friendly. We look forward to Christmas 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CanberraMac
Reviews.Content: This stay was at the end of our 3 and a half week holiday in the US, great way to finish our holiday. The Hotel staff were outstanding, extremely helpful in all areas. They made you feel welcome, which was lovely. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced the Marriott, we had no issues with noise. All facets of this stay were outstanding, I would recommend the Hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco. Very close to Union Square and Transport, not to mention walking distance to great shops, eating and entertainment. The distance to China Town and Fishermans Wharf was within easy walking distance. I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “All the basics done great, no frills”
Reviews.Author: dustyelisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is between 3.5-4.0. The location is amazing - Union Square is great and close to everything. I got a room away from the street and could barely hear the street even with the window open. The hotel was very quiet too - I couldn't hear the neighbors at all, the occasional hallway noise was tolerable. The rooms are spacious, the bed is so comfortable. The fold out was so convienant and my friend said it was comfortable. The rooms had microwave, refridge and sink and dishes, etc. That was the best part. The hotel is nice, a bit dated and needs updating as well as a painting in all the rooms. Be aware - the hotel is a timeshare so they will try to get you into a sales pitch. Just be prepared that this is not a Westin or JW Marriott - the staff is friendly but not...polished. Often they didn't have the directions or tips I was looking for, but Yelp was sufficient for my purposes. The parking is $30/night. The restaurant is nice. The burger was so delicious, but the crab cakes were dry. The 15th floor has a club level with gym, sauna, free coffee, and outside deck with smoking area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: mlb58Toronto
Reviews.Content: Sorry for late review but... We stayed at the Donatello in Sept/11. The location is great. Very close to Union Square, the Cable Cars,HOP-on buses and the Munni. An easy walk to some very good shopping and places to eat. We found all the staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Room: very clean good King bed. We got a room near the top floor and did not hear much of the street noise . We will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great service”
Reviews.Author: EuroShiro
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent: right by union square. (Nob Hill is nice but the walk up the hill can be tough for some). Service is excellent: Jesus at the front desk and the concierge staff are extremely helpful. the rooms are big for SF hotels (bigger than the standard rooms at the renaissance stanford court, in my opinion). the rooms are clean as well. we try to stay here whenever we visit SF for events or meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: fionaruadh
Reviews.Content: The location in Union Square is great. The rooms were not what I had expected. It was a hotel room with a microwave and a tiny refrigerator. There wasn't even a corkscrew! I am a timeshare owner, and this is the worst "timeshare" I have visited. The bed was uncomfortable, and, as a result, I woke up with a sore back each day. I was charged for parking when it was not clearly noted anywhere, not even in the Guest Information Book in the room. The staff were not very friendly. Often, I was not greeted. The Happy Hour schedule is confusing. I enjoyed walking around the city, and there is a cable car stop very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: NWOhioGuy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three-night stay here in August. We found the room to be outstanding, the customer service well above par, and the location to be ideal. We will try to stay here again when in the area. We found the lounge an ideal spot to relax in the evening. They featured small jazz acts each night of our stay. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - but beware the 'restaurant'.”
Reviews.Author: danickle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for ten days at the Donatello and really enjoyed the central location, our spacious room and the exceptionally friendly and helpful service. We had a room at the side of the building and it was very quiet and comfortable. However it is a shame that it is not made clear that the Zingari restaurant which is in the heart of the hotel is not actually part of the Donatello. We booked for Thanksgiving dinner and had an appalling meal and evening. If you avoid this you will have a wonderful time at the Donatello

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: foxieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: After spending 25 years working in the financial district, and returning after being gone 10 years, spending a week at the Donatello in the heart of downtown/union square area was fantastic. The location, the room, the amenities, the staff, the bar and the on-site restaurant all played a part in making the week one of the best ever. Since we knew our way around, it was great to be tourists in the #1 city. We walked everywhere, through North Beach, Chinatown, the financial district and the waterfront. Of course the weather was incredible in January, with people sun-bathing in Washington Square on new years day! I just hope we can return soon for another amazing week.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MHMoo
Reviews.Content: Checking in was fuss-free (I booked through hotels.com) and all the staff from the front desk to the bellmen were helpful and friendly. The front desk reception even showed us on a city map areas to visit and areas to avoid (for 3 females travelling alone). The room we got was spacious and well-equipped with a microwave, fridge, coffee-maker, cutlery, crockery and glassware. It even had a large safe in the wardrobe that I could keep all my valuables and more! Location is so convenient - it's a 3-min walk to Union Square - the centre of shopping, transporation etc. We walked almost everywhere and took the trolley from Powell to Hyde and back. Would definitely recommend this hotel to families and guests who value close location to Union Square and convenient transportation. Just a note.........Only thing is if you get a room facing Post Street, it can get fairly noisy as the windows aren't double-glazed.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient, and pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Sudsarama
Reviews.Content: Very good service, pleasant decor, and right near Union Square; easy walking distance to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: peeps225
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious with a couch and coffee table for relaxing. It also included a small fridge, mini sink, microwave, coffee maker utensils and champagne glasses. All of the above came in handy throughout our 4 day stay. Within walking distance of trolley car and other transportation and many great places to eat. The shopping district is also very close by. One tip, if you plan on using the concierge make sure you allow extra time before your planned departure, as it is one person, and every time we went up there was a long line.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating 38 years!”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was a gift for Joan and I and what a wonderful experience we had. Upon arriving they asked us the occasion of our stay to which we told them we were celebrating 38 years of marriage and immediately they sent a bottle of wine to our room to start the celebration! This hotel has a European feel, warm, one block from Union Square, and has a great bar for Happy Hour. WE had two great days there shopping dining and enjoying San Francisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old world beauty, great parking!”
Reviews.Author: WinkyBlinky
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. If you are going shopping or seeing a show in downtown San Francisco & you need parking, this is the place to stay. If you like quiet, smaller, less chain type of place, this is it. They even remember your name if they see you in the elevator. This is not a huge, anonymous place. It is like staying in a bed & breakfast. No one is ever too busy to stop & answer a question. You can walk to all the great downtown shopping or shows. Your car will be safely parked while you stay. If you need it, it is quickly brought out. I have never had the tiniest problem or unhappiness here. I have stayed more than 4 times. Your parking is discounted when you stay here. That is almost worth staying right there!

Reviews.Title: “SF visit”
Reviews.Author: BillySM
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in SF. Close to transport. Staff were excellent and not expensive. Would stay there if visiting SF again

Reviews.Title: “first timers to san francisco”
Reviews.Author: Geoff S
Reviews.Content: mature age couple seeking central location for day trips, easy access bay area & guide hire for a day.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: OurTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: I took my staff out for our annual Christmas party to San Francisco. I own a timeshare there and they are really flexible about booking. I was able to book four one night stays on the same night, and it counts as four of my seven days for the year. The service is great, the rooms are comfortable, and it is quiet. It is also a block from Union Square. It was nice to be able to walk back from Union Square at midnight and not be worried about my safety.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: grandmama30045
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. Great location. Within walkiing distance to catch street cars. HUGE room. Not noisy as we had expected. Windows open at night let in fresh air. Our room was not dated at all. It was boutique stype. Very pleased. We stayed here with our grandson and all of us stayed in the room with a King bed and queen sleeper and still had a lot of room. Great staff Very helpful.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Inver Grove Heights, Minnesota, United States
Reviews.Title: “California Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Diane B
Reviews.Content: Loved S.F. and the hotel was the center point to all sight-seeing and easy to get a ride on the cablle cars. The hotel was very accomodating and friendly...would advise you to stay there. We flew into Los Angeles, rented car and drove up the Pacific Coast (Highway 1). It was breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Convenience!”
Reviews.Author: tscateh
Reviews.Content: Lovely property, great room (big!), loved the rooftop Club area. Convenient location right off Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanGail63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Donatello Hotel for 4 nights, the staff at the front desk were extremely helpful, the hotel itself was very comfortable, comfy beds, good clean rooms & a great price, i would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near Union Sq....

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted at check-in. All questions were answered in full, and we were impressed with the staff's sincere desire to make sure our vacation experience was positive. The staff truly appears to enjoy their jobs. The Donatello is clean, cheerful, comfortable (great restaurant and bar), and near public transportation. Location! Location! Location! The Donatello is in the heart of everything we wanted to see via public transportation, and the staff made sure we knew how to get to everything. We travel often, and we were impressed by this hotel and its staff. We definitely would recommend the Donatello to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Travel - Donatello Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We recently visited San Francisco (November 11 - 16) and stayed at the conveniently located Donatello Hotel on Post Street. It is just two blocks to a cable car stop, walking distant to Market Street and right near the ever bustling Union Square. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bar on the second floor is cozy and friendly with live music in the evening. Go up to the top floor and check out the fitness room - very nice. The restaurant on site, ZINGARI, is wonderful. They have a wine special on Sundays and Mondays. Just ask your server! Let me not neglect the staff. To a person, they are helpful and courteous and made our stay most memorable. San Francisco is a wonderful city and a stay at the Donatello only enhances it!

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello and North Beach-Italian delights”
Reviews.Author: Emmacakes
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Donatello in November was wonderful. The studio like room was spacious, comfortable, and spotless. Housekeeping every day is a nice touch for us timesharers who usually get T/T (towels and trash) at best. The staff is knowlegeable, friendly, and helpful. Our request to change rooms to the quiet back side was honored immediately. At this time, Post and Mason are getting new water lines. It's location near the heart of Union Square is fantastic. We enjoyed the clubhouse lounge and free WIFI. You will not be disappointed. Tips: MUNI passport for transportation, Cafe Bellini-Happy Hour, Colosseo Ristorante-Italian, Liguria Bakery-Foccacia, You's and VIP-Dim Sum and bakery, Macy's basement-Asian and Boudins sourdough, Honey,Honey-crepes,Alcatraz tours-2545 Taylor, Marriott on 4th St.-view, Coit Tower-bus 39 for the view. Happy travels to all!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Donatello from 06 Nov thru 15 Nov, and found it to be outstanding. The staff, from desk to bell captain, helped us in every way they could, being friendly and helpful at all times. The room's colors were somewhat antiquated, and should be upgraded, but did grow on us during the week. The room was larger than most, and nicely laid out, incl the refrigerator and microwave, dishes, etc, which came in quite handily some evenings when we decided to just snack in the room.The concierges did a great job in getting tickets for us to Circus o Lea and several restaurants during the week. We were always pleased with the outcome. The hot tub in the club was outstanding, and we used it and the access to the club nightly. What a way to finish the day.. the only time we were dissatisfied with the hotel was when we order room service,which cost us $60.00 for a pizza, salad, and a bottle of water, Way too expensive. we spent the whole week without a rental car, and found, between walking, tours, and taxi cabs, that we could easily get around the city and its attractions without much added expense. No rental car needed.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JM144
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to review this hotel because I don't want it to be full then next time we want to stay there! We stay in the City often and are forced to try other hotels when the Donatello is full, but this is our favorite. It's so easy to get around from this location and it's easy to bring your car right into the off-street unloading area and then let them park it. The staff are always top rate and the rooms are large and totally comfortable. We love the fact that there are little fridges, microwave and sink with basic kitchen supplies in each room. Also that there are actual glass glasses and real coffee cups. Good bath towels, comfortable beds, robes and now the WiFi is working better (as well as being complimentary). What else can one ask for? Oh yes, and the price is totally reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Brisboy77
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I had read great things on Trip Advisor about this hotel and was really looking forward to checking in. Maybe my expectations were set to high but I really just found it to be like any other 3.5 star hotel. If this is the number 6 ranked hotel in SF, I can only guess that the city has some pretty crumby hotels. The staff were fantastic and went out of their way to help where they could and the people working there are certainly the hotels best asset. The room was so -so, I found it far to warm in the room and turning up the cool air did little to help. The room has a fridge but nothing in it, while I didn't require a fully stocked mini bar, at least some water, even for purchase would have been nice. The 'club' on the top floor which all guests can access is a nice touch, free morning coffee with newspapers and a TV. This is also where the Concierge is located. Another plus side is this hotel still does a turn down service with chocolates, which was quite nostalgic. Although on the last night, turn down will not until almost 8pm, by which time I was getting ready for bed ahead of an early flight the next morning. Hotel location is great, just one block from union square. Easy access to transport and tour buses to get around. Anyway, I didn't have a bad experience at this hotel, and would recommend it to others, I guess in the end from what I had read online, my expectations were just set higher than they ought to have been.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Storeyfi
Reviews.Content: I was having trouble finding a hotel to accommodate 4 people in the Union square area for a reasonable price until I came across the Donatello Hotel. This was a great find and I would stay again. The staff were so helpful and friendly, whatever question we had they would either know the answer or would make phone calls to find out the answer for us. We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The room was Massive, so unexpected for an inner city hotel, we had a huge King bed and the kids had a fold out bed. There was a hot spa and small gym which we used and valet parking. It is right in the heart of San Francisco and walking distance to the cable car on Powell Street and all restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: meirgold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Donatello for one night during October. The room was nice, spacious and clean. We dined at the hotel's Italian restaurant which was not on the cheap side, but worth every cent. The restaurant is run by Italians and the food was delicious ! The hotel is located in the union square area which is convenient for accessing shops and restaurants by foot. One word of advice: there is no free parking around the hotel. There is a valet parking at the hotel which costs 30$ per day. Take this into account when booking as hotel prices around this area aren't cheap. All in all, it was a good stay and I would recommend this hotel to people wanting to stay around union square. In my next visit to SF I will probably consider a cheaper place outside the town center, providing I have a rented vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Pros: Outstanding room, quiet and clean ! best value for money ! Excellent staff with a smile that is ready to help and answer your questions 24/7 Location - 5 minutes walk to Union Square Cons (I really tried to find some): Shower handle takes time to get used to It's not the hotel's fault, but SFO, is not very safe for walking at nights (from 7PM)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: GMH49
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite which was fantastic.We were very touched by the hotel giving us a complimentary champagne on arrival. Our daughter had tried to arrange this for us and to pay for it but Chris Magsakay corresponded with her through email and said that he would arrange it at no cost to her. We were very impressed by his service and also all other hotel staff. The hotel is in a great location and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathy E
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Nike Women's Marathon and this hotel was only one block away. The rooms and service were outstanding. I would not recommend the resturant there. We ate there with a promotion from Shell and the service was horrible and the food was over price. Could have had a better meal at the Carl's Jr across the street. Over the place was great just don't go the the Zingari resturant

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: carol k
Reviews.Content: We were there in October. Great location within short walking distance of fine restaurants, shopping (all within a few blocks), close to cable car line. Immaculate rooms. Great amenities. Nice having refrigerator and microwave in room. Good value for price. Used concierge services to book wine tour, reconfirm airline reservations, etc. and were very satisfied. Staff was the highlight - Friendliest staff of anyplace we've ever stayed. Bellboys, maids, even maintenance persons encountered in elevators smiled, wished us a good day, asked if they could do anything for us. Staff took great pride in their duties and seemed to genuinely enjoy their guests.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stopover!”
Reviews.Author: edward w
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Donatello when stopping over in San Francisco after a trip to the US east coast. It was by far the best hotel we stayed at during our almost 5 weeks in the USA. The rooms were large, extremely well appointed and clean. The staff were extremely coureous and went out of their way to assist us whenever possible. The Donatello club lounge is a welcome relaxation venue. As our stay coincided with the Womens' Marathon we were finding it difficult to book a restaurant for dinner and the concierge arranged for our dinner from the restaurant to be served in the club lounge. What service! We can thoroughly recommend the Donatello to any discerning travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff....”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: The location of Donatello could not have been more convenient. A short walk to the touring bus, trolley, stores, and restaurants. The room was clean --but could have used some updating. If you are on the street side, it can be noisy. Put on the AC or fan and the sound muffled. (or get a room off the street side) A very cool room is on the top floor for 'hanging'. It has a TV, fireplace and outdoor patio area. Great way to end an evening! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The pricing is reasonable also. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The City”
Reviews.Author: swadepax
Reviews.Content: Great location in the City. Close to great food, shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Room very comfortable. There was a refrigerator in the room. Since I had to be in SF for a week, that kept my costs down. The front door is just down Mason from Post. If you are coming in on Amtrak bus or BART, that means it's bit of a hoof five blocks up Powell, so you will get a workout. Great restaurants. Tad's Steak House has good food for reasonable prices. King of Thai noodle house is also very good. A block from Union Square and its shopping. There is a club outside the side of the hotel where my room was, so the street was noisy. Not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Value and comfort”
Reviews.Author: 77Tom77
Reviews.Content: Had an opportunity to stay at The Donatello while on a pleasure trip to San Francisco recently. The accommodations were excellent and the hotel personnel were professional and courteous. This "boutique hotel" in the heart of the city is perfect for both the "weekend get-away" or, an extended business or vacation trip. The service was excellent and everyone was more than helpful in making the stay a pleasant one. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit San Francisco and will certainly stay there again myself. Of particular note is the artwork in the hotel lobby. Thank you everyone at the Donatello!

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Cindykincaid
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to San Francisco in a year. Both times we stayed at The Donatello. We liked the fact that it is a fairly small hotel. We love the large, well laid rooms. We love the staff; they are always so anxious to please and take care of their guests. We had no problem with the sound quality in the room because we always travel with our noise machines and ear plugs. The hotel is very conveniently located in Union Square. If you are there on Wed or Thurs, go to Le Colonial Restaurant on Cosmo Alley...just a short walk away for some of the best live music in the city. The Cosmo Cats play on Wed night. The Martini Brothers play on Thurs night (think big band playing swing with a cool singer). Local people show up to dance and it is entertainment to watch them. Le Colonial was our highlight of our trip. Also, if you are a tourist, take the Hop On Hop Bus to see the city. A cheap way to do it and you will see ALL parts of the city this way. Also, check out happy hour at the restaurant in The Donatello; great drink prices and 1/2 price appetizers. The ravoli is wonderful; we dreamed about it until we get get back this year to eat it again. The lounge also has jazz. You should really enjoy The Donatello...we love it.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: travelbuttons
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello for three nights earlier this year. The location was great, right near union square. The room was large and clean, kitchenette was handy. Excellent tourist information was provided by the hotel. Restaurant within hotel was also lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Niiiice.”
Reviews.Author: sm8ckd0wn1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here so that I could attend a work function in the city. From the moment my colleague and I entered the parking lot, we were greeted in a nice enough manner by friendly staff. The parking attendant helped us unload our car and we were greeted by the front desk clerk. Very professional staff! The hotel, itself, if nice and looks like it was remodeled within the last 3-5 years. We didn't get a chance to check out the restaurant. My room was bigger than other City hotel rooms that I've stayed at. Considering the price was relatively low, I was very pleased with the size of the room which was also very clean. If I ever have to attend another work function in the City, I will definitely be coming back to the Donatello!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: Erik W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights in early October to re-discover San Francisco after 15 years. The location was perfect for getting around by cable car; just one block from the Powell-Mason/Hyde lines. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Noise on the 8th floor facing another hotel did not bother us; normal city noise that quieted by 11:00 pm. Staff was very friendly and helpful when needed; we were never bothered by anyone offering a membership in their vacation club. Took a peek at the exercise room but did not use it; no early or late hours. Used the upstairs lounge one morning only for coffee. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 6th stay at this property.”
Reviews.Author: mexicoamigo
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th visit to this property and will stay here again the next time we are in SFO. Rooms could use an upgrade, but still comfortable. Staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Rated #6? HOW COULD THAT BE???”
Reviews.Author: Denverfolks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in October. I really do not understand the high ratings and even did some research on how/if people scam TripAdvisor because it is unlikely this hotel would even be rated #60 let alone 6. The staff is friendly and courteous. Before you leave the registration area, someone from Shell Vacations is trying to recruit you for a 90- minute presentation. We asked for a quiet room (having read the reviews) and were assured we had a great room. When we got to our room (6th floor), it was right across from the elevator. There was a gap at the bottom of the door of about 1 1/2" and as a group walked to the elevator, it was as if they were standing in our room conversing with us. I called the front desk and asked for a different room. We were given a terrace room (5th floor) and it was hot and stuffy. We turned the air conditioning on and went out for about 2 hours. We returned and it was still hot and stuffy as the air conditioning did not work. We called the front desk again, and they offered us a bottle of wine for our inconvenience, which we refused and requested a room that was air conditioned. I believe they knew the air did not work and were hoping to get by without us mentioning it. 9th floor, handicapped room - (kind of). There were bars by the toilet and in the bathtub but most things had not been made accessible. The room had an old IKEA feel to it. The safe did not work. The jar filled with creamer packets for the coffee were so old, they were "crunchy". The noise from the outside - day and night - was ridiculous. The interior noise was also disturbing. You could hear every flush of the toilet, every shower run, every door open and close. If you are a business traveler, wifi is sketchy. No desk area in the room. Not good lighting for reading or working. There is nowhere to have a meeting (lounge area small and kind of dumpy). The business area consists of a small closet-sized room with a computer and a printer and one chair. The fitness area is extremely small; the hottub in a small. small area and seats maybe 4 comfortably. The location is great for getting around, but pay the extra money and stay at one of the other hotels in the area. We looked at the J.W. Marriot and the Kimpton boutique hotel (both on the same street) and wish we had stayed at either of those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: L0uL0uD
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisors reviewers were spot on again when picking this hotel. Stayed for 3 nights in September and was very happy with all our requirements. The room was really spacious even had a little kitchenette and a 2 seater lounge. The staff were polite and courteous. The lady in concierge was fantastic, advising on restaurants and public transport. It was 2 blocks away from Union Square and cable cars stations. We didnt experience any loud noise levels and the rooms have opening windows. The restaurant was nice but to small with the singer. They placed our party of 6 right next to the piano which made it very difficult to have a conversation, as soon as we had finished our main meals they cleared our plates and put the bill on the table!! We must have been to loud for the singer.. We experienced the homeless beggars thru out our trip so we had just learnt to keep walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient, we came in by BART and it was a short walk. The room was big and nicely appointed. The staff very friendly and helpful. The Restaurant was excellent, with a good singer and piano providing live entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sunholiday2009
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, spacious and clean rooms. The exercise facility is very small with 3 aerobic machines and it opens at 0700 which is late if you are on business. Lounge on the club floor has coffee all day but also opens at 0700. Would recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights - clean and quiet except for Sat night - there is a nightclub near which even on our 8th floor room was very loud. Apart from that I cannot fault the hotel - it is close to Union square and the Market cable car for sightseeing and the staff were very helpful. Watch out for beggers everywhere in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody Knows Your Name! Cheers!”
Reviews.Author: KLBill
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay at this gem for 4 nights the last week of September! We had to reschedule our Spring trip and Chris Magsakay, the Assistant Guest Services Manager, made sure we had comparable rates and a great room when we arrived. I love a hotel where they treat you like family- greeting you by name, remembering your requests, providing top notch service, ensuring that your wish is their command! Our room was immaculate- with a comfy, cozy bed- and spacious to boot! My only recommendation would be to update the bathrooms- which would put this destination over the top! Carlos, the Bellman, was always equipped with a smile and could answer ANY question you posed. I loved that parking was included in our rate! We were a block away from Union Square- and walked EVERYWHERE- discovering fabulous, affordable restaurants nearby. The free WIFI worked like a charm- and any glitches were quickly solved by Bobby at the front desk. We took advantage of the complimentary coffee in the Club Room on the top floor every morning and evening! We will definitely be back and have spread the word of this treasure to all of our friends!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Rm0425
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Donatello for 3 nights in mid October 2011. The location was wonderful - very centrally located which was great since we did not rent a car while staying in the city. We used the concierge service many times during our stay for restaurant recommendations and information on public transportation and they were extremely helpful! We also found the check in staff to be very helpful, happy and efficient! The room was very large, especially given its central location. I would agree that the decor leaves something to be desired, but that doesnt bother us - the room was kept very clean during our stay which is much more important to us! After reading several tripadvisor reviews, we asked for a quiet room at check in and had no issues with noise. We will be back if we ever return to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility between two worlds”
Reviews.Author: Frurby
Reviews.Content: Donatello is a first class hotel/ timeshare facility 1 block from Union Square, the heart of downtown San francisco tourist area, but a block in the other direction from the Tenderloin District the heart of the homeless/prostitute/drug addict district. Both areas have their own personality. Hotel itself is very well maintained and rooftop lounge terrace is an added bonus. Staff is very willing to help and there are what seem like an unlimited number of good restaurant choices within walking distance. Try the cornflake covered french toast for breakfast at Max's in the square at Maison and Geary or if your budget is lower Jack in the Box across the street has 2 eggs, bacon, home fries and toast for $2.99. For best overview of San Francisco try drinks(or breakfast, lunch or dinner) at the 36th floor Grandview Lounge at the Hyatt. The best way to travel San Francisco is public transportation muni. It is about 45 minutes from one end to the other and covers all major tourist attractions. An unlimited 7 day pass is $27. It includes the cable car which is fun attraction once but not a regular mode of transportation as lineups are 30-40 minutes most of the day. One final hint, book a limo to and from airport rather than a taxi. It is about $5 cheaper and a lot more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bongo_Craigy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, staff were very helpful and efficient - just what's needed after a long flight. The room was very nice and spacious. The central location near Union Square was brilliant for our sight-seeing and much nicer and more "authentic" than Fisherman's Wharf. The concierge service was very helpful. The only downside to this hotel was the noise - the windows didn't appear to seal properly and the hotel is positioned across from a noisy club where you can hear people queuing and leaving the club, and the staff clearing up and throwing out glass bottles. Try and get a high up room if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello: comfortable place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: moespook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for 3 nights 2nd week of October. As has been stated in numerous reviews this is a nice hotel near Union Square. Lots of good restaurants in the neighbourhood, but we especially recommend having dinner at Zingari's. We really enjoyed our meal; service excellent and a lovely winelist! The streetnoise didn't bother us, but our room was not at the front (Post Street side), but we're easy sleepers. Staff was helpful; all in all we really enjoyed our stay there and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service not the best”
Reviews.Author: Bobalucchi
Reviews.Content: After much research we decided to stay at the Donatello. The good.... - big rooms - great location The bad.... - A/C unit did not work. Had been down for 3 days - water pressure is shower measured slightly above a drip - staff didn't know what was going on with A/C unit. Kept promising an "engineer" would be up to fix it. No one ever showed up. We left hotel after one night and moved into Marriott Union Square. Besides the price, Marriott much better hotel and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: annieandnick
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient and we were able to get into our room early. This was great after a long flight from NZ. (Guests before us had been told to wait till 3 so not sure why we were so fortunate) The room was spacious and comfortable. We ate at Zingari Ristorante and so glad we did. The food was to die for. And the service was great. Was worth a trip to San Francisco just for that meal.

Reviews.Title: “loved it.Would come back again.”
Reviews.Author: jude105
Reviews.Content: The Donatello Hotel is right in the centre of everything.It has a great restauant(Italian)and the food is very good.The staff are very professional but friendly and helpful.The rooms are very large and spotless.There is some traffic noise as you would expect being in the middle of a city.All in all for a city hotel it was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Beach710
Reviews.Content: I chose the Donatello Hotel due to the high rating on Trip Advisor. After staying there, I think one of the reasons it is so highly rated is because the management actively solicits people to write reviews. That being said, The Donatello is a nice hotel priced well for the location however I also found the noise issue that is mentioned in other reviews quite bothersome. I felt like I was trying to sleep inside a club. I could hear music and yelling and almost make out the words to the songs. In the morning I could hear the recycle trucks dumping the glass and I was on the 10 floor. One solution is to turn on the air or heat and let the fan noise drown out the noise. (It took me several days to learn this.) The good things about the Donatello, the location, the room is well equipped, the bed is comfortable and the TV has tons of movie channels when you can’t sleep due to the noise. Also it should be noted the front desk staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for exploring downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: quiltingcanuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is superb - a few blocks from Union Square and the major shopping areas. Close to the BART, the street and cable cars. The property itself is very nice and the staff are professional, friendly and helpful. Our rooms were comfortably laid out and decorated. Everything was spotlessly clean and up to date - wireless for the computer, great big flat screen tv. In addition to the usual bar fridge there was a microwave and dishes so that you could dine in your room if you wished. While there is a restaurant on the main floor there is not a breakfast service at the hotel. This isn't a problem as there are many many restaurants, diners and coffee shops mere steps from the hotel. There is also a lounge on the top floor with coffee and newspapers - and a nice view over the city. Many reviews of this hotel comment on noise. Folks - you are smack in the heart of a major city. There is going to be traffic noise. And since a city of this size does much of its servicing at night the garbage and recycling is going to happen in the wee small hours. We noticed no noise from withing the hotel - no elevators, people talking or doors slamming. With the windows closed and the A/C fan circulating it is just background. But - you are going to hear the city. The valet service was excellent and the doorman can whistle you up a cab very quickly. The BART is handy by, but downhill - something to remember if you are towing a lot of luggage. It will be a bit of a climb up from the station. All in all a great hotel to use as a base to enjoy the many wonderful attractions of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ask for a higher floor, though”
Reviews.Author: tnarladni
Reviews.Content: I love that the room was very large, enough room for our toddler to run around without all of us bumping into each other. The king size bed was very comfortable, though the first night, I thought it had an odd smell. Didn't happen again though. The air conditioning did not cool the room at all. Instead we opened the windows which was fantastic until 3 o'clock in the morning when the garbage trucks were rumbling down the road. Next time, I would definitely ask for a much higher floor (we were on 7 but really it's only 3rd because the first 6 were parking). What I found really helpful was to draw the black-out curtains, it dampen the noise a great deal. The location is fantastic to a lot of great eating places, the BART, trolley, etc. All in all, I liked this hotel very much and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lgt190
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only 1 block from Union Square and from the cable car line. Most tour buses pick up at Union Square if they do not pick you up at the hotel. Several restaurants within easy walking distance. Hotel is scheduled for a renovation in the winter 2011-2012. Good property to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: We revisited San Francisco early in September after 30+ years since our first visit and were more than pleased with The Donatello. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable and the location could not have been better being a block off Powell St. at Union Square and the Cable Cars. By the way, be sure to enjoy a sumptuous dinner in the fabulous Zingari restaurant after a full day of sightseeing. What truly made The Donatello spectacular was the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful as they all made our stay wonderful. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location in SF”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during our trip down the coast. We liked this hotel because of it's location. We were only a few blocks away from a subway stop, which made getting around the city much easier. The staff was very friendly and helpful, offering tips for getting around the city. They were also quick to provide maps and directions. The valet parking was pricy, but that is to be expected in San Francisco. We were concerned about the number of tripadvisor reviewers complaining about the noise. In our three nights at the Donatello, we did not wake up to any noise from the street. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sussan_au
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our 6 week vacation here and we were greeted by very pleasant staff after a long flight from Australia. On first impressions walking into the hotel lobby was very good. Front desk staff always willing to assist us in anything we required. Our room was very clean,bright,and spacious, and the coffee machine,fridge,and microwave were a great added feature. Short walk to all forms of public transport. If we went to San Francisco again we would definatley stay at The Donatello Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel convenient for the centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RJ_70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in September 2011. The reception staff were welcoming and helpful. The room had plenty of space, was well equipped and the beds were really comfortable. The location is ideal for exploring San Francisco - just minutes away from the main streetcar and cable car lines to get to the main tourist destinations. The hotel is in a busy city centre area, so there was some noise at night, but once we'd adjuste to the change in time zones, this didn't keep us awake. We would definitely stay here again if returning to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Donatello Hotel, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Marian B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to Union Square, and loads of restaurants and eateries. Very central. The hotel has loads of character and is well appointed. Staff is fabulous and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVacation29
Reviews.Content: I find it tough to decide where to stay in a new city, especially when we look for someplace reasonably priced. The Donatello was a perfect choice. Our corner room was large and clean. The location is great. Loved the club floor terrace and beverages. Very nice to have a refrigerator and a safe. We did not use the dvd player or microwave, but had those too. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. We were on the 10th floor and the street noise was loud at night. It’s a big city. There is going to be street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Peggy W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend 3 days in San Franciso before we drove to Napa. We decided to stay at the Donatello and we are glad we did. Jesus at the front desk was wonderful checking us in. We had called a 2 weeks before and talked with Jesus explain that we didn't want the side where it was noisey so he got us a very good room. we did hear alot of noice our room was always cleaned. We would come back again Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “A lovely respite in the city”
Reviews.Author: Joan R
Reviews.Content: We stayed again at the Donatello and as always were thrilled with many things: the location is great, the rooms are large and comfortable, the bed very comfortable, parking is easy, the price is terrific, and the most outstanding part is the staff, who always makes us feel like returning honored guests. We have recommended it to friends and they all agree "this is one great find in San Francisco".

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: do-it-in-ky
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. My last trip I stayed across the street at the JW Marriot. Location is great for getting around Union Square. The only complaint I have was the gas line in front of the Hotel broke and I couldn't get back into my room for a couple of hours(the whole block was closed down) but I can't blame the Hotel for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lise-Anne P
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Right in the middle of San Francisco away from the touristy wharf area. Great price, clean rooms. Comfy beds. Maid service turns down you bed at night. All of the staff was extremely friendly and happy to assist you with whatever you needed, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: marge106
