Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Staff friendly. We arrived early and the staff had our room ready when we arrived at 11:00am. We had a corner room on a high floor, which had loads of light streaming in. Did not hear much noice from the street. Room has great amenities with coffee maker, micowave oven, sink, dishes, silverware, wine and regular glasses, CD player, large flat screen TV, WI Fi capable. Bed very comfortable. Centrally located hotel, just a few blocks from Union Square and the theatre district.. We ate in the hotel restaurant late in the evening after seeing a play. Had a great Califlower soup and wonderful salad. This is a time share hotel but you do not have to be timeshare member to stay here. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Clean and Comfy, Friendly helpful staff, Great value!”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyGray
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is so conveniently placed, close to Union Square, one block from the Cable Car line, plenty of restaurants, cafes and shopping nearby too. Morton's The Steakhouse across the street, Starbucks well represented too ;) Get in line early for the cable car (or expect to wait at least a half hour), it's very popular! The Hotel itself was really lovely, beautiful decor, clean and comfy rooms, kitchenette with crockery and cutlery, microwave and fridge, coffee maker. Internet was a bit of an issue for my iPad, but the business centre was adequate to update friends and family on our whereabouts. Overall, a beaut place to stay, friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfy rooms (I love king pillow top beds!) and awesome location!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tfu555
Reviews.Content: It was very regular hotel, was surprised it was ranked #6 in SF.... staff was great but otherwise very average hotel

Reviews.Title: “Only one night at the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: linda_ski
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our one night anniversary celebration at The Donatello Hotel in San Francisco, CA. The staff were outstanding and addressed all our needs. When we checked in I mentioned we were celebrating and the clerk never skipped a beat asking if we wished white, red or champagne sent to our room! (nice touch=) The room was very clean, comfortable and bright. There was a bit of an issue with the phone system. Their follow up email said the renovation completion in Feb, 2012 should remedy the issue. The hotel is centrally located so we walked every where. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the pictures”
Reviews.Author: szkut
Reviews.Content: We booked here for location and price. We had no expectations, but surprisingly came up much better than you see in the pictures. IT was clean and spacious inside. The small spa in the club level was great although the gym is very dated and badly needs an upgrade. For a well priced base in San Fran Donatello was a great choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: iris m
Reviews.Content: Quite recently, I stayed at the Donatello in SFO for 3 nights. Large, spacious room, with a microwave and coffee maker. Great location in Union Square. Outside noise is noticable but, the hotel is not in the suburbs and is to be expected. Had a problem with the AC the first night, called the front desk and it was dealt with immediately and to my satisfaction. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: Epage3
Reviews.Content: Right on union square, great hotel lovely rooms. Complimentary tea, coffee and hot choc is lovely touch. Rooms with dressing gowns as well as great sized towels. It was a little bit noisy but kind of expected as so central. Service was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, huge rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: LindseyTX
Reviews.Content: The service and friendliness of the employees here really stands out. The rooms are really big and the location can't be beat. The only thing this hotel needs is a makeover. The decor is a bit dated, but other than that we really enjoyed our stay. The happy hour at the hotel bar is awesome, and so are the bartenders!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithoutChickens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The bed was huge and very comfortable! Great location in a not too hilly area and an easy walk to heaps of shops and restaurants, plus public transport that will take you all the places you'll want to go. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room had all the necessary conveniences and was a little dated but nice and clean. A great find in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, really friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: POATraveler
Reviews.Content: A great option in San Francisco. The hotel staff is really helpfull. Rooms are spacious and clean. The only problem regarding my stay was with the wifi connection, it only worked near the door of my room or in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “large room, semi-private terrace”
Reviews.Author: da_jm
Reviews.Content: we recently spent 4 nights here & i would definitely stay here again were i to be in SF. the hotel had everything my family of four needed: space for all of us to fit comfortably, friendly staff, clean accommodations, a central location and a very reasonable rate. the only thing that would have made this hotel perfect would have been wi-fi that actually worked and a pool (my kids love a pool after a long day!). i called ahead of time to ask about the sleeper couch situation as my 12 year old is adult size and i was worried about him on a thin, pullout sleeper. the front desk staff was beyond helpful and assured me that it would not be an issue, that while there were no rollaway cots available, the sleeper couch would be more than adequate in terms of comfort. all i can say is a giant THANK YOU to the front desk staff for telling me the truth -- the pullout couch was actually COMFORTABLE!!! so other than that, the room was a perfect size and seemed large for a city. what i really appreciated was the fact that all of the space was utilized efficiently. there are a few rooms on the 5th floor that have semi-private terraces and we were lucky enough to get one. it was nice to have the extra space. the king size bed was super comfortable and there was plenty of closet/dresser space to unpack. bathroom was in fine condition & the wet bar, microwave & refrigerator were nice to have. the concierge stationed on the top floor at the "club" was knowledgeable and helpful. the "club" was a nice place to unwind and as others have mentioned features a fireplace, couches, outdoor terrace (same as our room on the 5th floor!) and hot drinks. the kids in particular enjoyed riding up to the club to get hot cocoa! fitness room seemed adequate, hot tub is on the small side (seats 3) and i couldn't get the sauna to work in the ladies locker room. all in all, this was a fabulous place for our family & i'd highly recommend it to anyone spending a few nights in SF. we essentially had 3 adults and 1 kid in our room and it was not a tight fit at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: VS0718
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 2 nights. Couldnt have been happier. Very nice and comfortable room and value for money. Close to downtown and t all the shopping centres and lots of restaurants. If you like to walk, it is a about a 30minute walk to to the pier to catch the alcatraz ferry. The staff were all nice. Really the only issue was the wifi kept dropping out for us but that was such a minor thing and everything else was great. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure trip”
Reviews.Author: auburnbarb
Reviews.Content: We are three retired ladies who went to spend a week "doing" San Francisco. The Donatello had everything we needed and more. Our favorite was the spacious and welcoming lounge on the top floor with fresh coffee, a fireplace, big screen TV and newspapers every morning. The central location of the hotel makes getting around on public transit easy and close. We found several great places to eat in the area ( special note to the Honey, Hoeny Cafe, and Sears Fine Foods) There is some street noise even in our room on the 10th floor but it never bothered our sleep at night and we found the nightclub across the street provided endless entertainment to three old ladies with bunoculars (the dresses are getting lower and shorter all the time and how do they walk on those Shoes?)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for comfort, location, and price”
Reviews.Author: northernstar747
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights while in the city to attend the opera and explore museums.We had chosen the hotel based on information on-line. We couldn't have been more pleased. Our room was large and had abundant closet and drawer space, as well as a sitting area, microwave and refrigerator. The top floor lounge room was stocked with an endless supply of Peets coffee, newspapers, and a terrace. We'll be sure to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It looks like the nearby Hilton, but prices are much lower”
Reviews.Author: aguyfromitaly
Reviews.Content: Last week I spent my last day of my trip in San Fran and I decided to give the Donatello Hotel a go. My requirements was pretty much simpler: - in the town, but not in the downtown or close to the bay area - close to the bart - normally priced I bet the Donatello matched all of my requirements, as in 10 minutes you reach the Bart / Muni or the closest Westfield center. The area is surrounded with a lot of places to eat of have your breakfast, and also you have the Apple center that is easily reachable (just in case) :) What I didn't really like of the hotel, but this is my personal opinion is: - some cracking in the bathroom tiles, - the very noisy airco, which probably is not required during the night as San Fran is quite chilly - the broken ceiling in the cupboard These are all things which really can't ruin your holiday. The hotel room was quite spacious, and surprisingly was having a sofa bed too, that means you can narrow down your staying sharing the room with your mates or comfortable staying with your family. It was including a small "kitchen" area with a fridge and a microwave for you to have a quick snack or continental breakfast. Very nice big LCD tv (not so much complicate in terms of functionality - please buy one with the sleep function) with DVD reader and micro hi-fi. The complimentary wi-fi connection was pretty much a rubbish, this is the only thin I can complain with. Even the ice machine, which seems close to every room 19 of each floor that is noisy, tend to not run so often, so the disturb is limited. The hospitality of the hotel staff was superb; they gave me plenty of suggestions and they have been able to accomodate my requests in full. I do like to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Substitute”
Reviews.Author: resipsaloquitur
Reviews.Content: When I couldn't get a room at the hotel where I usually stay for business in San Francisco (for your evaluation of this evaluation - the Grand Hyatt, Grand Club level) and not wanting to spend a fortune), I tried The Donatello based upon the ratings on Trip Advisor. The favorable recommendations of the TripAdvisor members certainly held true. While the lobby is not very promissing, the room I got was spacious with high quality amenities. I asked for a quiet room and actually got one. The staff was very helpful. The location was walkable to areas of interest and business. There are some very good hole in the wall restaurants nearby. The only negative is the "exercise" room which is small and the equipment is diminimus. However, on the same floor is a lounge area which was very pleasant. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, price in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: 217max
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello during March 2011 spring break with two teenagers. I was a little concerned about whether the room would be large enough, but it was just fine. Everyone had plenty of storage space for luggage and lounging during a very rainy afternoon. The mini-kitchenette space was very efficient. The service was delightful across the board. All staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. We ate in the Zingari restaurant in the hotel one night to avoid ging out in a heavy rain and were very happy with the food, price and service. All around a great San Francisco experience in a central location at a very reasonable price. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ace hotel in A1 location”
Reviews.Author: Joseph L
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated.Public transport nearby and great shops/eateries surround you. Spottless quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: jsislian
Reviews.Content: Service! Service!! This resort was absolutely fantastic! The entire staff was friendly and so accommodating - in true San Francisco style! When we return to the city, The Donatello is where we will go to feel truly pampered and welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kim1986
Reviews.Content: We lived The Donatello! The service was fantastic and welcoming. Location was great with an awesome coffee shop close by ( diagonally across road to the left). Rooms were great and cozy. Club floor was also a good relaxing area. We received complimentary wine & chocolates for my birthday from the hotel which was a nice touch. Would stay here again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “This Friendly&Well Appointed HotelI put in my Top 10 after 44 years ofTraveling the World!”
Reviews.Author: focustiltpanzoom
Reviews.Content: From Check-In to Check-Out this Centrally located SanFranHotel was 100% Up to Speed for friendly service. Aside from No HD Signal &No MSNBC on the New Tv's,my Room 511 was As Excellent as I've Experienced in all my 44 years of World Travel....

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home but with a Fabulous View”
Reviews.Author: Jan M
Reviews.Content: We chose the Donatello from reviews on Trip Advisor and we were thrilled to be staying in this gem! The room was actually a mini apartment so we were able to go to the store, buy some groceries and make snacks but we were still were close enough to public transportation if we wanted to go out. Because it is so centrally located, we were able to walk everywhere including Fisherman's Pier and the Coit Tower. The rooftop provided us with an intimate setting for a glass of wine, late night coffee and a spectacular view of the city of San Fran. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating and cordial. On our last night they were more than happy to hold our luggage while we had dinner at a restaurant the concierge had recommended. It was a perfect end to our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room; Central Location”
Reviews.Author: clpb
Reviews.Content: A dear long-term friend and I needed to get away and chose this lovely central hotel close to public transportation and easy walking distance to everything that interested us. Hotel staff courteous and loved the "Happy Hour" at the restaurant on site.

Reviews.Title: “Summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: Teresa B
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly, the rooms were big, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, close to shopping, great restaurants and transit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rgbiii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Donatello for 6 nights in early September. The rooms are large, bright, and airy. Our first room, on the tenth floor, faced the street and was rather noisy at night, so after two days we asked for a quieter room and were switched to one on the eighth floor at the back. It was much quieter there. The service at this hotel is excellent. The staff at the front desk, the concierge, and the housekeepers were all friendly and accommodating. We had numerous special requests (flatter pillows, new telephone book, extra towels), and these were all taken care of efficiently. Any deficiencies? Well, the restaurant on site (Zingari) isn't open for breakfast, but there are numerous nearby restaurants that are (Try Lori's or Sears). The one dinner we did take at Zingari was unsatisfactory because of (1) live music too loud for conversation (2) over-priced entrees (3) unctuous waiter arriving at the table with a bottle of San Pellegrino water, opening and pouring it at the same time as asking if we wanted some. On the bill there was an $8 charge for this! Aside from the restaurant, this is an excellent hotel, well situated to see the sights, and the staff are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: colmariew
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Donatello and had a great experience. Staff was super friendly and the location was amazing. They also provided excellent dinner recommendations and were very accommodating with all of our requests. Next time I'm in San Fran, I will certainly be visiting The Donatello again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but loud at night”
Reviews.Author: todhal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location of this hotel. We were able to walk to most destinations within 30 min. There were several dining options of all prices ranges within 10-15 minutes walk. The staff were polite, but generally nothing exceptional. Our room was a good size and clean. It was well maintained during our stay. Most nights we were there however, we were awoken by the trash collection between 2-3 am. This noise would carry on for quite a few minutes, enough to wake you up to an alert state. Maybe better windows would be an idea.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: Phil F
Reviews.Content: We liked the location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The club room was nice and the robes were a welcome touch. Our room was showing some signs of wear and there seemed to be an odd disconnect between the front desk and the bellmen - kind of like they didn't talk to each other or acknowledge the other was there. Tip: There are occasionally free concerts in Union Square. Check visitunionsquaresf.com for the schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Convention at Moscone - worked well - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: GatorEric
Reviews.Content: The room was impeccably clean. The staff was friendly -- front desk, bell, housekeeping. The walk to the Moscone Center was quick and easy. My room was facing Post street, 7th floor. There was some street noise, but I found it comparable to what I've experienced in many other urban hotels. The noise didn't disturb my sleep. Others have commented on the poor quality of Internet service; I had the same problem. It was highly intermittent. Worked at times, failed miserably at others. Fortunately, I had excellent Internet service at my conference so this wasn't a huge problem for me. I would seriously consider staying at the Donatello Hotel for another meeting at the Moscone.

Reviews.Title: “What great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KerryS65
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Donatello several times now while bringing several friends and family into San Francisco for a visit. They have always been extremely friendly, courteous and very accommodating. I really appreciate their extra feature of holding our bags either prior to check-in or after check-out. We can have extra time sight seeing without the cumbersome tote of baggage. The hotel itself is located centrally right off Union Square and within a short walk to shopping, restaurants, and any transportation. I look forward to my next trip and will always stay at the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Price but You Pay for What You Get”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNerdboy
Reviews.Content: The valet parking and check-in process was easy and the people were friendly. The lobby is nice, though not as nice as the Kimpton or JW Marriott next door. The rooms are in serious need of updating. The room still smelled like smoke from however long ago it was a smoking room. The decor is outdated and worn. The maintenance staff appeared to do their best to keep things clean, but the tub needed to be sandblasted or replaced. The bed was comfortable and I had a pretty good night's rest, waking only when the big vehicles started moving about outside (not the hotel's fault of course). The location was pretty good for us. We were there to see a couple baseball games. The hotel was easy walking distance to the Powell/Market Muni station. I got this room at a special price, so I can't complain too much. The full price is still cheaper than the other hotels around. So the overall value is good. But if you want a four-star hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL/GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine W
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice even when we called for the first couples of time to ask questions and make reservations. The rooms were very large with a terrific floor plan..separate dressing area with long mirror and mirror above small vanity plus the large bathroom so more than one could get ready at a time. The lobby was conveniently located to the hotel valet parking and to the street making easy access to all forms of transportation. Very clean as well!

Reviews.Title: “New home in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: IrishLouise
Reviews.Content: Before we got there, the location was what we were happeiest about - it is excellently located for Union Square & shopping etc. Rooms were great with plenty of additional facilities (fridge,microwave), the bed was really comfortable and the staff were very helpful. We have found a new home in San Francisco & will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: YvonneWR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of July and were very happy. The room was spacious and comfortable with fridge, microwave and a few dishes. It was very clean, comfortable bed, all the staff were friendly and helpful and the concierges gave excellent advice. The location a block from Union square is great, the views from the rooftop lounge fabulous and overall it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for good price.”
Reviews.Author: jane f
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is in a great location, one block from Union Square, with easy access to all the main sights and attractions. Our room was large and comfortable and catered well for all our needs. We particularly enjoyed the guest lounge on the top floor - it was nice to have somewhere to relax outside of our room and we appreciated that complimentary hot drinks were available there throughout the day. The staff were always friendly and helpful and our booking was dealt with very efficiently. If we are ever fortunate enough to return to San Francisco, we would definitely return to the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: janineor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Donatello and enjoyed our time very much. The bed was extremely comfortable but the street noise (especially the sirens) was a concern even though we requested a room on the quieter side. Some of the problem was jet-lag which kept us up anyway but as we always travel with earplugs it wasn't too much of a problem. The kitchenette was great and we got some cereal and milk from the nearby Walgreens for a simple breakfast on the mornings we had to leave early for tours. The main advantage of the hotel is the central location as it is easy to walk to most of the tourist sights and the BART is very close although most of the time the public transport was full so we ended up walking. The free wi-fi is frustrating as it is extremely slow. I would definitely recommend the Donatello as it was good value for money and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the city”
Reviews.Author: Newman65
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a good downtown location. Overall, the hotel was clean and safe. Staff was friendly and helpful. We liked it for its central location and easy to get to from the BART. It is an older building but everything works fine. The club floor has free coffee and tea for guests to use and it provides good view of the city. The surrounding area few homeless people but that is just San Francisco. We found most of them were friendly and didn't cause any issues.

Reviews.Title: “We are already planning to return!”
Reviews.Author: Micki O
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was a great choice for us in San Francisco. It is in the heart of everything, near whatever you want to visit. You can easily walk to attractions, great restaurants and shopping or get local transportation for a bargain price. The service was the best we have seen anywhere. Impeccable! Great coffee and views from the top floor guest area/concierge; also very comfortable sitting area there w/ daily newspapers. Rooms are spacious, clean, well appointed w/ mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and wet bar. The lobby houses some beautiful antiques and art work as well as comfortable seating. We can hardly wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas R
Reviews.Content: The location is the best.Powell st. One block Bart close buy everything walking distance.aloha tommy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull time”
Reviews.Author: IrishLass03
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and enjoyed our stay as always!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, little noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: saharact
Reviews.Content: My husband, I, and our two young daughters stayed here for 4 nights. Overall, this hotel was great for us. The rooms are clean and very large, with a pullout sofa and a king bed along with a kitchenette with a fridge, microwave, and sink. The staff was all very helpful and pleasant as well. The only problem we had was that across the street from our room was a club that was incredibly loud and both Friday and Saturday night our daughters woke up frequently from all the noise. Other than the noise, the location was excellent. There isn't a restaurant in the hotel, but there are tons of excellent places in the area. Definitely try Sears for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoW17
Reviews.Content: We had a large,comfortable,well equipped room with a small sink, microwave,basic crockery and cutlery and of course a king size bed. On the top floor there was a gym and a sitting room where tea and coffee was always available.There were car parking facilities competitively priced. Good location,some street noise at night (dustbins are emptied nightly) but that is to be expected if you stay in central San Francisco. Overall this hotel provided good value for money and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Some surprises (both good & and not-so-good).”
Reviews.Author: Jedi-Elvis
Reviews.Content: PRO'S: location! Spacious room, comfy bed, mini-suite (microwave & frig), nice set-up w/ante-room & sofa, clean, complimentary coffee & tea, standard bathroom amenities, STARZ network on TV. Health club (w/sauna), piano bar (daily happy hours), Member's Club (hotel guests permitted), restaurant next door. On site valet. Free wifi. Friendly staff. CONS: could use some updating (nothing major). Hotel address is misleading (entrances on Mason St.) Valet (like other places) is pricey, there are public parking areas close by. Wifi was a tad slow (just whining). Health Club could use a couple more cardio machines. TIPS: prepay for the room & self-park to save some $$$. If driving, note Mason St. entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: m_mckenna76
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is situated one block away from Union Sq. The rooms are well furnished with a kitchenette and lounge area, more like a Jr. Suite. The staff were helpful. On the top floor there is a 'club room' with complementary tea/coffee and excellent views over the city from the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: suegalway
Reviews.Content: We loved the size of the room in the Donatello Hotel and the fact that there was a small kitchen with microwave oven. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is in a great location for getting around San Francisco. We were there for 3 nights and had a great time. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Schmitts
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were slightly low only because we heard the hotel rooms in S.F. could be on the small size. The lobby is nice but unassuming. So we were VERY pleased to walk into our spacious king sized bed hotel room. It is modern but not industrial. Clean and new feeling. Detail taken in all areas including the tile showers. Nice little coffee maker, Wolfgang Puck coffee, little fridge, cups, glasses, silverware, etc. Beds and pillows very comfortable. We are Shell Vacation owners and usually only find comfort in a condo-type room but we were not even slightly disappointed with The Donatello. Walk out of the hotel and we were one street away from everything from cable cars to shopping. We will stay here again, again. This was our first ever trip to S.F. and brought our toddler and loved that we could scoot back to the room for naps. (Well, Fisherman's Wharf is a trek) Highly recommend this place. It definitely earns it rating. p.s. Did not try the hotel's restaurant but we will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Nights”
Reviews.Author: rugirldc73
Reviews.Content: This facility is great - club room on the 15th floor, cozy robes, mini kitchen, and friendly staff. We loved the views from our corner room. However, even though we were on the 9th floor the street noise at night was terrible. The club across the street was open until 4am and people stood on the sidewalk to smoke and talk. One morning the staff at the restaurant across the street began a picket line with a bullhorn at 7am. Possibly better if you request an inside room and get your views from the club floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Donatello Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Donatello in May of this year. We were impressed right from the start by the staff and the appearance of the Hotel. From there, the Donatello just went up in our estimation. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. Our room was great - very spacious and with a well equipped mini kitchen area. At first we were a bit concerned as our room was located right next to the elevators but we never heard a sound. Our bed was a King size bed and very comfortable. The room was clean and also very comfortable. We couldn't fault the Hotel at all. I loved the Rooftop Terrace area as it meant I was able to go up there through the day and have a cigarette (without feeling like a social outcast) and a coffee or cup of tea. There is a separate smoking section on the Rooftop Terrace which is a credit to the Hotel. They are obviously keen to cater for both smokers and non-smokers which I respect. If my husband and I return to San Francisco, we will definitely choose The Donatello Hotel again. It's close the shops in Union Square and we felt very safe and comfortable and enjoyed our stay at The Donatello immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellent Location, Great Staff, Ideal”
Reviews.Author: GW666
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, standard Queen room, check-in went well, very friendly and welcoming, room was very large for a city hotel, clean and had a small sitting area and coffee table, flat screen TV plus DVD player, Microwave, Coffee maker and sink plus cups, plates etc which came in handy during stay. Bathroom was average and a bit dated but it was clean and functional. In room safe and plenty of room for luggage, view from room was alley and a roof top car park. Very quite and heard no noise entire stay. Location was fantastic, central to everything, short walk to union square, macys, cable cars etc, we walked everywhere. Plenty of good places to eat within a block to suit any taste, and may open 24 hours. Room was made up each day (we were out each day but by the time we got back room was always made up), they also provide a nightly turn down service as well. The wifi was pretty bad, and only worked a few times (I overheard a conversation another guest was having with front desk and they were aware of problem and were in process of changing wifi provider), they did have a computer and printer for guests to use in the lobby which worked well and had very fast internet. The hotel has a club room for guests on the top floor which was nice, plenty of room and free coffee/tea etc all day provided, nice place to relax after a busy day and wifi worked well in the club room so we went their when we wanted to connect. Club room had an outdoor patio area with view of the city from 3 sides, lots of lounge chairs to relax on out there, but a bit chilly in San Francisco. Lifts were fine, waited no more than a couple of minutes at any time during stay. We were not leaving until late, so they held our bags while we did some last minute shopping and they allowed us to use the club on the top floor which was a nice area to full in some time before our coach arrived. Overall a great stay, would highly recommend to anyone visting San Francisco, we have stayed at a number of hotels in San francisco over the years, many far more expensive than the Donatello, but none felt so welcoming and comfortable, which made for a very relaxing and pleasant stay. We would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, trendy with tradition, and spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Comesanas
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in San Fran for 4 nights at the Donatello commencing July 23, 2011. We were very happy with the accommodations at the Donatello Hotel, the room was spacious with a separate dressing area, in addition it had a refrig, microwave, dishes, glasses, silverware and coffee maker. Nightly we made use of the gym, jacuzzi and concierge floor where you have a great view of the city. We had a king size bed and the sofa had a queen size bed. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel is only one walking block away from Union Square where shopping capital of San Fran., close to cable cars and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SeymourMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Nice sized room that was very clean. Excellent bed that was very comfortable. Good location for easy exploration of San Francisco. The hotel restaurant was good, but there are also plenty of other good restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key”
Reviews.Author: inzombiac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while on our cross country trip in early June. We stayed for two days in San Francisco and the Donatello just enhanced our overall experience. The hotel is located downtown and it made it a breeze to see everything we wanted to while in San Fran. The room was large, and we had access to their spa which was located on the roof where the deck provided a great view of the city. We were within walking distance of Ghiardelli Chocolates, the Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, and Chinatown. The staff and service was average but we didn't see any overall problems with getting a cab or our questions answered. The only issue I had was with the air conditioning. After walking the streets of San Fran, I would have liked to cool down in my room, but was advised by the staff they would not turn on the AC until the temp reached over a certain limit. Annoying, but not a deal breaker. The hotel has an older feel to it, but we were supplied with slippers and robes for the spa and the overall feel was relaxing and luxuriousness . A good night sleep and great housekeeping service and its location made this a place I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Sweet Spot”
Reviews.Author: footwalker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Donatello in San Francisco for four days in July, 2011. We were VERY pleasantly surprised by both the room and other accommodations such as the Business Center and roof-top exercise and lounge facility. Our room was not only comfortable and quiet, but was equipped with both a mini-fridge and microwave which we found extremely useful for breakfasts (not an easy meal in that area) and snacks. There were plates, glasses and utensils making an in-room meal quite easy. This was especially helpful since my wife was handling some important business during our stay. Of course, The Donatello has a marvelous location just off Union Square with its shops and restaurants, but also a pleasant walk away from SFMOMA, the Ferry Building, and Chinatown. All this at an incredibly reasonable price. So, The Donatello will definitely see us again on our next trip the the magical city by the bay.

Reviews.Title: “A great family experience”
Reviews.Author: Tracey V
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Donatello for 3 nights in July and I couldn't have been more pleased with the rooms, location of the hotel and service. The front desk accommodated all of my requests, booked our car to the airport on our departure date, and overall were extremely friendly. I booked this hotel based on other reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The hotel is well priced for the area and I would book this hotel again on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, service, amenities...thank you for everything!”
Reviews.Author: seasand55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was wonderful! All personnel, from the front desk, to the bellmen, to the concierge, to the valet service, were courteous, helpful, friendly, knowledgeable, and always available to help. It was our first visit to San Francisco so we had questions often about where to visit first or where to eat etc. and they provided great suggestions. Upon our arrival we had champagne in the room and a box of chocolates, which was so thoughtful due to the special nature of our visit. We definitely recommend The Donatello for anyone visiting San Francisco! My husband loved the free coffee & tea in the upstairs lounge. Also, the movies available to borrow. The filtered water at the gym was great for me since I always have my refillable water bottle with me and with all the walking you do there it's a must to have. We fell in love with the city and will definitely come back and stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “Service great, decor unusual!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty7London
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the service here is faultless-SO friendly and helpful. It was my partner's birthday while we were here-I told them and special Donatello chocolates appeared in our room which was a nice touch. Also, which was an even nicer touch, on the second day, which was my boyfriend's actual birthday, I noticed through an open door that the rooms opposite ours had a lovely terrace-I mentioned this to Jesus at reception and he upgraded us as a birthday treat-this really made our holiday! The rooms are odd-they are quite spacious and have a mini kitchenette in a kind of cupboard which is so useful but the decor is odd-blue and orange-who chose that combination? And when? I'm not sure when this would have been in fashion! If this hotel was given a makeover in more modern neutral tones, it would be absolutely amazing...could be number one hotel in SF. They have the fab service, the great location and lots more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Strange decor, Early Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Woodenham
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location just off Union Square so handy to get around. However this did mean that there was a lot of street noise. Room was a fair size, king bed, flat screen tv, safe , plenty of storage space, free wi fi, Sofa. There is a kind of mini kitchen, which included a fridge, sink, microwave, coffee machine and some basic cutlery and plates. This was next to the bed and had a sliding door to seperate one side of it off at anyone time. Decor was blue and orange with green curtains! Bathroom was a fair size, but was in need of a revamp as there were a few cracked and missing tiles. Shower was a bit weak and for 2 days there was no hot water. When we asked why, the reply was a broken boiler but no apology! Would not recommend if you like to have a lie in in the morning as housekeeping started their rounds about 7.30am!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: R0ckytw0
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with super staff! Super clean. Nice club area with good coffee and tea and view. Great lounge and resturant in the hotel. Noisier area being right downtown but it is a trade off. Windows provide good insulation from noise and air conditioning works great. Close to Union square, shopping, theatres and not that long of a walk to the Embarcadero/Fisherman's wharf. Cable car one block away. Lots of wonderful restaurants in all price ranges in the area. I will stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: enrarep
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, well equipped and clean rooms. Free WiFi, but inferior connection.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mosrm
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel with limited amenities. The only place to buy a bottle of water was at the hotel bar and it was 8$. The workout facility is a joke. The rooms are nice size but the bathroom is tiny and the shower didn't work very well. The AC in the room didn't work either. The rooftop lounge was a bit shabby. The location is great if you want to be near Union Square but there are many hotels near Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “G R E A T PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: 50207Traveler200
Reviews.Content: People are friendly, hotel is very clean, great location and we would definitately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two companies - One building, beware. Great Place though”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia9933
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club Donatello for 6 nights in April/May 2011. On arrival we found that our room did not have a kitchenette as we expected when we had booked through Booking.com Reception staff was very helpful and explained that it was only the Donatello Hotel, which makes up the first 7 floors of the same building, that had kitchenettes. Club Donatello occupies the remainder of the building and it does not provide kitchenettes, it only provides a coffee maker and has a small fridge with a mini bar. We were unable to change as the hotel was fully booked and in any case we would not have been able to change as our booking was made through Booking.com. This situation is very unusual and too complex for guests to fully understand at first. So if you want a kitchenette, book the hotel not the club. Both can be booked through Booking.com, otherwise the websites are: For the HOTEL www.shellhospitality.com then click on “select a resort”, then go to “California” under which you will find San Francisco and the three Shell Vacation hospitality hotels, one being “The Donatello” (the Hotel); this is a time share property. For the CLUB www.clubdonatello.org We had a very pleasant stay and although we would prefer to have the kitchenette next time, if the D. Hotel were fully booked, we would not hesitate to stay at the Club D. The room was big, the bed was very comfortable and so was the sofa bed used by our adult son. All was immaculately clean, a pleasure to see the ensemble base encased in a protective zipped liner! Rooms were promptly and well serviced; the building was quiet and very neat; staff was very friendly and helpful in every way. Excellent location and value; couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Nilsson44
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at the Doinatello hotel in San Francisco and I loved every minute of my stay. This hotel is a real treasure, moderate price, very big rooms and a perfect location! Coffe-maker, fridge and microwave made the stay even more positive. I can recommend this hotel and I will chose it again next time I visit SF. Leif Nilsson, Stockholm, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Hotel - the reviews were right”
Reviews.Author: MatLet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello due to the reviews I found in Travel Advisor. What a great place. They do not have any double bed rooms, but it is true the queen size couch is very comfortable. They gave us one of the larger rooms so we had plenty of room to leave the couch open the entire time. The room was very clean and recently updated. The staff were very nice. We really felt at home. The location was also outstanding. You are located in what I would call the high rent district. So no issue with being outside at night. You can walk easily to the trolley cars which are 1 block away at Union Square. I would highly recommend on your first morning you walk to Union Square and go to the half price ticket office. You can purchase play tickets and City Passes there. The City Pass were an amazing deal. The passes get you on all trolley's, underground and buses for 7 days straight and entrance into the Aquarium, Exploritorium, Science Museum, Boat tour of Golden Gate and Alcatraz and the Art Museum. All for $69.00 for adults and $39.00 for children. It was an amazing deal. The Exploritorium was also exceptional as was mentioned in other folks reviews. We had 4 hours there and it was not enough. The kids loved it and so did the adults.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: aask23
Reviews.Content: After spending several days in Yosemite, we drove into San Francisco and spent our last three days at the Donatello. The staff was helpful, friendly, and always willing to give directions or advice when asked. The man that helped us with our bags recommended a nearby restaurant, Fino, for dinner. We lucked into a last minute opening there. Good advice! Overall, we thought the hotel was well located, reasonable priced for a city, with clean pleasant and good sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Couldn't have done better!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineAsha
Reviews.Content: Over the moon with the hotel, staff were friendly and just so helpful. Bellmen, just the best and front office went out of their way to make sure our stay was everything we hoped. Hotel is situated central to everything if we come back certainly will be to this hotel. 10/10 Experience. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Sully
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Donatello after a long trip and were greeted with a wonderful welcome which made us feel instantly comfortable. Staff were really friendly and very helpful. The wine and cheese upon arriving was a great addition. The hotel was clean and well furnished and the room was spacious and very comfortable. Location-wise it was just a block from Union Square which made it very easy to access all areas of the city, including cable car rides. A brilliant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great”
Reviews.Author: hinau
Reviews.Content: We loved it. Well equipped and spacious rooms, attentive staff and handy to the square. Only draw back was the lack of double glazing and the street noise at night. There was a night club across the road and every morning about 4.00am a guy started sorting the glass. Even 10 floors up it was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Next to a bad and noisy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Danny_and_Bronia
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Good rooms. Good locaion..free wifi in the rooms.. However it's next to tenderloin which is the worst area in San fransisco..we slept..we were on a high floor but from 11pm to 4am all you can hear is street noise. From drugged up and homeless people..this did not retract from our stay as you will hear a guy playing his drum for hours however every time he stops he will say "one more time"

Reviews.Title: “We visit often, and will continue to return”
Reviews.Author: Sugardancer
Reviews.Content: Central location Friendly, helpful staff Comfortable, well designed rooms Nice restaurant on site

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Spacious Room, and Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: UrsulaMcCarthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello over the July 4th weekend. We found the staff very helpful and acommodating. The room at this hotel was spacious in relation to your average hotel room. We enjoyed the Pete's Coffee in the morning on the roof deck. The hotel was located a block from Union Square where you will find plenty of designer stores. There are restaurants and pubs about a block away. Be aware however of panhandlers approaching tourists for money. Also a couple of blocks behind the hotel is not a great part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Comortable as usual!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCrankyJoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our 1 and 3 year old stayed over 4th of July at the Donatello. Our stay was comfortable. We used our car quite a bit on this trip and did not have problems at all with the garage. Normally, we use public transportation which is easily accessible. Room service was always prompt. When all the other hotels are charging for internet, gotta love the free wifi in-room.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jimw48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days from June 11. The hotel is perfectly situated, just around the corner from Union Square, a short walk from Market St and Chinatown, but just far enough away from the rougher areas of the city. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable, with a well equipped kitchenette for self-caterers. And my wife loved the bathroom. The service was exceptional, it's hard to think of a fault. The Donatello will be my first choice next time in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwihamilton
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful two night stay in this Hotel and were very impressed with the service offered by all of the very helpful staff. Our room was of good size with a bathroom larger than expected . The location is brillant with good diners and the train station just a five to ten minute walk away. Would defniately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not perfect, but good for the price & location”
Reviews.Author: darew
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in July. The location was very convenient. Close to all public transporation, bus stop & trolly stop on block away (tip...walk down two blocks to O'Farrel street if the Trollys seem full, we got on every time). Honey, Honey Cafe was right around the courner, had great crepes (ate there 3 times). The rooms are exactly liked they are pictured on the website, nice, clean and roomy. Our only complaint was the tempureture of the room. The AC was not working. When we called the staff informed us that the AC does not turn on untill the outside temp reaches 70 degrees (it was in the mid 60's during our trip)....but it was much hotter than that in our room. Two of the windows in our room opened but they did not let in nearly enough air to cool down the room. That was a major disappointment. Also, since the windows were always open in our room it was pretty noisy outside, which normally doesn't bother me since I am a heavy sleeper...however around 5am the garbage trucks woke me up every night for about 20 minutes. (We were on the 8th floor). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Club lodge on the roof was very nice, and I loved the free coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base in SF”
Reviews.Author: PandC_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights so had plenty of opportunity to explore this hotel and the surrounding area. In short, this hotel (is it a timeshare that rents rooms?) offers excellent value relative to others in the Union Square vicinity. As others have mentioned, the club room on the top floor is a very nice retreat with comfy seating indoors and outdoors, newspapers, coffee and Friday evening wine/cheese reception where they tell you what's happening in town that weekend. Also, the lounge downstairs has a good happy hour - $5 for house wines and several cocktails. The location is great for Union Square and everything east and north, however the Tenderloin lies immediately to your west, which is still a dicy place at night. Whenever we needed to walk west (like to the Civic Center), we just went up one block to Sutter across then down Van Ness to avoid the Tenderloin. If traveling on the metro rail, getting off on Powell and heading up Powell street (rather than Mason) was better because of far fewer panhandlers. It's a shame SF hasn't been able to manage the homeless/begging problem better .. we only had one (of dozens) get physically agressive (on Mason St., we just kept walking). Walking to Nob Hill, Chinatown, Pacific Heights is very easy (hills excepted), and points farther away (Waterfront, Telegraph Hill) are also very walkable, so we only needed to use public transportation to get to Golden Gate park. Our room had a microwave, coffee maker and mini-fridge, so we had breakfast in the room, which saves money for other things (it's not a cheap town). But if you can help it, don't buy at the nearby corner markets ... prices are marked WAY up ($14 for a box of cereal and 1/2 g milk). There are larger stores sprinkled througout the city - just stop in when you walk by one. So, by all means, stay at the Donatello. It's the best deal in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: alijoe2001
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better! That's where it ends. My sister-in-law booked a room for 4 of us to share. When we got to our room, there was one bed and a pull out couch (we all know how comfy those are). The AC was broken and we were told the hotel was full we could open our windows. Fine. The noise below from people in the streets as well as the 5 a.m. bottle recycling being tossed into the dumpster were outrageous! We were there for two nights. Before checking out, we asked the desk clerk if there was anything the hotel could do to compensate us for not having AC. Free parking would have been nice (we paid $60.00 to park at the hotel). We were told that the manager was out of town for a week and we should try back later. We checked out of the hotel and realized that our son left his iPod when we were an hour away. We immediately called the hotel only to be told that they couldn't find it and we could try back later. There was no offer for them to call us if they found it. We were off to Yosemite and would be out of touch for 5 days. Upon returning to San Francisco, we called again to see if they had found it. Still nothing. We were also unable to get in contact with the manager at that time. We expected a lot more of this hotel. They did NOT live up to their mission statement, or even make an attempt to. There are plenty of places to stay in the area. Pick a different one. We expected a lot more for $250 per night. Internet connectivity was terrible. We heard another customer complaining about it to the front desk also.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Last February I experienced the Donatello Hotel on a business trip. Rooms are really big and its location makes it ideal to explore the city. It is located right in the heart of theatre district. Its prices are on the plus side too since they are extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better price”
Reviews.Author: smooth1jazz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on the high ratings/ranking (both well-deserved) on this site. Outstanding location in the heart of Union Square, close to great shopping and restaurants, along with easy access to public transportation. The hotel is literally surrounded by much higher-priced but not better-placed hotels. The property is well-maintained and staffed by friendly employees. Rooms are spacious and beds are comfortable. The nice rooftop club lounge offers free Peets coffee all day, and other beverages may be purchased. Wine and cheese party every Friday starting at 4 pm. No pool, but does offer a jacuzzi. Fitness room is a little small, but adequate. Doesn't open until 7 am (a little late for those on east coast time). Didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but it seemed to be quite busy, and we heard good singers entertaining there every night as we returned to the hotel. Enjoyed breakfasts at the nearby Honey Honey Cafe and Crepery (also highly rated by this site). Overall, this hotel is a great value in an expensive city. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious central location for visit”
Reviews.Author: attytravel
Reviews.Content: There are many good posts for this location. A forum post recommended hotelres.com for San Francisco hotel deals and I want to emphasize that here. We got a very good deal from the site when the hotel site said it was fully booked. We had a king room with a sofa bed that was perfect for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Central, decent hotel, great service, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Gla
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, centrally located at Union Square, near to all the stores and also the many ways to get around SF. Great service at check in, great room service, great at helping with one of the windows. Couldn't be more impressed with the staff. Some rooms a little hot, even with air con. Internet really slow, maybe depends on room/floor?

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: lmarieg056
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel on a family vacation and were delighted with our stay. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel staff were very accomodating when my daughter had to spend the night with us at the last minute. There is some street noise at night from nearby club but no more than in any big city. It is centrally located near Union Square and Chinatown. There is a wonderful nearby breakfast place called "Sears Fine Food" where we ended up every morning. The internet connection sometimes is not great but overall the hotel was very good. We will definitely stay here again on our visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda7240
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello in June for two nights based on trip advisor reviews. Location was perfect! Away from the noise, cable car stop one block away (if there was room), nice intimate bar, and room was large with micro/small fridge. Best feature was the Club floor where you could sit outside and get a view of the city. And even better, you can BYOB up there so we enjoyed a bottle of wine we had purchased in Sonoma. Staff was very polite, room was clean. Had breakfast at Cafe LaTaza, a 1/2 block away - wonderful! Also close to Union Square for shopping needs.We would definitely return to The Donatello! (AARP discount available)

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: wal4d
Reviews.Content: an excellent place to stay in the centre of san francisco. this was our first time in SF and we are so glad we took the advice of other tripadvisors. the hotel care be a nightmare to get to if driving yourself - but this is simply because of the one-way system which is a bit like a life-size version of playing Pacman! However once there you will feel it is worth it. spacious and comfortable room with kitchenette. a really lovely lounge area on the top floor with complementary tea and coffee. just a very short walk from union square and the cable cars. no breakfast facility but we highly recommend you walk across the road to Max's for excellent value and quality breakfast and dinner - we tried the chicken pot pie - huge and packed full of delicioud chicken and veg! parking is expensive - thankfully we dropped off the hire car - but typical for the centre of a city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jx2smom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for four nights and were quite happy with this hotel. The hotel room was large and clean with all the amenities we could need. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful; they went above and beyond their necessary duties. I would like to acknowledge Peter, the chief concierge, in particular. He was very helpful to my husband and I. During the wine and cheese reception he provided us with valuable insight and suggestions, again going beyond our expectations. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends and would definitely go back there again if I return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel in perfect downtown location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: hobbob
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. 1 block to cable cars and Union Square, a few blocks to bus stop, and 3 blocks from BART. You do not need a car to get around the city. Rooms are large and comfortable with fridge,microwave,and robes provided in each room. Ed &Jesus at the front desk are the most accommodating employees ever! They will answer any questions, and give you wonderful directions to anywhere in the city. We found a wonderful and reasonable cafe one block away on Post St called the Honey Honey Cafe. We ate our breakfasts there. it was fast and delicious. Wish we would have had lunch too! Buy a MUNI tix at the baggage claim info desk for a 3 or 5 day pass for unlimited use of the buses, cable cars,and street cars ($21-$26 per person). The hotel will give you maps that show all the routes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good value”
Reviews.Author: raddocmed
Reviews.Content: This was a nice find in SF. It is within 1 block of Union Square yet much more affordable than most in the area. It offered all the amenities we wanted. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: 2269vjs
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel due to it's location and I wanted it to be special so paid a bit more money out than I normally would to get a King Bed Suite. The Hotel is in a central location and is close to the tram system, which is great. The reception staff were friendly and helpful when you ask questions, they are knowledgable of the local area and transport tips etc. However, when we checked in, we were not informed the procedure for breakfast and B&B was what I'd booked. I assumed like most hotels that there was a restaurant to go to. In the morning, we got up and couldn't find it so went to reception. We were then informed that there were cards in the rooms which had a limited choice of tick boxes for Breakfast that should have been completed and left on the door handle overnight and then breakfast is brought and eaten in the room. We did manage to get breakfast that morning, but then the hotel added the cost on to our bill, which I had to get refunded. The next day, we completed the card and were then telephoned and informed that some of the items we'd ticked were not included in our B&B price and we ended up with coffee and danish pastries, which is not what I would expect for this hotel. I would therefore choose a cheaper hotel next time because I don't feel we had value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than expectations and Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: WINNMAX
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at hotel for a week June 19-26....Cant stop talking about it.The room was big, clean and had many amenities such as microwave, dishes/utensils and mini refrigerator.. The bed was extra comfy. Most importantly the staff was extraordinary and very friendly and helpful.......bellman, concierge, housekeeping, front desk to name a few. The location was excellent..close to everything...Union Square, shopping, cable car, restaurants, theater. We would definitely recommend this hotel and without a doubt stay there again . Irwin and Maxine Brand

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJeff60
Reviews.Content: My grandson and I spent 4 nights at The Donatello. Everything was superb-the staff was super helpful and friendly. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome and to assure we were having a great visit. The room was large, very clean, and delightfully stocked with such extra touches as plush robes, real glasses, china coffee cups, and so on. Delightfullly luxurious bed and my grandson (13 years old) said the sleeper sofa was comfortable also. Great location too-close to everything including bus, streetcar, and trolley stops. The club level on the top floor was always stocked with delicious coffee/hot chocolate and the concierges went our of their way to help us with our vacation. THANKS, Donatello, for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for our trip”
Reviews.Author: abc078
Reviews.Content: We were two families traveling together, each with young children and this hotel was fantastic. The service was exceptional and the room amenities for families were perfect (sleeper sofa, microwave, refrigerator, etc.). The size was above average for a hotel in the city as well. The price was also very reasonable. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Souzaac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Very well located. A block from Union Square. The room are spaceful, clean and updated. Staff is very kind. There is a good restaurant and a park lot inside the hotel. I would recommend for a friend and I intend back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: adamingley
Reviews.Content: great hotel, location, staff.... what more can i say? our room was amazing and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ProudDad9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Mid June. Union Square is a great location to be based out of while seeing the city. Close to attractions (could walk to Ferry Building) and good options for restaurants. I was a little leary of the hotel but relied on the Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed at all. The room size was very large and had a couch and a chair. King bed was comfy. Nice furnishings, including a fridge, microwave and simple dishware. Free Wi-Fi was included and worked pretty good. Was not a big fan of the color scheme, but it was not as bad in person as appears in the pictures. Price averaged $200/night plus taxes which I though was good for the area. The lobby is small, but we did not really spend any time at the hotel - too busy looking around the city. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel,in a good location almost on UNion Sq”
Reviews.Author: GRAHAM1608
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the hotel,it was just fantastic,room,food,&staff were fantastic. If you visit San Francisco,this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and we can't wait to visit again....”
Reviews.Author: Daphne2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello in the Union Square area of San Francisco. It was wonderful, the hotel was great, exactly what we needed. The staff was incredibly helpful and always pleasant. The room and bathroom and the rest of the hotel was A+ when it comes to cleanliness and the upstairs "Clubhouse" was great. Each night after a long day out exploring and walking the lovely San Francisco hills we would head up stairs to the clubhouse where we enjoyed the outside patio and then the clubhouse itself. The clubhouse included the outside patio area, a place to relax and enjoy complimentary coffee/tea/hot chocolare and it also has a fitness area. We stayed an entire week so the hot tub was a great relaxing experience. Being from Boston and YAY, we did win that 2011 Stanley Cup!!!!! we didn't want to miss the games and the relaxing clubhouse with a large screen TV came in handy. The staff knew we were routing for Boston so they immediately became Bruins fans as well to help cheer our team along. All in all this place is tremendous in all that it has to offer, location, cleanliness, helpful and pleasant staff. All in all, this made for one of our favorite vacations ever and we love to travel. A place we will revisit in the future for sure!!! Thank you all at the Donatello! The Gay Family

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CStew113
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our anniversary trip to San Francisco last October. What a wonderful place! My mom had stayed here previously and recommended it to me, and she didn't let me down at all. The staff was friendly and beyond courteous, the location was perfect - a quick walk and you're right at a trolley or bus stop or in Union Square, and the rooms were huge! There was a neat rooftop area that had free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate all day/evening. I would recommend The Donatello to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “excelllent location- great staff”
Reviews.Author: utah54
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful days in San Francisco and stayed at the Donatello. We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the facility, excellent staff and overall great experience. The location near Union Square was excellent. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go and enjoyed all the shopping and fine dining in the area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chuckk5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights and really liked it. The room was spacious, clean, and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable. We found the staff to b professional and eager to help. It is a very good value for the area. Perhaps the only negative is the gym. It is not very well equiped but it was typical of many hotel gyms. We would definately go back. The hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Our Oasis in Downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: minimi46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend one week each year for the past 15 years at the Donatello which is ideally located just a block away from Union Square, argueably the center of gravity of San Francisco. The Donatello's staff are all friendly and efficient including the housekeeping staff who make certain the rooms are super clean with fresh towels and toilet amenities renewed each day. The beds are firm (just right), pillows and sheets soft and comphy, carpets vacumed daily. Most rooms have LCD TVs and high speed WiFi internet in all rooms. Room service is good from the hotel's in house Zingari resturant and the bar on the mezzanine is a popular meeting point for both locals and visitors. The Donatello is our oasis in downtown San Francisco. We would'nt think of ever staying at any other hotel as it's your best value for money bar none!

Reviews.Title: “A getaway in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: GenuinelyCurious
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a comfortable hotel within a couple of blocks of the famous Union Square in San Francisco. It's also within comfortable walking distance to other major shopping (Westfield), the theater district and, of course, the cable car stop at the foot of Powell street. With a little more walking you can get to Fiisherman's Whart/ Pier 39. Easy to catch a cab as well. We actually live in the East Bay, so this was a local getaway for us. Donatello's car service is reasonable (for San Francisco) and becomes a pretty good home base for tours around the city or across the golden gate

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - great location, great staff, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesTheLimey
Reviews.Content: I read many of the other reviews before booking and would agree with the general opinion that, while this is not the most modern hotel (some features of the room are a bit older), it is great for a San Francisco stay. The location (one block from Union Sq.) is perfect and the staff are friendly, courteous, and eager to help. The concierges were particularly good and gave us great advice on how to spend the time we had in the city (all of their recommendations were spot on). I would have no hesitation in staying here again if (hopefully when) I retrun to SF.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: fortini
Reviews.Content: Our room was so spacious and comfortable, everything you could need was there, or close to hand with everyone we encountered being so helpful and friendly. We would recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smm327
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 night stay at The Donatello. The hotel is centrally located downtown with easy access to public transportation, tour bus stops. Chinatown and the financial district is an easy walk. Many restaurants, shopping, rental car agencies are located near the hotel. The hotel staff was very accommodating to our needs. The hotel is clean which is very important to us.There is a club room on the top floor which opens at 7AM and closes at 10:30 :PM where you can get a coffee, tea at no charge. This was a nice plus. We have given a 4 star rating because we feel some updating is needed; such as exhaust fan in bathrooms should be installed, a little bigger TV would be nice as well. Overall we recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back here for sure!”
Reviews.Author: luv2plan44
Reviews.Content: We just came home from our first family vacation to San Francisco, and we are already looking forward to returning! The Donatello added to our enjoyable stay. The staff was so cordial, and went out of their way to say hello, offer help, and make us comfortable. Deo, at the front desk gave us a great room along Mason St. on the 7th floor. The room is large, and has a mini bar area outside the bathroom with a sink, coffee maker, microwave oven, and even dishes. The room feels clean. My 9-year old son slept on the sofa bed, and my daughter was able to sleep comfortably with my husband and me in the king-size bed. Yes, we could hear sirens at times, but it did not bother us at all, and never kept us up. We were in the middle of the city, so it didn't seem unusual. One of benefits of being in the middle of the city was being close to shopping, eating places, theaters, the cable car turn-around, museums,...all within walking distance. Our whole family loved it! Being coffee and tea drinkers, we appreciated the club level amenities, which included complimentary (Peet's!) coffee, tea, and hot cocoa. The bellmen are all very friendly and helpful. Joe was so polite, and suggested the best way to the airport from the hotel, then handled everything, so we could just enjoy our vacation. On one drizzly day, we were standing on the street, and Rolando came all the way outside to suggest that we borrow a couple of their umbrellas! At the same time, he asked Tony, another bellman, to hail us a cab. All in all, I would recommend The Donatello to anyone who wants to be walking distance to Union Square, the cable car turnaround, and Chinatown, and is looking for a more intimate atmosphere than a huge chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Major Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: ptaylor9849
Reviews.Content: Just like MANY others have stated previously, this place is unbelievably noisy. Paper thin walls AND exterior glass. I know it's a city buy my God, you could hear EVERYTHING happening on the street even from the 9th floor ALL NIGHT LONG. Even my girlfriend who is not a complainer and a very heavy sleeper, couldn't keep from disliking this place. The only thing worse than the sleepless nights, were the homeless zombies following you into restaurants begging for money and food. Then there was the extremely tacky orange and blue decor that looked like something out of Greg Brady's bedroom when he took on the alter ego of Johnny Bravo. Wait till you checkout and you learn that parking with tax just cost you thirty two dollars per night. What an absolute joke! This place nearly ruined my California vacation experience. STAY ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: mmsole
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Donatello was short but very well worth it. My husband and I stayed here with our two young boys and they made all of us feel comfortable and welcomed. My boys loved the view from the 9th floor at the other city buildings and the room was spacious enough for everyone to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed; Large, Clean, Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Slubby
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at The Donatello in early June and were very impressed with this Hotel. Located one block west of Union Square and the Powell Cable Car line, this hotel is ideally located for easy access to all of the sites that San Francisco offers. You are only about a short 5 block walk to Market Street and all the shopping and public transit options. Check-in was a breeze and very efficient. And for those that stay over on a Friday, they have a free wine and cheese eveing at 5pm for the hotel guests on the top floor This was a nice bonus, as was the concierge service. The staff go out of their way to provide you with all sorts of info. The best part of the stay was the rooms. As this was our first visit to the SF area, we were expecting to have to put up with the small hotel rooms that most of downtown SF offers. Not at the Donatello - the rooms are as large as advertised, more than 400 square feet. The king size bed and pillows were so comfortable. The room also has a mini fridge, microwave, sink, dishes, glasses, cutlery, and coffee maker. I was also very pleased how clean the rooms and the hotel is. And finally, I slept like a baby as the rooms were very quiet and we never heard any of the street noise.(stayed in room 609). If you're unsure where to stay in SF, this is the place for you. Close to everything, and a very comfortable room. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for it's price and location”
Reviews.Author: lancshiker2308
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3nights as part of our holiday. The staff were top notch and the place has a pleasant positive feel. The rooms were spotless and well equipped with coffee maker, fridge, tv etc. The only drawback was that there was a nightclub right across the street from our window and, because we stayed over a weekend, it was really noisy at 3am when people were leaving, police sirens etc. As far as we could see the windows wen't double glazed which I think you really need in a city centre hotel. To be fair though we didn't ask to be moved so it may have been less noisy in ore rooms. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base to visit San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: rick184
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the start (4 nights) and end (3 nights) of our road trip around California. The room was spacious and well equiped with microwave, sink, fridge and crocks/cutlery. Our room was on the 6th floor, the view was not particulary interesting but hey it's a city centere hotel sourounded by buildings! All of the staff: reception, concergie, bell man and house keeping were so friendly and helpful throughout our stays. The location is great for exploring Union Sq shopping area and Soma. The cable car stop is just one block away, with Powell St BART station a couple of blocks away - we used BART from/to the airport which was inexpensive and straightforward. We would recommend Cafe La Tasca for breakfast which is less tha half a block way on Post St.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: BreatheEasy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Anniversary and had a great time. Our terrace room was spacious and clean. Service was outstanding. A great value and a great location. The only negative was a loud,noisy nightclub across the street. But you are staying downtown in a big city so some noise should be expected.
