Reviews.Title: “"Exceeded our expectations"”
Reviews.Author: Len39_11
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is well located, close to Union Square,shopping and transport including the cable car. Our room was clean, large and with a large, well-equipped bathroom. We found the staff friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. Even when there was an error in our account, this was rectified promptly and efficiently by the front desk staff. Our room on the 8th floor overlooked a nightclub and the patrons outside could get noisy in the early hours at the weekend. The Club on the top floor is a nice way to relax and unwind at the end of the day with tea and coffee provided. The free wifi worked very efficiently and was a definite bonus. My wife and I , in our senior years, thoroughly enjoyed our three nights at the Donatello and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a pleasant stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly ....we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: SanJai22
Reviews.Content: First off the location is superb...Just 1block away from union square...rooms are big and spacious...very clean ... Club house is very good...staff is helpful and friendly...free wifi....room service is prompt...there is everything in the room to make u comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, Perfect Staff”
Reviews.Author: SanFran2011
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I spent our honeymoon in San Francisco and stayed at the Club Donatello Hotel. We were greeted by Jesus in reception and he couldn't have been more helpful. and very polite and friendly as were all th eother staff. Jesus arranged a wine tasting trip for us to Napa Valley. The trip was fab, only 4 of us on it and was well worth the money. We would certainly recommend this hotel and would love to return in the future. We have read reviews about noisy rooms but, to be honest our room was great, the view could of been better but at the end of the day San Fran is a city and you will get buildings round about. There is also a really nice little eatery just down the street called La Tasca brilliant breakfasts in there. All in all we were sad to leave the Donatello and San Fran behind and go home to Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Tulip0506
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Donatello numerous times for both business and pleasure and I have never found anything bad to stay about any visit! The staff is warm and welcoming and it always feels like visiting family when I am there! I have recommended it to everyone that I know is heading to San Francisco and have heard nothing but good things from those people as well! The Donatello's location is perfect for those looking to be in the middle of everything and it is easy to get anywhere from there! Zingari Italian restaurant, in the hotel, has phenominal food but if you are not interested in that, we have never had an issue finding food close by! Shopping is also close by as is the cable car turn around, which can get you to Fisherman's Warf via a really cool tour of the City! i would wholeheartedly recommend the Donatello to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location, Best Value”
Reviews.Author: MikeAfram
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week long business trip. The rooms are a good size, have a kitchenette, sofa sleeper, and very comfy beds!! I Was lucky enough to have a room on the terrace level that has a private patio which extends to a larger shared area. The restaurant was wonderful and the bar poured generous drinks. The staff was very professional and helpful. Can't beat this hotel for price and value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: whodatnation76
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! Staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations on closeby restaurants, sights, etc. As mentioned earlier, rooms are a little dated, but still offer all the usual amenities such as flat screen tv, mini fridge, etc. Our bed was very comfortable. Best thing about this hotel is location to all of San Fran's attractions. The Union Square park is only away and there you can hop on a trolley for a quick and sight filled ride to Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty of great shops and restaurants are VERY closeby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on business, romance, or family trip and will definitely be staying here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “One Hotel - Two parts”
Reviews.Author: Smilingguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this building for six nights in mid May - although it was the Club Donatello which is the top three floors. Problem was that when booking I did not realise the difference that the Club rooms are privately owned, like a timeshare room. Treated as guest to the hotel with full use of facilities but lacked the 'mini kitchen' facilities in the hotel - no microwave etc - but too late to change on arrival. Anyway, the reception was fine, very friendly and helpful suggestions for breakfast. We would recommend Lori's Diner or Cafe Taza. Room was very large and the bed was just great. Furniture was dated - others might call it classic. Lots of mirrors - whole walls. Location was superb - 5mins from the centre and transport. The big test is would we go back? Yes but would try for the hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Smiles and great service!”
Reviews.Author: krayola80
Reviews.Content: From the time I made the reservation until my farewell... this hotel made me feel at home. The amazing approachable staff sets the tone. One block from almost everything you can think of. The front desk helpful suggestions, like buying a transportation city pass. If using public transit, I recommend you get one. Kitchenette in the room is convenient. WIFI is spotty, but its free. I will come back and stay here again on my next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “World Class... Local Flavor!”
Reviews.Author: azntazdvl
Reviews.Content: Had the great pleasure of visiting the Donatello on Business last month with coworkers and as luck would have it, we stumbled upon the Donatello while looking for a convenient location in Union Square. I did not know of the hotel personally, only was familiar with the general vicinity and it was in the price range. The rooms were very spacious and the attentive staff made you feel like a world class traveler. We were all very happy with our stay here and will continue to book here when business takes us to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Very Helpful Staff & Big Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ldavi13
Reviews.Content: Would def go back here... our first time in San Fran and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The Staff were so helpful & the hotel was right in the midst of the city, one block from Union Square so walking distance to the whole city basically. Free wifi was great too, we got to Skype with our son back in Australia! We did have a few problems connecting to it in the beginning but the staff fixed this up for us straight away. Really inviting property. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but had a drink at the bar :)

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent value for a super location with amazing service!!”
Reviews.Author: OnVacationSoon
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in SF several times, choosing a place to stay is always difficult because so many hotels have much to offer. We chose the Donatello because of proximity to Union Square's shopping, Chinatown and train. On arrival, we were met with the feeling that the desk clerk was actually happy to see us! What a welcome departure from those apathetic jerks that make me feel as if they were called them away from their last meal to do their job! When we got into the room, we found it more than adequate. It was quite large. There was a small 'fridge to put our bottled water and snacks into. A microwave was most excellent for reheating restaurant leftovers! The sink area with coffee maker was great, several teas and coffees to choose from. For a homey touch, there were jars filled with candy, sugar and sugar substitute packets, etc for our use. The bed was big and comfy. I generally cannot sleep in a bed that isn't my own but this one was good. Extra pillows and blanket were available in the closet for use without having to bother housekeeping. I slept most nights without waking. Only the city noise that could be heard once in a while woke me a few times-sirens mostly. Not unexpected in a large metro city, especially when you ask for a room facing the street! Bathroom, while somewhat dated and in need of rehab, was spacious. I have absolutely no complaints about the cleanliness or amenities. Personal preference would lead me to make this statement, nothing else. It was in perfect working order. On the second day of our stay, the toilet seat seemed a bit loose (hubby reading too long in there??) We called the desk and it was fixed within the hour! Service was tops. Room decor was nice. Again, my preference is that it be updated soon. Sofa was BIG. Chair was comfy. Television was LARGE! Again, all in good repair. Carpeting in the room was not worn or stained. All furniture was in great repair. Large closet in the entry area with additional dresser for my clothing was nice. I don't like to stuff a weeks worth of clothing into a tiny little space. There was room for everything, even my husband's items.. and he overpacks!. I'd like to have seen a work space or desk on which to work. The "desk" in the room was very small, not meant for meaningful work to be done. Before we left the Donatello, we already agreed that we would stay there when returning to SF. The price was great, location was excellent, service was amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Small and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: RealtorRena
Reviews.Content: Great location near trolly line and lots of resturants. The employees were great and very helpful, even housekeeping. This was a small older hotel, but very clean and comfortable. We had a refridgerator, coffee pot, sink, and a microwave, but there were many places to eat near by. We also walked to the mall and shopped at union square. Only one place to eat in the hotel, but the food was good there also.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jean7863
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we have stayed. The staff was very helpful and courtious. The room was spacous and clean. The room had a sink, refrigerator, microwave with dishes and silverware for two people. Our view was nothing special, but then in downtown San Francisco, there is no view to speak of. We stayed May 1 and 2 and cannot say enough good about this hotel. The concierge helped us get tickets for Alcatraz at the last moment. Finally, this is a great location and I wouild recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoppie123
Reviews.Content: Top quality hotel is in an ideal location in downtown San Francisco. Very friendly staff and nothing was too much trouble. My room was quiet and other guests did not disturb me. I would highly reccomend this hotel to both short-tern and long-term tavellers and whenever I'm in SFO I woudl choose to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our third time here”
Reviews.Author: Ashford817
Reviews.Content: We were in Sonoma last weekn and decided to stay overnight in San Francisco sincce our flight home was a little later in tha day and didn't need the convenience of an airport hotel.We chose the Donatello because ee've stayed there twice before for longer periods of time and have not been disappointed. The location, a few blocks from Union Square, can be a bit "seedy looking" at first glance but it has no effect on the overall experience. The hotel has a number of excellent restaurants very close. We've never eaten in the restaurant in the hotel only because we have other favorites in the area. The staff is very effecient, friendly and accommodating. Since SF is one of our favorite cities to visit, we know we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-very suitable-not luxurious-great service”
Reviews.Author: bongail
Reviews.Content: Great location-nice customer service-spacious room-little tired in decor but no matter-missing good amenities-no shower caps or flip flops-yes to robes! Would definitely stay here if not looking for luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, but needs some double glazing.”
Reviews.Author: BrightonianMiss
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in April and found it a great location from which to explore most of the City. Union Square, Chinatown and Nob Hill are all within walking distance (take care if returning through the nearby Tenderloin district though; full-on druggy area and quite menacing even in daylight.). Overall we were happy with our large clean room and huge, comfortable bed, and the extra amenities such as fridge and coffee maker were welcome (though as typical Brits, a kettle for making tea would have been perfect.). The orange and indigo decor is starting to look quite tired and dated, however, and unfortunately we were in one of the rooms which obliquely overlooks Ruby Skye's nightclub across the road. At 2am this place empties out very noisily, and then just as you are getting back to sleep an hour later, what sounds like a ton of empty bottles from the night are collected and loaded cacophonously into a truck, blowing your final chance of sleep. We were on the eighth floor but were still immediately awoken. Some secondary glazing would really make a difference on this side of the hotel, please take note. Desk, valet parking and housekeeping staff were all very helpful and friendly, offering advice and crib-sheets suggesting routes out of the city on the morning we left to drive to Monterey. We didn't use the restaurant but there are good breakfasts to be had up the road at Lori's Diner, and a wealth of evening eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We spent an enjoyable week in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: 1944Linda
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was very nice. Close to Union Square, cable cars, "F" train, buses and restaurants. Our room was spacious and very clean. The staff was friendly and so willing to help in any way they could. The hotel consierge was very knowledgeable and gave us a lot of good suggestions of things to see and do. Our room also had a small microwave, dormitory sized refrigerator and dishes/silverware for two. Very convienient for warming up leftovers or having a light meal in our room. We would stay at the Donatello again on any return trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: Grant13
Reviews.Content: Well all those other trip advisor reviewers were correct, this is a great hotel. The rooms are spacious, the location is right in the middle of the town - I walked from here to all of the central sites (but I do enjoy a walk). At night there are plenty of close resteraunts and if you wish there are also several theatres close by and the BART is only a 7 minute walk away. You cannot go wrong staying here. The hotel provides a microwave, plates, bowls, cutlery and a fridge so you can actually make your own cerial for breakfast and if you are really keen (and why would you as all the food is pretty cheap) make you own dinner in the microwave. The price of this hotel was spot on for its type - it was not the cheapest but is was still very well priced and I felt that there was real value for money When I return to San Francisco there is no where I would rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome in SFO”
Reviews.Author: Ittyfrog
Reviews.Content: Staff were great - welcoming and helpful. We arrived early and we were shown to our room without a wait - terrific when you have just flown across the Pacific. The location is excellent in terms of access to just about everything you would want to do in San Francisco. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, even if decor is a little dated. The in-house restaurant (Zingari) was really good and the guest lounge on the top floor is a great asset. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location, good value, lovely”
Reviews.Author: k8_005
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed for 3 nights at the donatello, when we arrived we decided to take the subway from the airport then walk, this would have been fine but we got off at teh wrong stop and walked up a lot of steep roads before arriving so arrived frazzled, was pleasently surprised when we walked in to the air con'd lobby with nice soft jazz playing in the background, despite us looking quite deshevalled and it being a smart hotel no one blinked an eye, the reception was manned and we were served almost immediatly our resivation was quickly confirmed and we were tolda bout the hotel aminities and given the free wi fi access code, a bell hop gladly took our bags and showed us to our room, the bell hop then gave us free a cable car pass that some other guests had left and felt maybe we could use it had that day remaining, (we ended up doing the same as we left with our old passes) this was a kind gesture and we tipped him for bringing the bags and giving us the pass. The room was spacious clean and niceley decorated the orange bedspread is bright but can be removed(basically its as in the photos) the hotel restaurant is the italian next door which is connected to the hotel so you can go to it via the street or the hotel lifts it has a good variety on the menu and reasonable costs though not the best italian food i have eaten it was pleasent and nice. and well presented with large portion sizes. the waiters were freindly and the bill was able to be put on your room or paid in full at the time. we also used the cocktail bar attatched, which had live music with a pianist and singer the pianist also sang when it was male /female duets they were very good and played a variety of songs as well as requests, the bar was fully stocked and while the cocktail list isnt extensive they will also make things up as you like or order. you can also order nibbles and snacks in the bar area though be aware there is limited seating. we found it a convinient evening out while jet lagged as were able to retire to our rooms at the touch of the lifts! location: very near union square and a short cable car or tram ride or bus to fishermans wharf we had a great time. we didnt use the gym but apparently there is one and we didnt use the laundry service, we did have a wake up call which was as it should be. the only thing that can be said as a downfall is that as its on a busy road you can hear the traffic at night this didnt bother us as we are londoners and hear the traffic at home but for those who arent used to it it may pose a problem. also there is no mini bar in your room again this wasnt a problem for us as we never use them. I dont know if there was breakfast available at the hotel as we went out to a local recommended diner every morning so didnt eat there. over all a good hotel to stay at for the price and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: nvr306
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Donatello the first week in May. Our children live in San Francisco and we travel to visit twice a year. We have never stayed in this hotel and I liked the reviews I read. The room was very spacious as was the bathroom. My husband enjoyed the bar on the first floor, as he did the roof deck. The location was very central to all the sights. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price in handy downtown position”
Reviews.Author: emelian
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 3 nights there. we drove in and got thier valet parking deal which is a bargain as parking appears to be around $40 a day. Perfect position for all the sights and shopping. Jazz club and nice retaurant attatched with happy hour half price food. Would definately stay again and highly recommend. A real bargain. Only one complaint, that they need a new keyboard in the buiseness office computer as the letters had worn off the keys which i found tiresome to type having to figure out where the letters were.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay-Beware Early morning trash commotion”
Reviews.Author: JajaLalaMimiEE
Reviews.Content: Great location like many had mentioned. Room, Services, and the friendly staffers are great Beware of early morning trash clearing commotion even from the 8th floor so be sure to ask for the highest floor! Daily per day parking fees

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bay60
Reviews.Content: The location was a block from Union Square and close to everything. Everyone who worked there was very helpful and friendly.They recommended restaurants and made us reservations The room was large and had windows that opened. (Would like to get the room with a terrace next time). On the top floor is the Donatello Club where you can get coffee in the morning or sit outside on the roof top. Would definitely stay there again. Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAFF”
Reviews.Author: CAMILLA-LOSNEGARD
Reviews.Content: The rates are reasonable considering how well placed the Hotel is. 3 blks from Union Square which means you easily access the tour busses and public transportation. Walking distance to china town and if you are up for a LONG walk, walkable to North Beach (their "little italy"). Staff was SUPER responsive to requests. ALWAYS friendly and EXSTREMELY polite and professional! Rooms were nice, spacious and VERY WELL kept...in fact I had locked myself out of my room and the housekeeper was nice enough to let me in to drop my bags while I went to find my sister to vouch for me but she wouldn't let me take anything, INCLUDING my ID to be able to get a key :-) I was not mad, I thought she was very p0erofessional and helpful and was relieved to know my belongings (and goodies I bought to bring home) were safe and respected there. Overall, fab value and we would definately stay there again if we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mitchigan1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello April 26th for one week. Had read all the previous reviews and agree it is a awesome hotel, we had a couple of minor problems in our room no sooner reported then there was a knock at the door and problem solved. Would definetely stay here again.Thanks Donatello for a wonderful stay. Julie & Mike Watson Newmarket UK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: codash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after a last minute change of mind and after reading TA reviews. I have no regrets whatsoever. The hotel is central, well maintained and rooms are a good size and well equipped. Bed was extremely comfortable. Staff was generally helpful and friendly. The only exception was a room service waiter who seemed to expect a tip even though the hotel added 17 or 18% service charge. The hotel has, to its credit, responded to my comment about this. The only downside relates to the lack of breakfast service at the restaurant. However this is a purely personal desire and may not influence others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Benny053
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - centrally located to Union Square and all attractions, transport, etc. Well furnished with all amenities - coffee machine, in room safe, bar fridge, kitchenette, crockery, microwave, cuttlery; what more could you want? Great if you want to reheat take outs, etc. BATHROOM and housekeeping were immaculate though decor a bit dated. But, it is surely one of the biggest room of any hotel in the City, you could dance all night and swing a cat. Great staff on board and very helpful. Thanks Jesus, Evita and gang. Coffee, Tea and hot chocolate (complimentary) available at the Club floor(Top of the building) from 7am till 10.30pm a very welcoming treat especially after a hard day's slog along the slopes of San Francisco and the chilly weather. Great place to check out the weather before going out each morning and take in the sights. Internet available to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not Excepting Credit Cards!”
Reviews.Author: PlanetR
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a wonderful value for San Francisco. The location is superb. The room is large and well appointed. Just make sure your window is completely shut to keep out the street noise. To our surprise our window was slightly open the first night and it was extremely loud. Once we realized it and closed it no problems. When we checked in on Thursday they said the credit card machine was not working and to submit it at check out. Well we checked out today (Sunday) and they asked for payment in cash! Well, we did not have access to that much cash on Easter Sunday and no checkbook with us. They told us just to send a check once we got home. Something is obviously not right here. Not sure what their problem is with the credit card company, but it must be fairly serious not to accept credit for days. The workout room is small. One treadmill, one bike, one stairstepper and some weights. Opens at 7am on top floor. Free coffee and cocoa was a nice touch. Overall a great value and hope their business is not in trouble. Would definitely stay here again. Also, while we were there the parking garage alway had a totally full sign up. Not sure if this is normal or just a more then average busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “frendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis3836
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed 8 nights at the Donatello in early April. The room was large and comfortable. The staff were very helpful. It's in a great location very close to Union Square. I would definitely stay there again. Dennis, Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: deb010101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and put as much as we could into our first trip to San Francisco. This was the perfect location to launch our curiosity into the city! The staff was extremely helpful and courteous from valet, to conceriege, to the service in the room. We enjoyed the live music and singing performers in the bar, the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I never thought it would be this good.”
Reviews.Author: redtripper52
Reviews.Content: Walking up the hill, the Donatello was easily seen on the corner. (A big plus for walkers in a new city). Front desk staff immediately greeted us and made us feel welcome. We were several hours early for check in, but, without our requesting it, the clerk checked to see if we could check in early. Within minutes we had our room keys and went immediately to our light persimmon & blue room. A tall table by the door was ideal for placing items we wanted to remember to take when we went back out. A letter was on the table welcoming us to the Donatello. I thought our bed at home was comfortable. Ohhhh, it was difficult to get out of bed each morning, the mattress was soooo nice. Placement of furniture was ideal. Service excellent. Everyone courteous, helpful, and made us feel very welcomed. The concierge always had time to answer my questions, give aid in chosing what to do next, and even confirmed our return airline reservations. Listening to the music in the evening in the lobby just below the bar was soothing and fun. The drinks in the bar are strong, so we definitely got our money's worth there, also. My only (very slight) complaint is the piano is a bit loud for the size of the bar. But for those who like loud music & have no desire to talk over their drinks, it would be ideal. The "Club" is a very nice touch. A place for exercise and a large room for relaxing. The Club room (set apart from the exercise rooms) had a television, DVDs, games, multiple tables, delicious hot coffee, and water for cocoa & tea. The balcony around three sides of the hotel (club level) was romantic. It gave my husband a place to smoke his cigars in the evenings after dinner. I was delighted with the selection of teas availble. I even took some back to my room for morning tea. I could babble on ages, but just know that if you want a comfortable, delightful place to stay in uptown (it was uphill from the Bart) San Francisco and be treated like VIPs, go to the Donatello. ,

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, not #4 in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_travel
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed, I use trip advisor a lot and usually when something gets this high a rating from travelors, it is something special. The Staff was nice but the hotel is a bit old and tired. The carpets are worn and the scuffs and scrapes in the walls and paint should be repaired. The location is good, but there are so many hotels with great locations in San Francisco. I was traveling with my wife, daughter in law and grand son. I ended up on the sleeper sofa, only King beds! there wasn't a second sheet for the sleeper sofa. Of course, I didn't realize this until we were going to bed and I was making up the sleeper sofa. I slept with just the blanket that night and had them bring me a second sheet the next night. When we went to use the dvd player in the room, the maintenance guy needed to come up and switch it over so that we could use it. There is a button on the side of the TV but no instructions. Overall, it was OK and I wouldn't be so critical, but it sure doesn't seem to be worth a #4 out of #242 hotels in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi didn't work for the entire stay, hot water broke down, and fridge froze our food”
Reviews.Author: Juiced_Pixels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights, and one of the attractions was free wifi, but unfortunately it broke down and wasn't available for our entire stay. Also, the hot water broke down for a day, and so that meant freezing showers. The fridge in the room froze all our food we bought at Wholefoods which we had to throw out. We told the front desk numerous times about these problems, but were not offered anything in return for the inconvenience we experienced. Oh, and the room was very noisy on the weekend nights due to nearby nightclubs and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location near Union Square; Excellent Service.”
Reviews.Author: MrLeakey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in April. San Francisco holds so much to enjoy--food, music, art, scenery, culture, food, and, well, food. The Donatello is perfectly positioned to enjoy it all, while using public transportation or your car. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The rooms ample and well kept for a value-priced property. This is our second time here and we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: nh_salsamama
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional, Evita and Jesus at the desk, Carlos at the bellman station. All were so helpful to these first time visitors to San Francisco. The hotel was comfortable and elegant at the same time. The Donatello is right down the street from the Powell Station at Union Square. Nice walking distance to everything. Rooms were large and bed was so comfortable. The restaurant ( we did not eat there) has live entertainment in the evening which can be enjoyed at the bar or just sitting in the lobby. The workout room is small. The jacuzzi is small but the place is immaculate. Nice seating area and balcony on the same floor. Complimentary coffee and tea in the seating area. Microwave and coffee in room. Only downside was the intermittent and at times absent WiFi access (complimentary) We were told that they are upgrading the equipment and that should solve the problem. (Seemed worse above the sixth floor) Still.. access was available in the lobby. The boiler went down for several hours but was fixed quickly and we were notified immediately. Staff could not have been more professional and customer oriented! Massage therapist was very good as well. We had the best breakfasts around the corner at The Sears restaurant. Max's for deli lunch is a must. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, superb rooms”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 4 nights, on a leisure trip to see SF. The rooms were superb. Here are the details. Two luggage stands for your bags and trolleys. A safe big enough for an iPad and lots of accessories and camera. Night table and floor lamps had dimmer switches to fine-adjust light levels. This was especially helpful late at night. Washroom also had a night light visible only on entering and invisible from the bedroom/living room (I had a studio room). Spacious bathroom countertop. CD player with speakers were standard, and TV was flat screen with DVD player. Plenty of closet space along with two tall shelf cabinets by the TV and CD player stands, and a kitchenette with microwave, utensils, glasses, and fridge were standard. Bathroom had handshower. Bed was perfect, not too soft, and I had a great sleep each night. A two-person sofa and table, plus a single easy chair with ottoman and writing desk rounded things out very comfortably. Wow. The room never felt cramped, as space was very nicely utilized. One concierge (fellow named Peter) was exceptionally knowledgable about the transit system and the best transit routes to key attractions like the de Young, Legion of Honor, and the Golden Gate Bridge. Another concierge (his name escapes me) gave me full details on how to book a CalTrain ticket to see Stanford in Palo Alto, providing train schedules, and how to get to the depot by bus from Union Square. In all my travels, I have not encountered such proficient concierges. Bravo. Service at desk: Very smart and efficient; knew the locations of local drug stores nearby, without consulting any guides. Check-in and check-out were trouble-free. Even booked a shuttle to airport for only $14. Negatives of room: not many, but fixable with some long-term inve$tment from management. - Water pressure was low in the shower, and had to leave hot water on full blast early in morning, to get the pipes humming with warm water. Perhaps an upgrade of the boiler system is overdue. - WiFi was erratic, and I couldn't connect on my iPad. Apparently, this was widespread, as one concierge mentioned it on my way out, in the elevator. Fortunately, hotel offers free use of a desktop in their biz center. Location: Perfect. One block from Union Square, transit buses nearby. No problem getting to the west end for museums and Golden Gate bridge (take the open top bus tour -- I listened to Wagner's Ride of the Valkyries on my iPod, as the bus drove across the GG Bridge at 45 mph in the bright sun and cool breeze. Bay views spectacular on both sides of bridge. Was a better thrill than the Eiffel Tower in Paris, which is boring by comparison. What an adrenaline rush!). Overall: A super hotel with lots of fine details that are missing in big chain places like Hilton and Marriott. And at these rates ($159-179/night) why settle for anything else? Will stay here again. Many thanks to the management team for making this hotel a very memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: BierGirl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel largely because we could trade our timeshare week for a week at the Donatello. What a wonderful experience. The resort is well located. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We discovered a very squeaky bathroom door our fist night which was fixed right away the next day. All the staff was cheery and spoke whenever we passed. One concierge was exceedingly helpful in getting some stuff I needed to ship packaged and shipped for me. We would definitely stay here again should the chance arise.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and accomidating staff, clean and large room”
Reviews.Author: GregDunlap
Reviews.Content: close to downtown, staff is very friendly, rooms are clean and large. Would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location = great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amyksholiday
Reviews.Content: This was my first vist to San Francisco with two friends. From the moment we arrived at this hotel the staff were extremely friendly and went the extra mile for all of us. I loved the fact that each room at a coffee machine, microwave and free wifi. We have stayed in more expensive hotels which don't even have these amenities!! The hotel is located right in the middle of the city, which makes it really easy to get to everything (shops, restaurants etc). The only thing is that there were a lot of homeless people on the streets, but I think you'll find this in the city, regardless of where you stay. Overall, we were very impressed and would recommend The Donatello to anyone. We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit! It's not only value for money, but also just a great experience. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VeryBusyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Donatello Hotel in San Francisco in mid-March. It was the first time for us in this hotel. We were very pleased with the hotel and particularly the staff. I rate the hotel very high on all counts. I accompanied my wife while she attended a conference and spent my time working from the hotel room. The room was spacious and comfortable. The desk was not so comfortable. This hotel is best for pleasure travelers, but we had such a pleasant stay I would probably opt to stay there again even if I was on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!! No Ka Oi!! (The Best!!)”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianTravelah
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, all were helpful!! I really loved this hotel because it had amenities such as mini refridge, coffee maker with free coffee, microwave, free wi-fi, also, dishes and full utensils. We got to bring back food and "warm it up"!! Many hotels in San fran does not have refridge or microwave so that was a plus! There are 3 diners that are ~3 min walk away.The beds were great, nice and firm. In many reviews people complain about the street noise but after being there, theres no way of stopping that any any hotel in that city. All in all I would definately highly recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go Wildcats”
Reviews.Author: GOWILDCATS2011
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort with top notch staff that are friendly and go out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one from the time you enter the resort. Be sure to visit the Jazz Lounge. The bar tenders are wonderful and good music. We ordered dinner from the restaurant in the lounge and although it was a little pricey, our dinner was very good. The club room and staff are great and the facility is very nice. Great location downtown to unique restaurants and union square is only a 5 minute walk and from there you can catch the trolley and hop on hop off busses. I would recommend staying here and the next time I'm in San Fran, I will try to book here first. Tip, ask for a room with even last number. The room view will be the Marriott. The other side of the building is a bar that stays busy late night and can get noisy very early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service was great!”
Reviews.Author: lizeth81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance of Union Square and Market Street. Being so close to these areas allowed us to explore the various transportation options that the city has to offer. The staff was always friendly and helpful with providing restaurant recommendations and with any other help we needed. For example, they provided an umbrella during the rainy days and also a map of the city. Overall, I felt welcome because of their outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brunospba
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to san Francisco many times and The Donatello Hotel is, by far, the best value in town! The best location possible,very good staff, and the rooms are better, bigger and more beautiful than you would expect! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: buck08
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Donatello. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless. The traffic noise was a little high, but to be expected a block from Union Square and during Saint Patty's day celebrations. The accommodations were very nice. We enjoyed the hot tub after a day of walking around San Francisco. We would recommend the Donatello anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elvis082
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Donatello in San Francisco. The staff was very knowledgeable and very friendly. There was a warmth about all of them throughout our stay. We loved the location which is central to most of the attractions, and the bellmen couldn't do enough to help. We had a beautiful room which was very clean and spacious. For our first visit to San Francisco, we were extremely happy with the hotel, its location and all its amenities, and we'd highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: allisonc86
Reviews.Content: Based on the other reviews, we thought this hotel looked like a great find. It was a wonderful location, and the staff was extremely helpful and kind. We would definitely recommend the Donatello to anyone visiting the area and will stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes for me”
Reviews.Author: graydudes
Reviews.Content: I've just returned downunder after a 3 night stay in San Francisco for a conference held at The Marriott Marquis. Sure, I could've stayed at the Marriott but Tripadvisor pointed a big arrow toward the Donatello. *great location *great staff *large rooms *excellent service *great value The whole team are genuinely friendly &, like previous reviews, Jesus gets a special mention as he greeted me by name 24 hrs after checking me in. I stayed on level 11 which is a Club Donatello (holiday ownership) room. You can check out The Club Donatello website & book club rooms which have been released by individuals with shares in the scheme. I loved San Francisco & hope to bring back my family soon. The Donatello will be top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: rayemit61
Reviews.Content: My family and I truly enjoyed our stay at The Donatello. Excellent all around service. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: deeann7
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled into the parking garage, we were pleasantly greeted by a most friendly attemdant and enjoyed our front desk welcome by Jesus and Mr. Ed. Superbly run hotel, we had a quiet room towards inner courtyard, very comfortable king bed in a large room with ample storage, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. Happy hour was great in the adjoining restaurant. Hotel located in Nob Hill just a block away from great shopping, theaters, and trolley stop. Just a few blocks walk to Chinatown as well. Many great restaurants nearby for breakfast or dinner. Our only regret was having stayed just one night. We would definitely return to this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmarcus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Booked it because of its great reviews on trip advisor, location, price, and good reputation of Shell properties. Parking rates were significantly lower than most of the hotels in the area, and it also offered free wi-fi (most of the 5 star hotels charge a fee for internet access) . (The only disappointment was the internet as it was dreadfully slow and frustrating to use. There was a computer for guest's use in the lobby area, and this seemed to be faster than the wi-fi in the room.) Overall we were very satisfied, and the hotel met all of our expectations. The room was very spacious, bed was especially comfortable, and location was fantastic. There was free tea, coffee, and hot chocolate available on the 10th floor, with a lounge . The concierge was available to assist with any sightseeing and booking of restaurants and entertainment, but we didn't require any of these services. We enjoyed the welcome wine and cheese reception on Friday late afternoon, and we were very pleased that there were no sales pitches for the Shell time share properties, which is a common feature when we have stayed at timeshare resorts. It was noisy at night from the street below, but this seemed to be an issue from the reviews for any downtown hotel . It would definitely be our first choice of hotels when we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello was fabulous..Great location,rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: Blondecoyote
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly as it looks on the website. I have never stayed anywhere that this was true. Sometimes I am dissappointed but not this time. The Donatello was even better than we expected. Great location. It is near the shops in Union Square and near the cable car. Lots of restaurants close by. The staff was wonderful and very helpful in getting us transportaion and directions to wherever we wanted to go The room was very spacious and the bed was really comfortable. We had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee. Can't think of anything negative about it. It was the very best and the rates were great. I would definetly stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “Your best choice for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Hipolito_Bouchard
Reviews.Content: What could I say about The Donatello ? Ok, first of all, there is no negative aspect, none. 1. The staff is outstanding. And I mean it. Jesus at the front desk, and the concierges Peter and Miss Almajose were incredible. I had seen this level of human resources in one or two hotels in my life. 2. The location: Perfect location. It is surrounded by Marriott, Nikko, and other hotels. Just a block away from Union Square, near to the Cable Car, BART, everything. Ok, parking has a charge, but you have in and out privileges, so it is a good deal for $25 a day. 3. The building has some years, but the rooms were all renovated, with lcd tv, sound systems, fridge, microwave, coffe makers, etc. The club at the 14th floor is veeeery comfortable, and you can go anytime to have a cup of coffe, chocolate, or tea. If you are lucky, you could find the hed concierge Peter, and have an interesting conversation about almost anything. Regards from Argentina Peter and Miss Almajose ! I was there always bothering them, asking to use their microwave and looking for directions. If you want a service like this, you might found it in some nearby hotel, I am quite sure, but you will spend at least $200, so it is your choice. P.S. If I was ordered to find something bad or just regular, it would be the internet bandwidth, it was too low to stream video and audio via Skype.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmb7t
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful. The staff was one of the best hotel staffs that I have seen. The location is perfect for a variety of interests. The club level is a great part of this hotel as well. We were extremely pleased with this hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise: Great value and terrific location.”
Reviews.Author: WannaGoToASkunkFight
Reviews.Content: Much better than I thought it would be for the money - $135/night for a large studio room with a king bed, amazingly comfortable king sleeper, microwave, fridge, dishes [washed daily by housekeeping], coffee maker, etc. There is also a very cheerful club room on the top floor where you can help yourself to beverages and sit inside on comfortable furniture or outside on chaise lounges. Very clean. Friendly staff. Not a luxury place but I would recommend this for families, business travelers, and anyone conscious of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Elocuphic
Reviews.Content: Had a two night transit stay early Feb 2011, first time in SF, staff were exceptionally helpful, rooms clean and big, only downside was it is a little dated, and no jug/tea/coffee in room, but for the price it still represented exceptional value - location is great in Union Square area. Wouls highly recommend, and definitely would use again. Auckland, NZ

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Queensjad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location, downtown San Francisco, close to attractions and public transportation. The room was a little small, but I'm told that this is normal for such a city. Bathroom wasn't the cleanest when we first arrived, but they maintained it well during the rest of our stay. We got a good deal on pricing through our RCI membership, so I don't know if I would have paid the listed price (that said, San Fran is an expensive city). The restaurant was a little overpriced for the food (or so we thought), but other than that, no real complaints. The roof-top lounge was a great place to have a coffee and read the paper in the morning and the king-size beds were very comfortable! The other perk was the concierge staff- they were EXCELLENT at suggesting places to eat, easy ways to navigate the city, and the best places to view 4th of July fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Marvles
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for sight seeing and shopping. The 'front of house' staff are friendly, welcoming and informative (and so is the conceirge on the top floor). The rooms are a great size and were very clean. There is a 'turn down' service in the evening with a chocolate for each guest, which is a nice touch. Packets of filter coffee are available in the room, which is far more preferable to the more usual powdered variety. We also liked the jar of sweets in the room - didn't eat many but it was a welcoming touch!

Reviews.Title: “great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: dja831sc
Reviews.Content: I read good reviews about this pace and they were very true. Biggest room I've had in San Francisco. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantistic stay”
Reviews.Author: bigvance
Reviews.Content: Once again the Donatello exceeded our expections.....It was my wife's birthday and, once again, the Donatello went out of their way to make us feel like ROALLTY...it was fantistic. THANK YOU DONTELLO. We look forward to our next visit...AND THEIR WILL BE ANOTHER VISIT... THANKS

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great room, helpful staff, excellent location very noisy outside saturday night late!!”
Reviews.Author: Renatabaltimore
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be in a perfect location as my husband had meetings and I could walk everywhere. The staff was very considerate and helpful. The rooms were large and the kitchenette a big help. The concierge floor with terrace and fresh free coffee and tea all day was a big plus. Our only problem was the horrible outside noise on Saturday at 1:00AM. We had requested a quiet room having read previous reviews but it didn't seem to help.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent experience, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: TexanNatureLover
Reviews.Content: The customer service was exceptional. While planning the trip I called the hotel for rental car suggestions (pick up San Francisco and drop off at San Jose airport), Carlos was amazing and set up reservations (only two blocks from the hotel). My husband and I were delayed a day due to airport closing/bad weather and the hotel did not charge us even though we cancelled the day of arrival. When we did arrive we were greeted by friendly knowledgable staff who were able to check us in early. I second all the reviews that rave about the size of room, cleanliness and location. We can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment like rooms with great location”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: Close to Union Square, this hotel has apartment like rooms which is especially good for families. We had a studio at $155 (exc tax) p.n. which was good value given the location. The rooms do have some kitchen appliances like coffee maker and microwave oven. The rooms are decorated with Ikea quality furniture.

Reviews.Title: “This was a quality experience.”
Reviews.Author: Baselscot
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in the Donatello while I was sightseeing in San Francisco and I found it to be a really quality hotel. I'd done my research and having stayed there I believe that it fully justifies it's very high ranking. My room was large and comfortable with all the amenities that I needed plus a couple, like the microwave and the sound system, that I didn't need to use. The staff were very welcoming and professional at all times and if I'm ever in San Francisco again this will be where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel near Union Square - close to all the theatres”
Reviews.Author: california2011
Reviews.Content: i spent 5 days in SF with my husband who was there on business - the great location allowed me to explore the city on my own and return to rest whenever I felt like it. Everyone at the hotel is keen to make your stay a great experience. It was warm enough to enjoy the roof top terrace - the rooms are light and spacious and the windows actually OPEN!!! Good value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for families with children or just about anyone else!”
Reviews.Author: PolaMolaPola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Donatello for 4 nights and it was a perfect stay. I chose this place primarily for the location and also the fact their amenities included a microwave and a small fridge, so I could make simple breakfast and meals for my toddler. It turned out to be more than I asked for! First the location was great. It had the BART, MUNI, and the cable car that would take you up the hills to fisherman's wharf with in very close walking distances, with in a few blocks. It got a bit noisy one part of the night on Saturday but only for about 10 minutes. We were glad that we didn't book a hotel at the Fisherman's Wharf after visiting there... there were so many tourists, and just so congested in general. The Union Square area that Hotel Donatello is in was perfect. Not too far from any of the key places, and most places were very walkable. The service was always prompt and friendly, by everyone including the porter and the concierge. We called the front desk for a taxi at the last minute to get to a wedding, and a limo service was waiting downstairs- and the price was better than what a cab fare would be. The cleaning ladies even washed the dishes I had brought and neatly laid them out to dry on the counter. The rooms were kept clean and neat and they had plenty of closet space. I had read some reviews before the trip about how things look very worn-out, but in reality, there is some wear, but still maintained nicely. I think if you take flash photos of corners of a bathroom floor or walls in any hotels you'd probably see some worn-out areas. This is not a newly constructed hotel, but still up-kept nicely. The kitchenette has a small sink, a coffee maker, a microwave, and a small fridge (no freezer compartment, though). In a small drawer are metal utensils, and up on the shelves are mugs, glasses, bowls and plates. The bed was a bit high but incredibly comfortable. We just had our son sleep in between us, but they do have cribs if you need one. One extra note-- I had left my son's favorite DVD in the room and didn't realize until we got back to the east coast. I called the hotel and they promptly mailed it to me, packaged safely in a cd case and a bubble protected envelope! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: cozmo12
Reviews.Content: Loved the Donatello. Saw everything from this location. Room was outstanding and the staff even better. Evita on the front desk was the complete best. She helped us so much and had the nicest personality. Thank you Evita. And the rest of the staff too. I would always book the Donatello when I go to San Francisco. I cannot wait until I can come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: dr_otto
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful 1 week stay at the Donatello. Room was spacious and comfortable with all the amenities we were after. Location was terrific - walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Great staff was very helpful and friendly. Convenient and reasonable (for SF) parking and a nice lounge/balcony area on the top floor for coffee, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: samson93924
Reviews.Content: Had a great room on the 10 floor with afternoon sun. The room was large, very well appointed and clean. Best of all is the location of the Donatello in SF....just a block from Union Square and walking distance to Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Wow- amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: RachelDuBose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and son for one night. We were treated like royalty from the moment we entered the beautiful valet parking area. This was unexpected, especially given the low room rates. The room was comfy, quiet and cozy. We are definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back again”
Reviews.Author: 4terry70
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Donatell was first class. We were comfortable with 4 persons in one room. Service was excellent from delivering extra towels, to opening the sleeper sofa inthe evening. Wonderfulcustomerservice from each staff member we encountered. I do recommend The Donatello

Reviews.Title: “genuine hospitality, professional personable staff, fab location”
Reviews.Author: RuaDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Our family group stayed 3 nights in the Donatello over the holidays in December and we were so pleased at our choice - for many reasons;- the location is brilliant; the staff all treat the guests as fellow humans rather than mere customers; the room and facilities are very clean, comfortable and spacious; the club room is a very comfortable space to relax in with very helpful team of concierges; we heard no street noise; all dealings for reservation, check in and out were painless- totally satisfactory, would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: abdslk
Reviews.Content: Our king bed room was large and, in addition to a desk and chair, had a couch, easy chair, mini fridge, microwave, bar sink, dishes and silverware...all for the price of a hotel room!! The location in Union Square can't be beat given the number of good restaurants, shopping, art galleries, other activities and access to public transportation very near by. We would go back whenever we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing experience”
Reviews.Author: belice64
Reviews.Content: Everyone treated us royally. The hotel is so centrally located that you can walk to major attractions if you are in good physical shape. A very good value for your money. the free coffee in the morning was definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: angloT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the middle of December based on its high rating on Trip Advisor and weren't disappointed. It's an older, more traditional hotel but everything about it was positive. We'd just flown in from Sydney and were able to check in early, which was a big plus. The hotel was very clean, our room (912) was huge and nicely furnished, and the king size bed was both new and extremely comfortable. Closet space was great and the bathroom was fine. Service from housekeeping and the front desk was excellent (Jesus in particular) - friendly, professional and helpful. There's free internet just off the lobby. It's only a block from Union Square and Powell St, so it's in a great location, yet it doesn't have the crowds. The only issue was that the pipes were quite noisy when someone in another room (or rooms) was using the bathroom - the hotel was aware of it and were investigating to see if there was an air bubble in the system. It might have been a problem if we'd gone to bed early, but as we didn't, it didn't make a difference - we slept like logs. Great hotel, and very good value for the center of San Francisco. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel employee went out of the way to assist me.”
Reviews.Author: rec331
Reviews.Content: Only stayed a couple of nights on this trip and as usual our stay was great! On this stay one employee went above and beyond to make us feel very welcome. My wife has to have a newspaper every day for the crossword puzzle and Sudoku to keep her mind at work. On the morning of our checkout the SF Chronicle hadn't been delivered to the front desk yet so I asked the garage attendant on duty where I could find a local paper for sale. He said, "Here take mine." He had just purchased it himself. He hadn't even read it yet. A few minutes later after I returned to my room to deliver the paper to my wife he called saying that a co-worker had removed the "Sports" section to read himself. I said, "That's OK she doesn't need that section anyway. BUT, once again he delivered that section to my room. He wouldn't take any payment for the paper. Although it doesn't seem like so much it really makes you feel good when someone does something for someone just because........................

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello Hotel: A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: KimRonCormier
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in the city of San Francisco in December of 2010. We searched for several months to find a hotel that was reasonably priced and in a central location to many of the tourist attractions. We had other destinations in California; therefore we rented a car at the airport. Our package deal for this stay included valet parking. Reaching the Donatello from the airport was an easy feat. Upon our arrival we were greeted by a valet and a bellhop. They were extremely courteous and helpful. They provided instructions on checking-in and valet parking the car. We next met with the front desk personnel who were extremely helpful. They provided information on the room and entertained questions about the area. Our interactions with the hotel staff including the front desk, the house keepers and the concierge were always pleasant and professional. The hotel features a club level with concierge and fitness room. Each morning we would double check our plans with the concierge and she would provide input on the proper mode of transportation. The location of the hotel proved to be a great choice. The hotel is two blocks from Union Square (shopping), a block from Powell Street (street car access), about four blocks from Market Street (major shopping district), walking distance to China Town, Little Italy, museums, and Whole Foods. Fisherman’s Wharf can be reached by foot or cable car. We chose one day to walk back and forth to Fisherman’s Wharf. The second day we chose to ride the Hyde/Powell Line Cable Car from Fisherman’s Wharf to a block from the hotel. The hotel is located in a business district with restaurants, convenience stores and other hotels allowing us to feel comfortable with an evening walk. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. We had a microwave, small refrigerator, sink and dishes. This allowed us to save on meals by stopping at Whole Foods and preparing meals in our room. There are sounds of the city outside, but that added to the ambiance of the hotel. We would stay here on another visit to San Francisco. We will also recommend this hotel to family and friends that are planning a San Francisco trip. Ron and Kim Cormier - Louisiana

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTravelerMD
Reviews.Content: A very good value. I found the bed to be particularly nice, which is important to me when I'm traveling. The amenities (refrigerator, microwave, plates, bowls, silverware, wine opener, wine glasses) were also very useful. Three minor quibbles: the bathroom was a bit dated. San Francisco is a very loud city and I could hear some street sounds at night. It's not clear, however, that anything short of a concrete bunker could have kept the noise out. Finally, my room didn't have a desk or any sort of work area.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel at a top location for shopping, chinatown, or just to have fun,”
Reviews.Author: yeungatart
Reviews.Content: We stay in a Studio thru RCI exchange. It has a microwave and small refrig, a sink and utensals for two. definately not for serious cooking. But who needs it when you are in San Francisco with all those great restaurants. There are four or five car rentals within two blocks, but be sure to check out the overnight parking fee. They are expensive. Try to learn the SF public transportation system, they are great, and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ShoreFire
Reviews.Content: We visit SF every Holiday Season to take in the sights and shopping. We've stayed at many different boutique and commercial hotels and The Donatello Hotel far exceeded our expectations. The rooms are incredibly spacious, the beds very comfortable, and the showers had plenty of hot water with great water pressure. We had read in other reviews that it was "noisy" - But we found complaints about taxi's and streetcars pretty silly considering you're in the most bustling part of the city - granted some noise should be expected, BUT we slept like babies! We absolutely loved being just steps from Union Square. Using the Muni system to get around the city is a piece of cake. We took a Trolley to Fisherman's Wharf and the bus to Haight-Ashbury. Another plus is the Donatello Hotel's parking fee which is $28 pls tx - that's a bargain compared to some of their competitors. Finally we want to especially thank Jesus at the Desk - He couldn't have been more warm, friendly and helpful - It's great to have a "face" to a place and Jesus made our stay at The Donatello even more memorable & enjoyable - Thanks Jesus - We'll be planning our next stay at The Donatello Hotel again "For Shore" - J & C Shore of CA

Reviews.Title: “Travelling again for business, I'd probably stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: RItravelller
Reviews.Content: An earlier review (lcf-guy) has it exactly right. It's a fine hotel (3.5/5 stars on my personal scale), but there are some drawbacks for the business traveller: wireless is VERY SLOW (albeit free, which is nice), and the rooms lack a usable work space (no real desk). The room was nice enough, but the decoration scheme and furniture could use an update. The couch was uncomfortable; the TV was hard to see in its cabinet. Overall, there are nicer hotels in San Francisco at this price, so I don't think I'll stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good time at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Tredelerch1848
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in San Francisco many times, usually at the St. Francis, but for this trip the latter was too pricey and I found the Donatello. The price was right and the hotel was great with friendly staff, a concierge level with a very helpful staff who patiently found restaurants for us and even booked it for us. The small bar was very pleasant and the live jazz was excellent. I read many of the reviews for this hotel and saw a few negative ones so I was rather concerned about my choice at first. What I experienced however was very good and we found the room clean and staff very helpful. One review did mention excessive street noise and there is a club nearby that can be quite noisy but with windows tightly closed it was OK. In reality I have even found the St. Francis very noisy during some stays.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous atmosphere, room was beautiful! Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Redhead692041
Reviews.Content: We were totally happy with everything at the hotel and the concierge was extremely helpful in helping us get started in seeing the beautiful city of San Francisco. This was our first visit and we were very limited on time. We only had three full days, bot we even managed to get up to NAPA valley. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: jjcoleman
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Donatello made my stay in SF great. The beds were unusually comfortable,especially for a hotel. The staff treated me like I was important.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: Gary20636
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Francisco and we went the week after Thanksgiving. We utilized a time share exchange and it was a bargain. The hotel is one block from Union Square and the Powell St cable car, five blocks to Westfield Shopping Center and the Market St streetcar line, nine blocks to Chinatown. And these are all small blocks, so it is within easy walking distance. We did not "fine dine", but we found plenty of good places to eat on a budget. If you are driving, prepare to pay $32 per day to park. This is just the way it is in San Francisco. If you plan on public transportation while visiting, buy a multi-day or weekly pass . Also, if driving, watch for pedestrians. If you see anyone crossing with the light, it is probably a tourist. The staff was friendly and we had no complaints about our stay. Enjoy your visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but too noisy the entire night (street noise)”
Reviews.Author: cdhtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was on 5th floor facing the street. We stayed two nights and probably got a total of about 2-3 hours good-but-interrupted sleep each night. Even though the location is GREAT, so close to Union Square, shopping, theaters, etc, the street noise and almost constant noise day and night (fire/sirens, noisy garbage collectors/trucks, horns, drunken/loud homeless people ALL through the entire night) does not make this a comfortable or restful place to stay. If you pretty much DIE when you sleep, then fine. If you are easily woken by ANY kind of noise, then it will be a battle. I took TWO sleeping pills the second night, and was still woken up by drunken, loud homeless people at 2:30 am. It didnt help that one of our windows had a poor fit, making it impossible to completely close (but we tried our best) I honestly cannot say that a quieter room exists here - but I would definitely ask for the highest possible floor and IN THE BACK of the hotel, NOT street side. And be prepared to stuff cotton in your ears if you are even a slightly-light sleeper like myself. Other than this (!?) clean hotel, nice room amenities, fairly spacious room for SF, great location.

Reviews.Title: “best value, cleanest rooms in the city”
Reviews.Author: noon28rick
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the city this year, we stayed at the kensington park hotel, which was across the street from the donatello. The room at the donatello was much nicer, it looked like everything was new, the carpet, furnishings, etc. The kensington park just looked old. Staff here was the friendliest i have ever seen, everybody and i mean everybody was friendly. Parking was only $28 a day, which is cheap in s.f. Located 1 block from cable cars and union square, shopping center was 2 blocks away. They have a large balcony on top floor, but not really much of a view, tall buildings all around block it. Balcony would be nice on a warmer day though. Only thing bad i can say was internet was spotty if you could get on, someone had been stealing the routers out of the hallways, there was just one on the other end of my floor, and the routers on the floor above and below were gone. They said a new vendor was taking over 1st of year, and all would be fixed. So yes I would stay here again, and I'm sure i will.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: EllynGreen
Reviews.Content: The Donatello has become our go to hotel in San Francisco. The staff is always friendly, the rooms are spacious and the location can't be beat...just one block from the greatest shopping in the city. We particularly appreciate the small hotel feeling with big hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with luxurious, super-clean rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller8717
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved our stay at The Donatello; the rooms were very spacious with comfy beds and great pillows (and normally I'm super fussy). Bathroom was always immaculately cleaned; all the staff were very friendly and helpful with directions. The location was great, a few blocks from Union Square and all the best shopping, and there was a great Thai restaurant just up the block, right near a laundromat too which was perfect for us. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good value in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sruffs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. When I booked the hotel we got the parking package so we weren't stung paying an additional $30 - $35 a night. Even with the parking included we got a reasonable rate, much cheaper than other hotels we had stayed in previously. The hotel is in a great location - just a very short walk from Union Square. We had no problems checking in and were greeted by very polite and friendly staff. Having stayed in San Francisco several times before I was expecting the room to be quite small. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a nice spacious room with a mini kitchen ( a fridge, microwave and small sink), a king size bed and an additional seating area with a sofa and large chair. The room was nicely maintained and very clean. We had a large flat screen TV and also complimentary WiFi. The only slight negative was that the shower seemed to be a bit old. It took a while for the water to heat up and the jets of water coming out were not very strong. The room was cleaned to a high standard daily and each evening we were offered a turn down service which we declined but we were always given a couple of chocolates anyway. There was a restaurant but we didn't eat in it. We did order room service one evening and the food was very nice and delivered promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mariner59
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a week in San Francisco for holidays, staying at the Donatello. Arrived early from Australia and given room very quickly, no questions asked. Evita at the front desk is fantastic. We had a corner room on the 9th floor (although appears to be no level 2/3/4, so not sure it really was 9th). Very spacious, well equipped. Fridge, microwave, wifi Breakfast served in room, no onsite, so we ate at Pinecrest, Cafe Mason, David's Deli (including dinner at the last 2), all within a block. Good value for money, and very happy with the quality of food. American breakfast coffee is appalling - always filter coffee, topped up constantly, and just awful. We could not find anywhere that did genuine cappucino or latte with breakfast. Evita steered us to Encore cafe, diagonally opposite the Donatello, which did very good coffee, with a range of beans including Yergacheffe, Sumatran, Ethiopian, etc. Best coffee (and pastries) is in North Beach (Little Italy) at Stella Pastries on Columbus Avenue, where you can also access the wifi from Hotel Boheme next door. Very easy access to and from SFO via BART to Powell and easy walk to Donatello. Everyone helpful, never any concerns for safety. We took buses everywhere - Haight Ashbury, Golden Gate, Golden Gate Park, Legion of Honour. These and the Cable Car just minutes away. Biggest downside to this hotel - which I suspect would be the same everywhere near Union Square - is the street noise. We were then on Black Friday, and so a holiday weekend. Everyone seems to drive with one hand on their horn, and late night revelers seem happy to give a character reference to their friends at the top of their voice at 2am. Take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Otherwise just accept this is life in a big city and you will go back to sleep in the enormous comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! A night to repeat!!”
Reviews.Author: SueMarie52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had some points to use with our timeshare and were able to book a night at The Donatello in San Francisco. It was a wonderful experience from beginning to end. We took BART over from our East Bay home, walked the 10 minutes to the hotel, checked in and went to our room. We were delighted with the size and lay-out of the room. It opened up to a balcony, which we didn't use due to the weather, but were impressed to see. Before we headed out for our dinner, we went up to The Club level, which houses a nice lounge and a small, but adequate fitness area, spa, jacuzzi, dry heat saunas, etc. Then we stopped in the hotel bar for a drink, with half-off well drinks during the happy hour. It was very cozy and the bartender was friendly. This hotel is located in a great area of San Francisco. It is a block away from Union Square, which means it is close to shopping, live theatre, and restaurants galore. It is easily accessible by BART or car. The Powell Street cable car, that runs down to Fisherman's Wharf, is within walking distance (right outside the BART station). We will return and bring friends!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with good staff”
Reviews.Author: zuari
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Donatello while I attended a conference at a nearby hotel. This one had terrific and friendly staff who allowed you to print off 8-10 pages at the business center computer for free; the downside was that the in-room wireless was pretty mediocre, kept going out on me. More pluses: location, near Union Square and near fantastic SF food. The concierge on the 16th floor was helpful, and the view up there was good. Negatives were that the rooms were *not* triple-glazed and much of the busy nightlife could be heard. We slept well, though others might want earplugs. And the bed was soft (too soft for me). Nevertheless, the room itself was very spacious and very thoroughly cleaned and turned down every day.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has got it all -stay there you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Olivertwit
Reviews.Content: Arrived safely at the Donatello for a late check in from SFO by taxi, despite the fact the cab driver hadn't heard of the hotel located just one block from Union Square! Check in by the friendly front desk staff was easy and I was pleased to find the quiet room, located on the 6th floor, was clean& spacious with a large king size bed, a "kitchen area" with microwave, sink and coffeemaker. The 37 inch cable TV could be viewed from a comfortable put u up. The entrance lobby area contained a wardrobe with a safe and ironing board. Adjacent to the lobby/entrance was a fully specified small bathroom including a telephone. The club room located on the top 16th floor had a very helpful Concierge. In the clubroom was a comfortable seating area with 'free'local newspapers and coffee and tea facilities. I did not use the adjacent fitness room. I enjoyed eating in the restaurant where the food and wine quality was excellent. All in all this 6 night package proved to very good value considering the location of the hotel, the space of the room and its facilities and very friendly and attentive staff & service. So I'll be back despite the 10 hour flight from he UK. I just hope the Donatello don't put their prices up

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable, efficient, and superb location”
Reviews.Author: clel3
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in San Francisco. It is comfortable and roomy with more than adequate amenities.
