The location is just right for all the downtown features of the City including theater, shopping, restaurants, nightlife etc. etc. You have everything you need in a hotel for either a short of long term stay. Everyone on staff seem there for your comfort and convenience. Street noise can be a little annoying when there is a lot of street activity but it does not diminish the positives.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets - superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loviehowell
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Donatello, San Francisco. The bed and linens were clean and comfortable. The room was spacious and well-kept. The staff was welcoming, knowledgable of San Francisco, and very helpful. This hotel deserves its four stars. If you plan to eat at the restaurant, Zingari, allow plenty of time...but the food was excellent! As sightseers, we couldn't have choosen a better location. Everything we wanted to see in San francisco was easily accessed by the cable car two blocks away, and the Donatello's Concierge helped us navigate the city like pros!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value, excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DaisyErie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my elderly parents in an adjoining room. Our reservations were flawless. Medical needs fully accomodated. Convenient parking, large attractive room, perfect location 1 block from Union Square! Will definitely return. Poldi, the Club floor Concierge, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. She has menus for every restaurant and will make reservations for you with a smile! The only negatives were: 1. You can only get breakfast by ordering room service. Oatmeal is a packet of Quaker Oatmeal. Go out instead. 2. Street noise from Ruby Skye? across the street (Mason). Clinking bottles at 4am as they pick up the recycling. We are not used to street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, but some drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: Rauz
Reviews.Content: I like this property and the people there, so that is a big plus. Parking was reasonable, so there's another. The rooms are nice, but the room I had was super noisy from the street below. Closing the windows didn't seem to help. This isn't really the fault of the hotel, just location maybe, but to be fair, I've stayed at other downtown hotels, e.g. Hilton towers just up the road, and the outside noise was negligible. This one issue is probably enough to make me think twice about recommending this property. Also, the heating system is ancient - loud blowing that can only be remedied by turning off the fan and the heat (don't most systems turn themselves off when the desired temp is reached? But it evened out as the loud heater noise somewhat drowned out the partiers outside. Only thing is I called the front desk to ask about the climate control and he was clueless, stating it was an engineering issue. Really? You need an engineer to help me with the thermostat? C'mon now.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, made Great by fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: LauraMott
Reviews.Content: We ended out Californian road-trip with 3 days in San Francisco. I booked the Donatello having read the good reviews on TripAdvisor and other travel sites. We were not disappointed! From the frist greeting by Joe the porter we were made to feel super "at home". Joe became a firm favourite with both my daughters, and one month on they are still talking about "How cool Joe was" (a big thumbs up from an 11 year old and a 9 year old!). All the staff we had contact with at the Donatello were top rate, friendly, helpful and making sure that any problems we had were dealt with immediatly - our phone in the room did not work when we arrived and a man came within 5 minutes to fix it. Joe and Maryanne stand out for superb customer service, but all the staff were lovely. The rooms were clean, big enough for the 4 of us to be comfortable and the beds were super comfortable. The top floor guest area is a nice touch and it was nice to sit and have a drink and listen to the bustle of the city getting ready for the evening on the roof terrace. the hotel is central to the shops and sights of SF, so location is good. We were lucky enough to be in SF when the Giants won the "World Series" - the dowwnside of this was that our first night (the winning night) was probably a little nosier than usual (parties in the street!). We didn't mind - we went and joined in with the locals - GREAT FUN! We got the desk to book us a car back to the airport which was as cheap as a taxi and a lot nicer. Joe came and said his goodbyes - I thought the girls were going to cry! If we are ever back in SF (I do hope so) we would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific downtown hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sspencerinmd
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms with great amenities for the solo or family traveler in the guest rooms. A wonderful find and great value near other more pricey hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: Vhrojas
Reviews.Content: Warm greeeting at the front desk, spacious, spotless, nice room with a very comfortable bed and cool terrace. The service is simply excellent, they really put their efforts in making your stay very pleasant. Free wireless in the room and all areas of the Hotel. Good price for such a great hotel. The location is very convenient, it is really close to Union Square and nice restaurants, one block away from the cable car stop and nearby Chinatown. No doubts about recommending it to others. We will return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find in Downtown San Fran”
Reviews.Author: CelineCeline
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Donatello after having spent 4 nights at another hotel for a conference. The Donatello is centrally located in the heart of downtown about a block from union square, with tons of shopping and restaurants, all within walking distance. The rooms are well appointed, clean, and comes with a small empty mini-fridge, microwave, and kitchen plates/utensils, and a small bar sink that you can use. Although the hotel is a little older, it's well kept and in good condition.Staff are very friendly and helpful. And....wireless internet....free! The way it should be in this day and age! By comparison, the Marriott Marquis, the hotel we stayed at before coming here, charged $15/day for wired internet. We rented a car for the last half of our trip and required parking, which cost $28 plus tax per day for valet. Although this is expensive where we come from, it seems to be a reasonable rate for San Fran (compared to the $55 at the Marriott Marquis). Overall, great value for your money. If we are in San Fran again, we will be returning. One more thing....Honey Honey cafe is just a block away on Post and their breakfast is excellent!! I am still craving those crepes!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Ric
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy to get around San Francisco from this base. The hotel rooms are large and well equipped, the fridge etc. gives you that extra flexibility. The rooms were clean and maid service every day. Our barman gave us plenty of ideas on where to go and things to do. Our only gripe was that housekeeping wanted to start cleaning the rooms at 8 a.m. every day and wouldn't take no for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: aurorasev
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, free Wifi, spacious well-appointed rooms, complimentary tea/ coffee in lovely lounge and an excellent location - what else could one ask?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LCP66
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Very close to Union Square and all the shopping. We took a long scenic walk to Pier 39 and took the cable car back. Staff was excetionally friendly and attentive. The only critisism is the house wine at happy hour. Great stay. We would definetly stay there again with out a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Brief but Perfect Stay at The Donatello”
Reviews.Author: rusticpress
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Donatello Hotel in San Francisco on November 6-9, 2010. It has the perfect location next to Union Square, the Cable Cars and Chinatown and the service is strictly first-class. The staff was thoroughly helpful and friendly from the moment I arrived on Saturday to my departure early Tuesday morning when the bell captain hailed a cab for me and got me to the Amtrak station on time. The price can’t be beat given the location of the hotel and the clean, spacious, well-appointed room with all the conveniences. Unlike the pricey high rises in the area, The Donatello remains close enough to earth so I could enjoy the wonderful sights and sounds of downtown San Francisco from my perch on the ninth floor. I couldn’t be happier. I’ve already recommended The Donatello to family and friends and I hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms, Lobby and Bar a Bit Dated but the Location and Value Make It a Good Find”
Reviews.Author: SalsaPicante78
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the Financial District and I think on future business trips I will stay closer to the Tenderloin and Union Square where the Donatello is located, there is so much going on. However, I am not sure that this would be my hotel of choice. The rooms are fine but the color palette, TV and amenities are all a little dated. Mustard orange and powder blue, hard candies in a jar, carpet circles for me to play with on the floor, I felt like I was at my Grandma's house in Detroit. The room does have a mini fridge, microwave, coffee pot and free Wi-Fi (although it is a bit slow). The staff was gracious and the parking was reasonable for San Fran. If you do stay here, check out the Hidden Vine across the street. It's a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenjohn
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the Donatello before. It is a superb hotel, very friendly. A warm welcome from Jesus at the desk, comfortable room (mini kitchen with microwave and crockery for 2). Comfortable Club on top floor with very helful Concierge, free coffee, gymn, sauna, massage. Perfect position on Union Sq.Best place in SF under $300. Get a deal on line.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central, well-eqipped”
Reviews.Author: loneranger70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located near Union Square but is quiet (with windows shut). It is adequately eqipped for self-catering and is very comfortably furnished and fitted out.The staff are responsive and pleasant. I enjoyed staying there and would recommend it to others who like to be independent.The only negative was a hassly ride to the airport with the airport shuttle service they use.

Reviews.Title: “well-deserved praise”
Reviews.Author: TracyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked two stays, one before and one after a meeting we attended in town because we didn't want to pay the high rate at the meeting hotel. We were delighted with our stay at the Donatello. The rooms are exceptionally functional, with a small fridge, bar sink, microwave, coffee maker, and coffee cups/plates/silverware enough for the two of us. We had an inner courtyard room which was quiet, and although we were near the elevator, we didn't hear anything during the night. While a section of carpet leading out to the little porch was a bit worn, it did not detract from our stay. For the price and location, this will be our first choice for lodging in San Francisco in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel very near union square”
Reviews.Author: CoTyronereviewer
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed or expectations. it extremely convenient t o union square, just one block with plenty of restaurants and bars near by. the hotel is very claen and confortable, rooms are large and airy and the fitness club adds an additionla benefit. would definitely reccommend. Dont take a car to San Fran... no need and also parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: praryflower
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the customer service we received during our stay. When we needed anything, we receive prompt and curteous service. We were always asked if we needed directions or any help to get around to different attractions. All of the staff was extremely polite and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-around city hotel”
Reviews.Author: drp528
Reviews.Content: Most important to my wife and I was the Donatello's location right off Union Square - without a car we were able to walk to most of the city's neighborhoods and tourist destinations. Aside from that we found the service to be very pleasant and the rooms spacious, clean, and reasonably priced. We would definitely stay at the Donatello again.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in SF”
Reviews.Author: dianetauzer
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is by far the best kept secret in SF. We came the night before the Giants World Series Parade and were only there for 1 night. Because of that we were not looking for luxury but for inexpensive but not too creepy being we wanted to be near Market and Mission the heart of the Tenderloin. We ended up with the best of both: quality luxury and a great price. Such a great surprise. The room was very spacious with a queen sofa that my 23 and 27 year old slept on and a very nice comfortable king bed. We have stayed in many places in SF over the years and opt for the more expensive and luxurious such as the Grand Hyatt (which is around the corner). Though the room was not quite as luxurious everything else was :The service, the restaurant food, the front desk, the valet service. was as good or surpassed. There is an intimacy here that eludes the other hotels. After the parade and lunch my husband and I returned not willing to brave the city with the million others. Even though well past check out we were cordially received and sent up to the Club level where we able to lounge comfortably with complimentary beverages.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello Hotel for 4 nights (October 29 - November 2). It is only one block from Union Square with easy access to transportation including the BART, cable cars, and buses (we didn't have a car). We were welcomed by Jesus on our arrival and he could not have made us feel any better about our choice of hotels. We were about 3 hours early for check-in, but Jesus said our room was ready to go. The room itself is very clean and good size. There is a club level where you can get coffee/tea, read the paper, or just hang out. Just outside the club level, there is a balcony for views of the surrounding area, There is a fitness center, concierge service, and Internet access just off the lobby. Everyone there was so friendly. Like several others mentioned, there is a club across the street (Ruby Skye) which was pretty noisy late at night but that was to be expected on Halloween weekend and with the Giants winning the World Series. Fortunately we had asked for a room away from the street and that paid off. Thanks to other TA contributors for making that suggestion. I really enjoyed out stay at the Donatello Hotel and will return there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go there again”
Reviews.Author: northern101
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you want to stay in downtown SF (close to Union Square), nice, spacious rooms and super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- very large room”
Reviews.Author: l0vet0travelCalgary
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Club Donatello, Oct. 2010. The location is excellent and the rooms are very large. Note that the "Club" and the "Hotel" are not exactly the same. Our room was in "The Club" part of the hotel with 2 double beds. Beds were extremely comfortable, lighting in the room could've been better. The bathroom was a little out-dated but otherwise it was great. The concierge was very friendly and very helpful. Only concern that we had was at check-in we were told that our room included breakfast but when we checked out, the breakfast was added to out bill. It was taken off but it would've been nice to avoid that confusion in the first place. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello Hotel made our first trip to San Francisco so nice!”
Reviews.Author: pamr48
Reviews.Content: We spent our first day in Sacramento (Embassy Suites Riverwalk - really good hotel - great breakfast!), second day in Fairfield at the Staybridge Suites (also pretty good) in order to be closer to Napa for our Napa Valley Wine Train lunch the next day. Then on to San Francisco and The Donatello! Everywhere we went people asked us where we were staying and EVERYONE knew about the Donatello and said how nice it is - and they were right! Valet parking - simple and fast (but expensive - $28/day), check in fast - altho our front desk person (Bobby) didn't give us a great room. First we were going to be on the 10th Floor, but when he heard it was our first time in San Fran, he moved us to a "better" room on the 7th floor. We got to the room and excitedly ran to the window to see the beautiful view of......the backs and roofs of a lot of other buildings!! I'm still not sure how this was better than the 10th floor, but.... The room was really large and well laid out. Huge closet in the entry hall with plenty of room to put up a luggage rack and still get into the closet. Nice bathroom and shower. The room itself was interesting, big bed, couch, chair, cocktail table, TV cabinet was also the dresser - a big unit on either side of the TV with doors and lots of shelves. The kitchenette was kind of a pain - it was a unit with one sliding door, so either the sink and cupboard with dishes and glassware was open, or the side with the microwave and compact refrigerator. It worked out OK - we were only there for coffee in the AM and perhaps an adult beverage in the evening after a long day of sightseeing. The bell captain gave us great advice about where to get a quick hamburger our first night - The Daily Grille - very close and very good. The only problem we had was with the internet, evidently, someone got into the hotel and stole the servers on several floors (including ours) so we had no internet for the last 2 of our 3 days there! Kind of odd. All in all it was a great stay - make sure to visit the piano bar on the 2nd floor - nice bartender and really good piano player and jazz singer! Also ate at the Tadich Grill in the Financial District - oldest restaurant in SF - had a wonderful Cosmopolitan salad with about a pound of lump crabmeat and tons of shrimp over different veggies including lettuce - really good. We had so much fun - I didn't leave my heart there, but I would sure love to go back again sometime - and I would definitely stay at The Donatello again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before and will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mexicoamigo
Reviews.Content: Super location. Large comfortable rooms. Coffee maker, mini frige, microwave, lots of storage. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable-affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: akg4909
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for a wedding in San Francisco. The hotel staff was very helpful and available and the decor was modern and interesting. Our room was equipped with small appliances and utensils, in addition to plenty of storage space and a safe. The upstairs lounge is a nice feature. The location was a huge advantage-we had limited time in the city and were able to see many sights on foot in just an hour-long walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bella85033
Reviews.Content: The service compares to none other from the people at the front desk to maid service. The hotel is located in a perfect spot and 1 block from Union Square and restaurants all along the way. The staff at The Donatello make you feel right at home the minute you walk into the lobby and you are treated like old friends. We love staying here and return often because of the wonderful staff and hotel accomodations. The Zangari Restaurant is just off the lobby and the cuisine is superb. The lounge offers great food, drinks and wonderful entertainment. I am already planning my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in fabulist location”
Reviews.Author: ak8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Donatello recently for 2 nights as part of honeymoon trip, room was spotless , v big studio with outdoor patio, had not expected such a big room, location is fantastic right in heart of city two mins from union square, cable car, theatre district and as my new wife will testify fantastic shopping , this hotel far exceeded our hopes and expectations and I cannot recommend it highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: MarMourinho
Reviews.Content: These hotel is just very well located and that's all. The beds are old, not smoth and confortable has you expect to find in an hotel. The carpet is cleaned but it's washed up colour doesn't make you confortable about it. The TV is quite old also the bedroom. It is a hotel of the 80's who didn´t the renovations, the atmosphere is classic and decadent, dark. The price, though not very expensive, is completely inadequate for the offer quality's.

Reviews.Title: “We can not WAIT to stay at the Donatello again.”
Reviews.Author: batelohim83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Francisco for our three year anniversary. We stayed just one night, but the next morning, we did not want to leave. The service was wonderful, we felt like the staff were our friends, celebrating with us. The room was gorgeous, the bed more comfortable than my bed at home! We walked everywhere we went, and will definitely stay at The Donatello the next time we go to San Francisco! We would go there to stay even if we had no other San Francisco plans.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyontheroad
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest, but a great place to stay if you want to be at the centre of everything in this great city. Clean and spacious rooms, very attentive room servicing, well equipped room, helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff @ Great location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam1982
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Donatello Hotel for 2 nights an it was an great experience. The hotel staff was VERY helpfull an made our stay at San Francisco great. The hotel is at a great location near the city center an from walking distance to Union Square. The room was great with an terras an i would recommend a stay at The Donatello to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PaulKim
Reviews.Content: We live in the Bay Area, but wanted to celebrate our 20th anniversary in San Francisco. We found the Donatello online and got a good price. The Hotel is part of a resort program and that makes it less like a traditional hotel. They were very very friendly (quite surprising to me and I travel a lot). The hotel room was a nice modern looking room with plenty of space. The location is great - right off Union Square on the corner of Post and Mason. They have a nice spa upstairs with jacuzzi and exercise equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: cyclemike11
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and goes out of their way to offer any assistance you might need. Even though I didn't need anything special, they made me feel like an important guest. Nice rooms, free wireless internet and a great location. I will definitely stay there again next time I go to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: legends1958
Reviews.Content: We visited San Francisco for our honeymoon and chose this hotel for its value for money and location - the price we paid for the Donatello was very reasonable compared to a lot of hotels in San Francisco especially in the Union Square area. We stayed for 4 nights in total. Our room was on the 8th floor and was a lovely spacious room including a fridge, coffee machine, flatscreen TV, safe, iron and plenty of storage space. There was even a turndown service provided every evening. I have noticed a few people commenting on the rooms being noisy due to street noise however during our stay, this was not an issue as we barely noticed any noise. All staff were very pleasant and happy to help with any questions we had. On the top floor of the hotel was a 'club lounge' which had free tea and coffee, a lounge, terrace, gym and jacuzzi all included in the price of the room. We didn't eat in the restaurant however we did visit the bar once and would recommend you go at 'happy hour' as drinks could be pricey outside of then. All in all, this was a great hotel and if we visit San Francisco again we would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Noisest place we've ever been”
Reviews.Author: SailorSteve123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the Donatello in room 701. The room overlooked a nightclub which stayed open until 3:00AM. At 3:30AM, they begin emptying the empty bottles into a dumpster, then about 4:30, people come by in their pick up trucks to take the bottles from the dumpster and throw them into their pickups. We were supposed to stay 3 nights, but since we got absolutely no sleep, we left after two. The room was arranged so that it was impossible to watch TV from the sofa. Since it was impossible to sleep, it would have been nice to be able to have a comfortable place to watch TV. We will definitely never go back. Steve, Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello is a beautiful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: kwattenbarger
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to the Donatello for a quick trip to the city. We chose this hotel again because of it's great location to shopping, theaters, and restaurants. From the hotel you can walk just about any where.

Reviews.Title: “A very good 3 stars in a 5 stars location”
Reviews.Author: From_South
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights last September. One block from Union Square. Only con: Street noise, cars and people.(Corner room, facing Post St, 5th floor) Certainly would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mmvinnyt
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze. I asked about the wine reception they have on Fridays, and we had just missed it. The receptionist asked if we were celebrating anything. I said it's my girlfriend's birthday. He responded with "What kind of wine would you like? Red, white, or champagne." I was astounded... "Red." "Alright sir, we'll bring that up to your room." Wow. Upstairs was the club room: a great rooftop terrace with a great view of the city. You can chill up there and watch TV, as well as grab some hot coffee and tea. We also brought some wine up there and relaxed, and the concierge was not only friendly, he was cool with us bringing our own wine. He said we can also order from the restaurant below and they'll bring it up to us in the club room. Location: ONE block means ONE block away from Union Square. The location was fantastic and was within walking distance to any place we wanted to go in the city. And of course, there are plenty of bus lines available. The room was a lot bigger than I expected, and of course came with a small kitchenette where we made instant noodles for late nights after partying. My only complaint was the noise on Post St because our window was facing that way. We didn't mind it much because we knew the large windows (which were awesome btw) would pose that problem. There's a lot of channels on the TV with none of that Lodgenet crap, but with direct access to the channels when you turn the TV on. There is also a decent boombox to play the radio, or hook up your mp3 player (if you have the right cable 3.5mm to RCA). I come prepared with all audio cables, so we took advantage of that and pumped ourselves up blasting the ipod loud before we go out. This hotel is great if you want to accommodate friends coming over and hanging out, which we did. They didn't like their hotel much, so they came over to ours and hung out there. They don't charge extra for more than 2 occupants, so that's plus there. And it's a vacation rental (timeshare unit), and I wasn't bombarded by salespeople trying to sell me their timeshare. Overall great hotel, and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, contemporary rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: rilytravel
Reviews.Content: Rooms had good space and comfortable amenities. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Reasonable value for its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Read 143 positive reviews - this makes it 144! So happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: lnfdogrescue
Reviews.Content: This was a "bucket list" trip to CA - we were sure we wouldn't return so it was important that this trip went well. I read so many reviews before I booked I made myself dizzy. The Donatello had 143 positive reviews so I picked them & I'm so glad I did! The place is ALL about service & they made every day - we stayed 5 days -- a happy event. Highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable, large room in great location in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: ZeniasGirl
Reviews.Content: The Donatello hotel is located near Union Square, so it's handy to bus lines, restaurants, stores and the cable car routes. My husband and I took our 13-year old grandson for his first trip to San Francisco. We had a large room (they say 400 sq. ft), with a king size bed, sleeper couch, large screen TV with DVD player. Free internet access. There was a mini-kitchen area (part of the main room) with a small refrigerator, a microwave and a few plates, cups, glasses, etc. Not the kind of place you could cook, but we were able to bring home and eat leftovers for dinner one evening, and could store drinks and snacks for the grandson. Staff was friendly and responsive to requests. We paid about $150/night, a great price. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: thedawsongroup
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly, rooms were spacious and clean with comfy beds and located in great location. We would absolutely recommend and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: atsm
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the favourable reviews, the room was large clean and comfortable, service was friendly, the club lounge was great, concierge helpful and location was excellent. Got a room on 10th floor, no noise and slept well. Coffee maker was useful and I would definitely stay again. Didnt use the fitness centre, jacuzzi or sauna that were all available foc.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: luvou58
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that I stayed in strictly because of trip advisor's recommendation. The oversize king room was very clean, with lots of amenities. I appreciated the nightly turn down service, the kitchenette in the room with nice dishes and flatware (just in case you didn't want to eat your delivery dinner out of a box), the in room safe, and the furnishings. The nightly live jazz in the hotel restaurant and bar was excellent. This will be my hotel of choice for future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “I used to saty at Clift but this is now my favorite hotel! I will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Alexis95814
Reviews.Content: I frequent Ruby Skye and have most often stayed at the Clift. The Donatello Hotel came highly recommended from a good friend. I finally heeded my friend's advice and booked a room here last Friday. We were welcomed by two friendly and unpretentious staff behind the counter and checked in in little over two minutes. They told us about the club level, jacuzzi and fitness room on the top floor. I wish I would have known and brought my sneakers (next time). We had a fabulous room on the 5th floor. I think it was twice the size as the last room we stayed in at the Frank. Large king-sized bed, big pull-out couch, no hotel smell upon entry, and a wet bar stocked with a mini fridge and the most delicious Wolfgang Puck coffee I have tasted. The only drawback: while they did have a CD player, there was no ipod connection. We remedied this dilemma with a quick trip to Rasputin's (FYI Virgin on Market is closed). The club level was a nice surprise; complete with complimentary coffee and tea and again a knowledgeable and friendly employee. This hotel is not the W or St. Regis but it is absolutely comfortable and worth the money. I recommend this hotel for anyone looking for an affordable place to stay near Union Square (only one block up on Post Street).

Reviews.Title: “Great position - a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: drysGeelong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Donatello for 2 nights when visiting San Francisco. This hotel is great value and in an unbeatable position - just a short walk to Union Square and the Powell Street Trolley line. The staff are really helpful and the rooms quite large and comfortable. The only minus is that it's somewhat noisy at night which I guess is to be expected in such a central location. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Donatello to anyone visiting this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service & Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Armand35
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about how great everyone was, extremely courteous, helpful, pleasant, go out of there way to make sure everything was right at all times. From the Bell Hop, the Front Desk, the Parking Garage attendee, to the House Keeper. The Lounge and the Restaurant included, plus the food was FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a godd location”
Reviews.Author: fireguy329
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while vacationing in San Franscico. It was a very good location right near the Powell street trolly car line. Lots of restraunts in the area and a short walk to Union Square. The staff at the hotel were outstanding. Very helpful with any questions we had for them. The room itself is an average hotel room which could use some updating. It was clean and comfortable. If a taxi were needed to get to fishermans warf the cost is around $12 if you don't have time to take the Trolly. Make Time for that experience. Easy access to the area via the BART from the airport. Hotel is about a ten minute walk from its exit point. Bring a map of the hotel location if you choose that option.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location, great staff attention”
Reviews.Author: SteveBlueBellPA
Reviews.Content: Two blocks for Union Square, far better quality location than today's Wharf area, that is if you like food and shopping over honky-tonk and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M021958
Reviews.Content: Stayed there based on the reviews from Tripadvisor. Great hotel, staff great, room was great and the bed was excellent. The shower was old and it was like standing under a high pressure hose, but other than that it is a great place to stay. They have live Jazz every night which was great and it is in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PaulM2755
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is in a super location, a block from Union Square and within yards of some great restaurants - however their own restaurant should not be missed, superb Italian based food. The jazz in the bar was great and definitely sets the hotel apart from many others. The room was very spacious and clean with all the amenities you would expect plus a microwave. It can be a little noisy but you are pretty much slap bang in the middle of Union Square so its to be expected. Staff were very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly, particularly the concierge and check-in staff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is EXTRAORDINARY at the Donatello!”
Reviews.Author: heyjudestr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Donatello in San Francisco was truly extraordinary. The staff was not only welcoming, but very knowledgeable and catered to our every wish! We ate at the restaurant and were thoroughly delighted at the variety of the menu, and we enjoyed the entertainment in the lounge. The room was immaculate; the bed very comfortable, the pillows too! We had a room with a terrace that really made the room special! The central location made it very easy for us to use public transportation to take in all the sights with ease of travel. We are looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A very good option at reasonable prices by SF standards”
Reviews.Author: Liilak
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it came up as one of the most reasonable options within a certain category. We opted for a room at the so-called Club Donatello, since this was actually a cheaper option than the Donatello proper, but to be honest we had no idea what the difference was. Needless to say, we were surprised when we were given a suite with great views, lots of space and a huge bed, right next to the Presidential Suite. That really set the tone for what turned out to be a great stay in a lovely city. I assume the hotel has seen better day, since it had that sort of faded grandeur look to it, but still as I said the room was great, the staff professional and attentive and the location hard to beat. I can't speak for the rooms that belong to the other floors, but if you're looking for a very nice hotel without spending a fortune, you can do no wrong with the Donatello. Downsides: the bathroom was a bit worn out, but it was perfectly reasonable anyway.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: bigvance
Reviews.Content: It was our 30th Wedding Anniver, and it could not have been a better one. The hotel staff were all outstanding, the room was wonderful, and I wish anyone that plans a trip to San Francisco to consider The Donatello for their place to stay. It is close to everything, cable cars, Lefty O'Duals (a very famous and great place to spend an evening)n Union Square. The hotel restaraunt was fantastic. Everything about the hotel exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable room along with excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: scottpalmsprings
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Donatello in San Francisco. We were greeted very nicely upon arrival and found the room to be so spacious, beautifully furnished and very clean. A large screen High Definition TV was available and the room was well decorated. The bed was very comfortable. You could hear street noise with the windows open but when closed it was very quiet. I had a parking issue with the city and needed the help of the hotel. They were anxious to take care of the problem and did so in a very quick manner. They went above and beyond what you would expect for a hotel and I can only say the best things about Richard, the manager and his staff. The workout area was very clean and spa was delightful. Thanks again to the staff of the Donatello for making this a wonderful stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and luxury in the heart of Downtown San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: ksrupper
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a luxury hotel that has kept it's excellence and ambience in the heart of downtown Sna Francisco. It is close to restaurants, (from fine dining to diners that the locals frequent) theatres, (saw "Dreamgirls" at the vintage Curran Theatre) upscale shopping surrounding the famous Union Square, Cable Car stops, and many other attractions. The room was 4 star, and was very clean and quiet. All of the service and staff was first class. We liked the ease of traveling to and from the Donatello at minimal costs. A cab ride to just about any of the spots we traveled to was about $10.. The Metro/Subway to the ATT/Giants baseball game was $2..

Reviews.Title: “felt safe and welcome here”
Reviews.Author: happywander_49
Reviews.Content: From the time of check in I was treated very well. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was great - just a couple of blocks to catch a cable car. Nice hike to The Cannery. They have a Club room with free coffe/tea/hot chocolate - and a fire place. A great patio off the Club room floor as well as a fitness center on the same floor.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed again, and it was excellent again.”
Reviews.Author: BMLNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Stayed last year about the same time, and sometimes when you go back to the same place twice, it isn't as good. But this doesn't apply to the Donatello. Jesus, at the Front Desk, was extremely helpful and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. The most spacious room we have stayed in during our travels in the US. Great hotel, great location, great amenities. Hopefully we can stay again on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ilikegoingaway
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown San Francisco about a 5 minute walk from Union Square. Rooms huge with a fridge, microwave and some cooking stuff as well as the statutory coffee machine. Lots of diners really close perfect for breakfasts and 24 hour dining. There was a bar with a happy hour and a restaurant which we didn't sample. Not too many bus lines from outside the hotel, but really not a problem. Great city, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great service in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GGD1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in the Union Square area and the Donatello always manages to be my favorite. It's not glitzy or showy but it has very large rooms and incredible service. My room had a king bed, couch, chair and all the usual bells & whistles. My only concern about the room is that the bathroom is relatively small and fairly dated. The hotel is one block west of Union Square and so it is near shopping, cable cars, restaurants, etc. Everybody who worked at the hotel was very nice and I would highly recommend the Donatello to any SF visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great and very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeresaX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Union Square and therefor very well located. The rooms are big and confortable. The beds are comfortable and one cant hear the noise from the street ot other rooms! The kitchenett is good. There wasnt any healthy choice at breakfast but the unhealthy choice was good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zedesseff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello back in June on our first trip to San Francisco. The location is excellent - close to Union Square, and within easy reach of the main sights. The bar staff were friendly and introduced us to Anchor Steam - which became my husband's beer of choice for the rest of the trip. The only criticisms we had (and these might seem picky) was that the towels could have been changed a bit more frequently, and we couldn't see any spoons in the Club Room, which made it a bit difficult to make a decent cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: robertgladden
Reviews.Content: The Donatello Hotel has offered my wife and I an excellent value for our buck. With clean rooms, an attentive staff, a restaurant and bar onsite. We have been staying at the Donatello for the past five years on our annual visit to the "city by the bay". One block from Union Square, a trolley ride to Fisherman's Wharf. theaters and Chinatown within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely wonderful; the physical facility as well as the amenities and the attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Donnajb
Reviews.Content: The staff is immediately welcoming and the rooms are well appointed and very roomy and comfortable, The location is within walking distance of various tourist attractions and many good restaurants . The public transit system is also easily accessible. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room; Club Room Cozy Respite from the Summer Frost!”
Reviews.Author: ArmchairPlanner
Reviews.Content: I agonized over which hotel to choose in SF, but was delighted with the Donatello. (Truly, I'm not one of their Time Share customes; nor did anyone solicit me to join.) The room was nicer than I expected - storage in the TV armoire, a dresser in a separate closet area, and the small kitchen area (microwave, small fridge, some dishes and utensils) were nice touches. The whole family (mom, dad, two teens) enjoyed the Club Room on the top floor for hot beverages, comfy furniture, and the view. (Outside access to the view - brrrrr!) The concierge is also up there - interesting concept. San Francisco was COLD (and I know cold...). Bring lots of layers in the summer. I wasn't that impressed with the highly-touted Union Square area. We weren't there to shop and the area was overrun by tourists. We took a bus (seriously) the few blocks up Nob Hill to take the California line trolley car instead of waiting in the block-long lines for the Powell lines. At 9:30 in the morning, there were only a handful of locals on the car. (Later, it got more crowded.) Take advantage of the public transportation. Very easy to navigate. We paid $155 per night (with AARP). Booked two months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Our accommodations at the Donatello were spacious, clean, friendly and so close to all that S.F. has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: sparkle89511
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Union Square and an easy walk to shopping, good restaurants and many other attractions in San Francisco. We enjoyed our visit and intend to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A+++”
Reviews.Author: Travel_bunnikin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfect location; close to Union Square. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, I will stay at Donatello again”
Reviews.Author: Wasabi7666
Reviews.Content: Excellent stayed at Donatello for 3 days. Pleased and satisfied. Great location -- close to Union Square/Powell Station/Cable Car/Tourist Info Center/Car rentals. Just a block away, there is a garage for many of the popular car rental companies (Hertz/National/Alamo/Dollar/Thrifty) (320 O'Farrell Street). First day, warmly welcomed by the Staffs and got helped on setting the sofa bed. Great customer services. Chocolates were given every day. Complementary WiFi: first day was weak, yet it was fair for the last two days of the stay. (If you do not bring your own computer/smart phone with you, there is a computer room with printer at the lobby.) Complementary Coffee/Tea/Chocolates are offered at the Club House which closed at 10:30 p.m. It was freezing cold (windy) last week, felt great to have a nice hot drink after a day out. Safely stored our luggages after checking out. Great arrangement on the shuttle to the airport - $13/person. Alternatively, one can take BART (Powell Station) to the airport for $8.10/person. Pro: Great Staff/Great Customer Services Clean Large room Powerful Shower Many power outlets Great Location Con: Pillow too soft Many THANKS, Mark, Jesus and all the Staffs at Donatello!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at The Donatello”
Reviews.Author: Paolo61
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at The Donatello in S.F. with my wife and my daughter (from Aug 9 to 14, 2010). The rooms are very clean and spacious, but what I have more appreciated is the extreme kindness and helpfulness of all the staff. I will reccomend this hotel to all my friend who intend to visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: ElisaLeone
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good position, very next to Union Square. We practically visisted the city by feet and the hotel position helped us very much. The hotel doesn't have breakfast included but there is a Starbucks very next to it. The room was clean and quite big.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: eileenandjerry
Reviews.Content: This little hotel near Union Square is a gem! The service was impeccable and the room was comfortable, clean and tasteful. I usually don't sleep well in a hotel because the bedding and pillows are usually not comfortable, but here, it felt like home! They actually have a turn-down service, which seems to be scarce these days. The location was perfect, near a lot of restaurants and Union Square. The parking was pricey at $30, but that's San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Blair_of_DC
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a real find. Comfortable rooms with especially attentive and helpful service and a location that can't be beat. This is a great place to stay in the City by the Bay. Check out their rates!

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello is a very nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco near great restaurants, shopping and art galleries.”
Reviews.Author: denise444
Reviews.Content: The Donatello's rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. We slept great on their comfortable king size beds. The location is excellent for walking to nearby shops, restaurants and art galleries. The first night there we were tired and ordered room service from their restaurant which was excellent. The jacuzzi was just okay as their were many suds in the water when the jets were turned on. Everyone who worked there seemed to have a genuine interest in making sure our stay was enjoyable and offered recommendations on things to do and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Donatllo as a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: randyveach
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the Donatello. The people were GREAT. They catered to our every whim. Every evening, after a long day exploring San Francisco, we went to the Club to have hot chocolate and tea. The Club area allowed us to unwind and talk about what we liked best about that days excursion. The room was kept very clean. The front desk took care of all of our concerns with a smile. Because of its location, the cleanliness of the hotel/vacation club, and the people working there I highly recommend this as a place to stay when in San Francisco. I should mention that because of its location, right downtown, its noise level is a little high, but this is NOT donatello's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location - would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: flos
Reviews.Content: We chose the Donatello for it's combination of location, space, price and favourable Trip Advisor reviews; last time we stayed in the Westin Market Street. Jesus checked us in into a great room at 1130 when we were expecting just to drop our cases - what a great guy! In fact, the desk staff, concierges and maids were all super friendly and helpful which made The Donatello a welcoming place to stay. The room was generously sized and being on the back of the hotel, very quiet indeed - we didn't hear a thing from either inside or outside the hotel at night. A kitchenette area allows for snacks or breakfast in the room which was an added bonus. The hotel is just two blocks from Union Square and a few blocks further from cable car and muni stops (The F line tram is quietr than others and a great way to see the sights from The Castro, through Fishermans' Wharf to the Embarcadero) and there's even a parking garage right next to the hotel if needed. I think we made a good choice with the Donatello and would say that it fully lives up to it's positive billing on Trip Advisor and would recommend it without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RosanneNYC
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was a perfect choice for us - large room, perfect location, friendly staff, great concierges, clean. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would not even consider another hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouLouMe
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure was great. Great location a few steps from Union Square. Large room with high ceilings. Clean and quiet. Staff couldn't be better. Free wireless internet, microwave, fridge, dishes. Absolutely lovely Club room and patio on the top floor with complimentary coffee and tea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel perfect location good value”
Reviews.Author: Valerimal
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the perfect location 2 blocks from Union Square, everything is perfect, the staff is very friendly and helpful the rooms are nice, clean and sound proof so you don't hear anything from the street. They have a gym on the last floor and an area to sit where you can have coffee or tea anytime of the day. The whole family loved the hotel and it was a good value for your money. We would definitely go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marinamaria
Reviews.Content: Hotel Donatello is a great place to stay in San Francisco! large rooms, clean and well equipped, and a fantastic position, so near Union Square!

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello and San Francisco both superb”
Reviews.Author: trevor_hargrave
Reviews.Content: Checked ino the Donatello on August 6th for six nights and were warmly welcomed by Bobby on reception. He told us we could get any information we needed about places to visit or the area, from reception or the concierge on the tenth floor in the club lounge. Our room was more than adequate with good facilites. It even had a microwave, plates and cutlery. The Bathroom was fine and the jet from the shower was very strong. The bed was big and comfy. We are now tryting to obtain the same type of pillows for our bed, having returned home. The room was cleaned everyday and the bed was always turned down when we got back every evening after s stroll. We visited the club lounge where you are able to get free tea/coffee.chocolate and spoke to the concierge Peter who was very helpful and more than willing to book any tickets we needed. This was our second visit to the City. We had a three day stop-over three years ago and did not have time to see everything we wanted to. On that occasion we stayed in a cheap hotel on Van Ness. The Donatello was much better for eveything. When planning out trip this time we had thought about staying down at Fishermans Wharf but decided the location of the Donatello would be better for travelling from as all routes on public transport systems seem to virtually go outward from around Union Square and Markert Street. We enjoyed a visit to Alcatrtaz and walks through Golden Gate Park and over the Bridge from Sausolito which we got to by ferry. The sites in San Francisco are superb and it has so much history. We would recommend a visit to the Winhester Mystery House in neerby Santa Carla which is just over an hours train ride away on the CalTrain. Also a vist to Macy's and a meal at The Cheesecake Factory is not to be missed. The ONLY negative we have is that there was a little bit of noise from the road outside the hotel, early in the moring on two occasions, according to my wife, although I slept through. Sadly, we did not use the Spa, Fitness Facilities or the Zingari Restaurant but we thouroughly enjoyed our return visit to San Francisco, made al the more enjoyable by The Donatello which we feel well worthy of a high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: thejos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Donatello for 3 nights, and were not disappointed. The staff were freindly and helpful at all times. The room was huge, with good tea/coffee making facilities including a fridge. Lovely fluffly bathrobes were supplied, alomg with lots of linen. Great value for money, and close to Union Square, which means great shopping, and handy to the sighseeing buses. We loved San Francisco, it is a wonderful city. Do check out Zingaro Restaurant at the Donatello - wonderful Italian food and classy Italian waiters wearing very nice suits!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RGYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is one block from Union Square and within easy walking of all the central San Francisco sights. We arrived at Oakland airport and took the BART to Powell with an easy 10 minute walk from there to the hotel. Powell is also on the direct BART line to San Francisco International. When we arrived we received a friendly welcome from the reception staff (this was followed up by phone call to the room to ensure everything was o.k.). Our bedroom was relatively large and very well equipped (tea/coffee percolator, microwave etc.) with a good size plasma television. The other room we had for our booking was slightly smaller but it had the advantage of being on the inside of the building which meant it did not experience the traffic noise that we encountered. On the Friday afternoon when we arrived there was a cheese & wine reception in the top floor 'club' room. Part of this property is given over to time share and we thought this may be the opportunity for a sales pitch but this proved not to be the case. The club room also offered comfortable seating, a range of newspapers and periodicals and coffee/tea 'on tap'. The club staff were particularly knowledgeable about the city and were able to come up with some very good suggestions of where to eat. On the same floor there is also a small fitness suite, sauna and jacuzzi - all kept immaculately clean. We did not experience breakfast in the hotel as there are lots of really good places - Dotti's True Blue Cafe (but be prepared for a long queue), Sears Fine Food and Cafe de la Presse are all to be recommended. All told our 5 nights at the Donatello provided us with comfort, friendly service and an excellent location as well as terrific value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowrider11
Reviews.Content: Everything what you need and just one block away from Union Square. So its a fantastic place to start exploring sanfrancisco by pedes. The hotel is alright and the rooms are great, the breakfast however is not a great draw...juice, mediocre coffee and some donuts and bagels. There is free wireless lan hroughout the hotel and the view from the top of the hotel is great. A little bit old fashioned but a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPhilC
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was the first stop on our California fly-drive, and to be honest, by the time we'd arrived, any bed would have done the job. But the Donatello offered a great deal more than that. Our welcome was very warm and informative and our room - if a little drab in its decor - was huge, offering a useful (if unexpected) kitchenette. During our stay hotel staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly. But the Donatello's true winning hand is it location, a couple of blocks from Union Square and the main shopping streets and the streetcar route. And about a minute from the great Pinecrest Diner on Geary Street. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sudan74
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff could not be more helpful. When we stated at the front desk that it was our first time visiting San Francisco, they immediately upgraded us to a room with a terrace. The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square. The concierge (a woman, not the man) was very helpful. She had a unique name which escapes me at the moment. She recommended a wonderful Napa Valley wine tour. One of our favorite things was the hospitality suite where coffee and tea were served throughout the day and into the evening. Having a nice cup of tea before retiring for the night was a nice touch. This is a VERY nice hotel with a wonderful staff. I do have one complaint which is not the fault of the hotel. San Francisco collects garbage in the middle of the night and the automatic trucks are extremely noisy. The noise goes on for quite a while and was quite annoying. That is what interfered with my sleep, not the comfort of the room. The fitness center was not great but there is a pretty good gym about a half block away and if you are a guest at the Donatello there is a discount

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in excellent location in our favorite city”
Reviews.Author: Cindy34521
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 block from Union Square, making it easy to walk everywhere we wanted to. We took advantage of the room + parking deal for $172 per night. We thought this was a great price and alleviated any need to worry about parking our rental car which is impossible and expensive in SF. The hotel room was clean and comfy and with a king bed plus pull-out sofa bed accommodated our family of 4 (including 2 kids 9 and 14) just fine. There is some street noise at night, but this is a hopping part of town, and we were too tired from walking all day to be bothered by it. The staff were pleasant, helpful, efficient. We felt safe and secure in a fun but not too touristy part of town. Refrig, microwave, and coffee maker useful for quick in-room breakfasts. No breakfast provided. We did not have any need to utilize the dining room or any other facilities, except the concierge floor for afternoon coffee and hot chocolate and better wifi reception than in the room. Highly recommended overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for a good price in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked in advance and had a great rate for our 3 nights stay at Club Donatello in July. Had a king room on 14th floor vwith cityview. Traffic noise was ok but if the room faces Post St, it could be noisy. Staff was very nice to us, room was big with big bath. Water pressure wasn't always strong but it was a minor issue. Free Wifi in-room and tea/coffee machine was a plus. Location is 1 block from Union Sq and the Cable car, 2 blocks from several Rental Car company. Very useful when you've to pick up or drop off your car. Didn't try the Zingari restaurant or bar. We had a really good stay at this Hotel (club). We can recommand it and will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Trips2keep
Reviews.Content: The best part of staying here was the service and staff. Convenient Location. Rooms were Comfortable. Air Cond didn't work great, but with temp in S.F. never getting above 65, it wasn't a big problem. It was NOT noisy. Live music in the bar. Parking onsite in garage. Make reservation in advance for best value. Good Fresh Coffee on club level.

Reviews.Title: “I loved every minute there, they made me feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: Hagita
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the stuff is warm and friendly, the room was large and comfortable. I had a problem with not receiving a package that was sent to me, and the Hotel Service Manager tried to help me far beyond his duty.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if booked in advance. Parking expensive.”
Reviews.Author: 1plato23
Reviews.Content: MAIN PROBLEM: noise from music on streets/nightclub. We were very high but it still kept us awake on both nights. What a pity as hotel good. This is why we would probably not go back again. Valet parking good but $28+tax per night. Enjoyed our stay. The Friday cheese/wine was brilliant - sat on roof terrace and had a 'merry' time. Do not miss it even if its not usually your thing. Roof terrace usually quiet and sunny and away from hustle/bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Mumbles13
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights here. My second visit to the Donatello. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with a small microwave, fridge, coffeemaker and utensils. The location is a few steps from Union Square. Staff polite and helpful. Can recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great city”
Reviews.Author: cmoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at the Donatello with two children, great rooms and great service and above all agreat location and value for money. We had a room with a patio area which was great for morning coffee from the complimentary club room on the top floor. All in all a great hotel and would strongly recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LoveCali12
Reviews.Content: ...staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Hotel was very clean. Turn-down service was nice to come back to every evening. Would definitely recommend, especially if wanting to tour the heart of San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LightMatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located at one block from Union Square, and it's real good value for money, because the rooms are spacious and quite nice. Only drawback: WiFi connection didn't work very well neither in the room nor in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved reputation”
Reviews.Author: KenLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good reputation on Tripadvisor and it is well deserved. Staff were excellent in giving advice and dealing with requests. Rooms were of a good standard. Location was excellent, if not a bit off the centre of things but not too far from Union Square. Far better than being in the Pier 39 area.

Reviews.Title: “not great for biz”
Reviews.Author: lcf-guy
Reviews.Content: The hotel does many things well (TV, music, bath, bed), but fails on things which should be simple. The wireless, if it works at all, is very slow. You can only see the TV from the bed. There is no real desk to work on (I write this on a nightstand with a stool). It does have a frig, u'wave, and dishes for people who want to eat in their room (good luck finding groceries around, though!). The rooms are large by SF standards, but with trendy, uncomfortable furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmabax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for 4 nights and loved everything about. The location was fantastic- only one block from a cable car stop and Union Square. Staff were always extremely helpful and the free internet access on the ground was very useful. The room was spacious with a very comfy bed and was well equipped with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Have already recommended to family and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NateJ11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for two nights and were very impressed. We were surprised how large the room was! Our room was clean and modern looking. The free wireless internet was nice and allowed us to plan our day since this was our first time to San Francisco. Jesus the front desk attendant was awesome, we mentioned we were going to the Giants game and he pulled out a map and showed us exactly how to walk to AT&T park.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: arch_10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed a week in San Francisco at the Donatello Hotel on Post St. near Union Square. Location of the hotel was pretty good and furnishings were adequate. Experienced trouble with air conditioning and had to open windows to stay cool at night. This created a lot of street noise (we were on 6th floor) interfering with sleep. Complained and their engineer looked at it but very little improvement. Service was hit or miss depending upon the individual. Wireless internet service was slow and would work only intermittently. Do to work and other demands I have very little leisure time and was truly trying to enjoy a few days away from the normal routine. Circumstances and conditions at the hotel made that very difficult and diminished my overall experience in San Francisco. Needless to say, I will not be returning and would not recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: bkfrombrum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in June, 2010. The room was fantastic, large and well furnished with TV, DVD and music centre. It also had a mini kitchen with fridge, microwave and crockery and cutlery for the odd meal in. Coffee maker as well, but free coffee is available all day in the roof garden lounge. Enormous bed - and very comfortable. Free wi-fi that was always reliable. Staff couldn't have been more helpful, polite and knowledgeable. The hotel is situated just 2 blocks from Union Square and connections to all the cable cars and public transport. In fact the Donatello was one of the best hotels I have stayed in for many years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: bazil2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited the San Francisco area. Our travel agent booked us into The Donatello Hotel. The staff there were great, I have never had hotel staff that concerned on how we were doing. Keep up the great work!!!! I would totally return if I'm ever in the area again. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property, in a perfect location offering excellent accomodations and customer service.”
Reviews.Author: MicheleRP
Reviews.Content: We recently spent an evening in San Francisco, which included an overnight stay at the Donatello. The Donatello exceeded our expectations in every aspect; friendly & helpful staff, very nice accommodations, overall comfort, located in Union Square. Also, the lounge located on the 2nd floor offered live music, in a comfortable setting with friendly staff. A nice place to end your evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelwith5
Reviews.Content: Large, comfy rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great views from the guest lobby on the top floor, and quiet. Just off Union Square and close to lots of car rental sites to drop off/pick up a car, and a Walgreens to get snacks. Our family of five had two adjacent rooms and teens and parents all loved this hotel. We loved the large towels, the bathrobes, the hard candy in our rooms, the chocolates at night, and the apples in the lobby! It's a short walk to cable cars, buses, and the train to airport although we got there with the hotel car which was a great value. The room rate was very very good, especially compared to some of the other prices we paid during our trip through Northern California. The only downside was the limited number of computers in the lobby (1) and slow internet service from that one computer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for 3 nights -our first trip to San Francisco. Room was great - roomy with a sofa and chair, refrigerator and decent size bathroom. Location was wonderful - one block from cable cars, easy access to most tourist things. Staff was very pleasant to deal with....restaurant food was good. We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: John181
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of previous reviews and we were not disappointed. We arrve very early following a long train journey from Seattle and only wanted to drop off our luggage enabling us to spend some time in the city. You can imagine our surprise and delight when Manuel who was working at reception informed us that our room was ready and available allowing us to unpack our luggage and relax prior to going out for the day. Manuel deserves Employee of the Month in our book !!. Thanks. That was just the start of a most enjoyable stay at this hotel. Our room was very big and had all the additional facilities of a small suite. We loved the room and as an added extra someone came into the room each night of our stay and turned down the bed and left small bars or chocolate. It reminded us of the cruise we had just been on from Seattle. The hotel is alsoi right next door to a bike hire facility and as we intended to 'Bike the Bridge' this was perfect. For a really nice hotel in the centre of San Francisco look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/ staff”
Reviews.Author: Peteradio
Reviews.Content: Great staff, relatively cheap parking, great location, and big clean rooms. Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kda_morris
Reviews.Content: Recently, my family and I traveled to San Francisco to attend our son's wedding. Our daughter-in-law made reservations for us, as well as her family, to stay at the Donatello Hotel. She had planned several pre-wedding activities for us to enjoy so our families could meet and bond. What a fabulous experience! The location was perfect. We had access to great restaurants and local attractions. If my elderly was unable to walk the distances, my son was able to get taxis. The fares were reasonable and very affordable. The hotel service was excellent. The entire staff was welcoming and went to great lengths to accommodate our every need. I will definitely stay here again whenever I visit my son and his wife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Superb Dining”
Reviews.Author: waynefb
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, just off Union SQ. Absolutely wonderful dining room and very very helpful staff throughout. Jazz in the lounge was entertaining even though we were eating dinner in the restaurant. Stayed two nights and ate both nights in the Donatello.... there was lots of other choices though. Reasonably priced considering location. Valet Parking was $30 per day. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend The Donatello!”
Reviews.Author: cassiah
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The location was very central to activities. My teenage daughter and I felt very comfortable and safe shopping in the vicinity of the hotel in the evening. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel too bad about the noise”
Reviews.Author: lucky_e
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine but I cannot recommend it due to the noise from the bar across the street. I had read the warnings in other people's reviews, and they all mentioned that the noise is not a problem on week nights. This isn't entirely true! We were there on a Tuesday night and the music was incredibly loud! And the windows were single pane and didn't shut properly. Thankfully the music stopped around 11:30 PM, but for someone who likes to go to sleep earlier, I wasn't happy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Donatello is the perfect place and location to enjoy San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Pettefer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Donatello is located perfectly in Union Square in San Francisco. It is surrounded by all of the famous stores and name brands but also China Town. It is on Mason and Post near important bus lines and the cable car lines. The staff and the amenities are fantastic. The restaurant and bar with its 1/2 price drinks and appetizers every night are very good. There is a club on the top floor for all guests with fitness, coed jacuzzi, free coffee and tea, and a knowledgeable concierge at your disposal. The rental car companies are 2 blocks away, and the concierge found us one that did not charge an overnight parking charge. The hotel even gave us a free bottle of champagne and boxes of chocolates because we were there on our anniversary. You won't go wrong with this marvelous hotel that is close to any activity you want to engage in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and value”
Reviews.Author: robinbryn
Reviews.Content: A well appointed hotel which provided us with a large and comfortable room (including a kitchen area with crockery, cutlery, a refrigerator and microwave oven). All the staff we met (desk and domestic staff) were friendly, informative, flexible and very efficient. Moreover, all this at an exceptionally modest price for accomodation in the centre of downtown. We stayed for ten days and feel we got to know the hotel and its services well during this time. We would unhesitatingly return and will recommend it to any friends or colleagues who are planning to visit San Francisco for leisure of business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-size hotel in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: houtraveller
Reviews.Content: Donatello is an excellent mid-size hotel with BIG clean rooms, that are quite well appointed. The service is very good and the valet parking is fast and efficient. You feel more relaxed as the traffic is not as heavy as the big hotels near by where hoards of tourist surge in and out. Its location is excellent being right next to the Union Square and the Cable Cars and public transportation and all sorts of car rental agencies. We have a King Bed room but there is also a queen size sleeper. It does not look crowded at all because there is plenty of space. I cannot find any thing to complaint about and will probably stay there again if I should visit my son in San Francisco in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: FLATraveller52
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days at the Donatello in lat May 2010 for a leisure tour of San Francisco. I booked this hotel through my timeshare ownership. Let me just say that I was not disappointed with one thing at the hotel. The Staff was excellent, friendly and informative, the hotel accommodations were superb and the entire property was lovely and kept exceptional clean. The on-site bar was a joy every evening after a long day of sight-seeing. The bartender Mary was a gem, I think she is leaving at the end of summer to begin her family. The location of this hotel is so wonderful. We were able to walk out one block and catch mass transit. The selection of shopping and restaurants were excellent in this area. Walking to just about anything is within reach. Thanks Donatello for a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a high-priced city”
Reviews.Author: phbSonomaCounty
Reviews.Content: Best deal in San Francisco in terms of bang for the buck. Excellent location, accommodating staff, large, clean rooms and in-house parking, to boot. Within walking distance of dozens of resataurants, including one on-site. Have stayed there many times and am about to book another stay shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a city hotel. GREAT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: philGoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Donatello Hotel for 4 nights. The location is amazing. 2 blocks from Union Square and 4 blocks from the Market Street where all the public transport is. The hotel has good service with friendly staff. Rooms are clean and bright and are cleaned daily with towel and sheets changed everyday if required. Free Wireless internet in the rooms is a nice touch. There is a small gym on the top floor with a Jacuzzi and sauna which is clean and modern. For such a good location, the cost compared to other hotels around is cheep. We would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location great for families”
Reviews.Author: FraserB
Reviews.Content: We flew from Vegas to San Francisco with our daughter. We chose the Donatello as it seemed to have a spacious rooms with fridge microwave etc. Just what you need when traveling with a toddler. We weren't let down. The room was great if a little dated, it had cable tv and DVD, large sofa and easy chairs. The hotel was central, two blocks from Union square and parking for our hire car. The Donatello has a great lounge on the roof where smokers can go outside and enjoy the view. It was nice and relaxing place for coffee, soft drinks. We had room services both nights from the Italian restaurant in the hotel which was very good. The staff were very helpful during our two night stay always ready to stop and say Hi to our daughter and help us get around the City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent San Francisco value”
Reviews.Author: potma
