Reviews.Content: It has a little San Francisco charm along with sophistication. Everyone is there to asist and make your stay one you will not forget. I for one have stayed there many times and will return. I am also a former resident of the city and find this a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping....”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: Came to the Donatello four years ago with my family and found that it was great. Good location, quiet with a large room that the four of us could share happily. This time it was just me, meeting a friend on my way to the UK. When I arrived the room was dirty. I was tired so I didn't want to wait for someone to come but i phoned down to reception and told them. They were not apologetic and were happy for me to leave a note for the cleaner the next morning. Which I did and still no apology! When I asked at the front desk for directions I was never informed that the concierge was upstairs. It was interesting how you would stand there and wait then when they were free they would not walk towards you and ask if they could help just look at you and wait until you walked over to them! Interesting approach to customer service. When I came before there were pastries and coffee upstairs each morning. I contacted them before my arrival to ask whether or not they supply anything gluten free and i was not advised then that this facility no longer available. I also remembered the sauna and spa being a welcome addition so my friend and I looked forward to this. However when we spoke to the concierge who showed us how to use the controls even he did not tell us the the sauna no longer worked! So we sat there for half an hour like two stuffed lemons getting chilly! The morning I was leaving to catch the plane to the Uk was the morning of the first flight disruptions due to the volcanic ash. The lobby had a kiosk where you can use the internet but the room was locked and the key could not be found! Eventually they broke into the room and we queued to contact our airlines. So not a great experience and no I would not go back or recommend. d r t e.

Reviews.Title: “very good deal”
Reviews.Author: michikoloh
Reviews.Content: a large studio; no extra charge for more than 2 people; 4 family members had plenty of room. very reasonable parking fee for san francisco. a good find.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: dkmartyn
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you find a jewel in a big city, and Hotel Donatello is it. The room was spacious well appointed, clean, charming and full of surprises. There was a kitchen area with small frig, microwave, dishes, wine glasses, silverware, everything you need for a late night snack. Happy Hour at the bar on the 4th floor had great 1/2 price drinks and appetizers in the late afternoon. On the top floor you could relax with coffee any time of the day. There was a whirlpool spa for relaxation. I had the best massage I have ever had! When I needed directions for the hightlights of San Francisco, the staff gave me these little cards with exact directions to help me out. If you want the best room, request a "quiet" room. Ours was on the 6th floor overlooking a patio area. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but generally decent!”
Reviews.Author: Boggsie
Reviews.Content: Located one block from Union Square, Tiny lobby, fairly friendly staff. Room was on 14th floor as we were in the "Club" part. Rooms are large and relatively well appointed. Decent TV and DVD player. Alarm/radio. Tea and small coffee filter maker. Housekeeping is variable. I suspect this is just America and may be related to our European lack of understanding their tipping system. The bathroom is a little dated but adequate, has had a facelift but will need gutting and replacing in a few years. (How much water do standard USA toilets require?) Bed was comfortable, turn down service occurs nightly. Biggest gripe would be that the safe is at 6' above ground in the wardrobe. Now this is fine for me, I'm 6'4''. However, "certain people," are a little bit shorter and found it infuriating to have to continually ask me to put things in, take them out or else drag a chair across the room, not an option for the less able bodied. It is large enough to hold a big laptop. There is quite a lot of noise from the street, a couple who were opposite a nightclub called Ruby Sky complained that the noise one night kept them up for hours. Ask for a room on the Post St side. There is free wifi, which is not password protected. No chance of having your laptop screen-shot by a thief then! It's OK with a computer, not so great with an iPhone and the bandwidth and stability of the connection is poor. Skype calls were problematic. The 'club' level is at the top of the hotel and has tea/coffee facilities, nice armchairs and some pleasant views. it also has a concierge service that takes 5% commission and presumably then would seek a tip. We didn't use them, the trips they recommend are more expensive and appear little different from the ones we chose and booked elsewhere. The spa and gym are small and almost deserted. Beware the spa pool, there was a high concentration of chemical in it when I was there. There are a number of good restaurants in the area, I have reviewed some of them on TripAdvisor. Didn't eat in their restaurant, which does not have a great reputation. There is parking on site. Be aware that if you turn one way when leaving the hotel everything is rosy and Union Squarish, the other way and downhill is a lot more down at heel. Europeans beware, the taxes are not included in the base price and that's before you tip.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews, this is a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: swanee27
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from the reviews on TA and we are so glad we did. It can be quite daunting finding a hotel in a city you don't know so we decided to look at the top 10 on TA for San Francisco and then looked at value and location and I have to say that The Donatello was just about perfect. The price was good, the location was excellent and the room and facilities were fantastic. After travelling for a few weeks and staying in many hotels we wanted somewhere that allowed us to spread out a bit and cater for ourselves and The Donatello did just that. The room has a small kitchenette and also has a comfy sofa and armchair, all in a large room that is no way cramped. I must also mention the warm and friendly service that you receive from every staff member; you are made to feel like a valued guest which is quite a change from some of the other hotels we have stayed in. If we ever return to San Francisco we would not hesitate in staying at The Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaruAz
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the donathello this past may, and it was fantastic. the location is great, you are near to a lot of places. the service was great too, the staff was nice, friendly and helpful. it has a great area in the last floor where you can take a coffe or a tea. i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Our Surprise Find”
Reviews.Author: FrankD60
Reviews.Content: This was a business/pleasure trip for me and my wife. We just happened upon this hotel after we had already booked somewhere else. Couldn't justify paying the higher price at the other hotel, so we opted to stay at The Donatello. We could not have been happier. The rooms were very comfortable, had free wireless internet, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, etc. Bedding very comfortable. Nice exercise room and free coffee on club level each morning. Valet parking cheaper than other hotels; the list goes on and on. The staff went out of their way to make sure every detail of our stay was the best it could be. I would definitely recommend this to anyone and we'll stay here again if we're back that way.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait”
Reviews.Author: Pat155032
Reviews.Content: I haven't even arrived at the Donatello yet but I can say if Peter the Concierge is a sign of the type of service I can expect to get there, it will definatelly be 5*....I called in simply to check on my reservation and ask a simple question as to renting a car. Peter was friendly, curtious and even told me to meet with when I check in, he'll give me all the insights I need on my stay in San Fran.... Can't wait to get to San Fran.....and congrats to Peter on top notch service..

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello: a Great San Francisco Location”
Reviews.Author: rbc1psu
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 3 nights at the Donatello. While I booked the hotel based on TripAdviser information, I was not aware that it was an RCI Gold Crown Resort. This was a pleasant surprise upon arrival. The location is exceptional, a block from Union Square. Complimentary coffee in the Club Lounge every morning was a great start. We soaked in the spa at the end of several long days of wandering. We got a 3 day MUNI pass and used the cable cars, trolleys, and buses. We really enjoyed the Ferry Building, a plesant change from the tourist stops of Pier 39 and Fishermans's Wharf. We did the Alcatraz tour, and were pleased with the very good audio tour included in the price. We also took Mr. Toads (3 hour) Tour with Ed. He was a fount of information, and we got into sections of the city that would have been problematic on our own. I'd highly recommend Mr. Toads Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to base yourself in San Fran - I Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lainey007
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend the Donatello, from the minute i walked in the door, the Front desk managed to find me a room at 9am because i was not feeling the best, they went out of their way every day to ask how i was and to ensure that I was comfortable. The overall Service was excellent, the rooms were very comfortable, clean and housekeeping was more than efficient.The Location is excellent especially for a solo traveller. The complimentary Tea and Coffee in the club lounge was great to come back to from a busy day in San Fran and the Internet is complementary another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location-in the theatre district near Union Square.”
Reviews.Author: PearlJ30
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a nice hotel with great location. The hotel is located in the theatre district approximately a block from Union Square. My wife and I stayed two nights at the Donatello during a recent visit to San Francisco. Our spacious studio suite was on the ninth floor. The suite was clean and nicely furnished with a king bed, a sofa bed and armchair. The room also had a small desk table, an in-room safe, a small refrigerator, microwave oven, plus a small set of silverware, a few plates, and a set of wine glasses. We also had a wall unit with a television, radio/CD/tape player combo in the room. The hotel offers a coffee bar and lounge area on the top (14th) floor, which was very nice. The fitness center, also on the 14th floor, had a stationary bike, a treadmill, a stair-stepper machine, a few free weights and a large multi-purpose weight machine. We found the Donatello staff to be courteous, friendly and helpful. The hotel offers valet parking for $28.00 per night. We parked our car for in a garage a few blocks away for $40.00 for the weekend, which we thought was a little more reasonable. All in all, my wife and I very much enjoyed our stay and highly recommend The Donatello to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: sstflyer
Reviews.Content: Second enjoyable visit to the Donatello! A great location in downtown San Francisco for walking, shopping, and sightseeing. A number of nice restaurants for all meals within walking distance. Did not eat in hotel restaurant on this trip, but it is recommended. Lots of city activity and fun places. Excellent service and friendly staff. No longer has a complimentary breakfast, but a cozy top floor sitting room with a view and 24 hr. coffee and tea service was enjoyable to start and end the day. Neat, clean spa for a quick workout and shower. Room was very comfortable with nice amenities including WiFi. Crowd noise and sirens added to the city adventure, and closing the window helped sleeping. A tenth floor, south facing room was not an ideal view, however a full moon and early sunrise made it very nice. Valet parking was a bit steep, but fast service and security were worth it. Looking forward to our next visit and recommending the Donatello to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations! Would love to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: sangeeta61
Reviews.Content: Starting from the check in process, the courtesy, warmth and helpfulness of each and every employee I met was consistently outstanding. The group at the Reception and Bell desk, housekeeping and the Club went out of there way to make sure that they could assist us at all times. I enjoyed taking a break from my kids to go up to the Club and make my plans for our day with the help of the staff there, over a great cup of (complimentary!) coffee. The perfect location added to the great time we had in San Fransisco! I would strongly recommend this boutique Hotel especially to families as the studio apartment size is very comfortable for a family of 4!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would recommend to anyone wanting to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: klein3
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in San Fran, we stayed at a different hotel last time and wish we would have stayed here. It is very central to everything, it is 1 block from union square, so you are close to the cable cars which will take you to the wharf, the buses which will take you anywhere, we went to the golden gate bridge, golden gate park, alamo square, etc. They have free wi-fi as well. We had room 704 which was very large. We were travelling with a 4 month old and they were as accommodating and friendly as possible. We called 3 days before we arrived and reminded them we needed a crib and it was in our room when we arrived. Overall we had a great stay. 2 complaints about this place which is, when we arrived in our room there was dirty dishes in our room from the previous guests, the bell man noticed this when he brought out luggage up and took them away right away but they should not have been there. Another issue we had, since we were travelling with a 4 month old, we need to make formula and boil water for the power, we asked for a kettle and they didn`t have one anywhere, they offered us another coffee maker and we use the kraft and microwave water, but the kraft had a metal band on it so can`t use it in the microwave. We ended up microwaving coffee mugs of water to make the formula, we did the best we could but it was a pain and there should be a kettle or a big bowl they had that was microwave safe available. other then that we will be returning to san fran in a few years and will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tourist2468
Reviews.Content: We live in the East Bay but often travel across the bridge to spend a few days in San Francisco! This was our second stay with the Donatello Hotel and it was great! You get the feel of being part of the city cause your right in walking distance of everything! The hospitality is wonderful, everything went smoothly and we really enjoyed the restaurant, Zingari ! Food was excellent! We'll definitely return and bring some friends for a great weekend! Jane Del simone

Reviews.Title: “A great San Francisco hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank036
Reviews.Content: Clean and well situated in San Francisco this hotel offers great value. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of major San Francisco landmarks. The only complaint is the street noise during the night due to the garbage removal. Ask Jesus, Bobby (hockey expert), or Mark at the front desk for anything and they will be more than glad to help you. My wife and I would definitely stay here again. Once again the reviews from trip advisor were right on! Thanks to every one for suggesting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with an infant”
Reviews.Author: Shoeprncss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for a long weekend to celebrate our anniversary and Mother's Day. My husband booked the room and surprised me with the trip. We brought our 7 month old son so there were a few features of the room that worked great for us. The microwave and refrigerator were a blessing. It helped immensely to store his food and sterilize his bottles. There was an area near the door and closet that fit the crib perfectly so it was like he had his own room. It was nice to have a larger room in San Francisco, especially in Union Square, where the average room size is a closet. We all had plenty of room to move around. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The bathrooms could use some updating. Overall this was a great hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ! Big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jenn101680
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Donatello. It was clean. Friendly staff. It was very affordable. King size bed. A pull out Queen size bed. Located right in Union Square. Convienient for shopping and Dinning. Only complaint would be the street noise. (they do trash pickup at 1a.m.)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth another stay”
Reviews.Author: jkr_on_the_web
Reviews.Content: Nice, welcoming staff and a decent room for a whole of €160 for two nights - that's what my first impression of the Donatello was. And they for sure lived up to that. Check out the lounge on their top floor for some coffee (yes, American coffee, yet free ;o) and a nice view. The hotel bar is also worth a visit (even though they close at a quarter past twelve). I'm aware that other users were mentioning that this place might be a bit noisy, but closing the window helped me a lot. Given the hotel being at such a central location, you either live with that or find a better place in a more rural area.

Reviews.Title: “A CENTRALLY LOCATED GEM OF SUPERIOR VALUE.”
Reviews.Author: SeniorHoney
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week at the Donatello Hotel in San Francisco. The hotel met all of our expectations + more. It was centrally located in the Union Square area, close to Theaters, fine restaurants and transportation. Market Street is a few blocks down and we were able to catch the cable cars and trolleys there. Good shopping was also in that area. The Donatello Hotel staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, comfortable and larger than most in San Francisco. We enjoyed the jacuzzi after a day of sight seeing and walking up and down the hills. The fitness center was small, not what I could use. We had problems with the internet in our room as our access wanted to connect to the Marriot across the street. We would definitely return to the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great restaurant, great location! A great triple threat!”
Reviews.Author: ArchitecturalTravel
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I showed up the front desk was tied up but they smiled and greeted us silently while on the phone. When one became free we were checked in early and fast. It was wonderful after the long flight to finally be there and to be greeted with a smile was nice. When we got up to our room it was a wonderful surprise. I have traveled to other big cities and most do not have this size of room. King size bed, couch and chair, small desk, little kitchen. What more could you want. The kitchen was a bonus. First thing we wanted to do was get some groceries for breakfast, so down to the front desk to ask where a good grocery store was. The man at the front desk was very helpful and directed us to a bunch of different options and gave great directions on how to get there. The location was fantastic. We walked almost everywhere we wanted to go, even to the Legion of Honor (which is about 6 miles from the hotel). The cable cars are 1 block from the front door and the bus system is right out the front door. The cable car line that is close goes right to Market Street and all the way to Fisherman’s Wharf making it a very convenient and fun way to travel. The Donatello is also right by Union Square which is the shopping district in San Francisco. The only thing is that there is a dance club, Ruby Skye, right across the street. This was not a problem for us because after a long day walking in the sun we powered down at night and slept right through the weekend noise. During the week the streets around the hotel are quiet at night but we were woken by street noise around 8 am each morning. This was fine because we could get up and get going to see the beautiful city. We did not use all the amenities they had to offer at the hotel but we did check out a few. The hot tub is very small and I would not want to sit in it with more than 4 people total in there. But it was nice and warm and wonderful after walking all day. The restaurant was fantastic. It was small but the food was great and the service just as good. My boyfriend is a chef and he recommended that other guests check it out while they were there. The lounge has nightly jazz and it is very good. It gets very full and we didn’t get to sit and listen in the lounge but we went down to the lobby and listened from the couches. On our last night we wanted to go for a very nice romantic dinner and saw a restaurant on the waterfront that we thought would be nice. We did not have time to go in and make a reservation so we went to the concierge upstairs in the hotel and asked him to make a reservation for us. He immediately picked up the phone and called. Within a couple minutes we had dinner reservations at the place we wanted and the time we wanted. Every day we left the “Do Not Disturb” sign on the door and one day housekeeping did come into our room while we were out. A nice surprise to come to a clean room but it did make me feel a little uncomfortable to think that they didn’t abide by the sign on the door or our request I put in at the front desk to not have housekeeping enter our room except on certain days. All in all a wonderful stay and I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: mmshires
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised about everything at The Donatello. From the amazing front desk help to the wonderful singer in the cozy bar. Two women for the first time in San Francisco - we will be back! We felt both comfortable and safe. The employees made us feel welcome. Underground valet parking. It doesn't get any better than this in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!!!”
Reviews.Author: spiggyholes
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave great service from arrival to departure. The staff were extremely helpful and everything was as it should have been. The rooms were very clean and a good size. The Donatello is situated a block from Union Square which makes it an ideal base to see the sights of San Fransico. The only bad thing was they had a coffee machine in the room and I would have preferred a kettle to make tea being British.! Fantastic Hotel, staff and location. Would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Donatello = super star”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_in_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Donatello for a week while looking for an apartment (relocating to SF later this year). Was everything we could have asked for. Great location with easy access to a multitude of public transport options, stellar staff, free wireless, super clean, great value. On our last day, we rented bikes next door and rode across the GG Bridge to Sausalito. Will definitely return to the Donatello!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect San Francisco getaway”
Reviews.Author: smokeylinks
Reviews.Content: The Donatello Hotel is an excellent choice for a San Francisco hotel. It is near Union Square, two blocks away from the cable car and other public transportation. The rooms are quite large, with a small kitchennete (refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, utensils). Free wi-fi in room. Even though we were on the ninth floor, the noise from the street was quite noticeable. On the top floor is a nice lounge with coffee and tea service all day. The concierge was very professional and was able to answer all our questions. There was a small fitness room and a jacuzzi. Did not think much of the restaurant at the hotel. Chinatown was within walking distance and the Orient Pearl restaurant was excellent. So too was Scoma at Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “location :-)”
Reviews.Author: DonegalJohno
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location of this hotel as it is minutes walk form main square, loved it and will be back to san fran hopefully soon and will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: hightest
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Donatello met or exceeded all of our expectations. We have stayed at serveral other high end hotels in San Francisco at other times but none gave us the comfort, service and location afforded by the Donatello. The only negative we could come up with was that neither the front desk staff nor concierge printed boarding passes. We were directed to the "business center" which was limited to a single computer and printer, typically with a waiting line to use it. We will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: IVORYCOST
Reviews.Content: We stayed at t The Donatello during my recent visit to San Francisco. We were impressed by the high standard of service. Whether it was at the reception desk or at the cozy Top-floor lounge all staff were very friendly and worked tirelessly to please all the guests. The location was also excellent with plenty of restaurants nearby. Great shopping was available at Union Square/Market street. And next door was a bicycle shop which enabled us to rent a bike and tour San Francisco/Golden Gate on a bicycle.... a real adventure. Paal Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great location- Great staff”
Reviews.Author: sls_10_10
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped off the airport shuttle van till we checked out- we were treated with friendliness. The staff was exceptional- always trying to help with any question we had... We really appreciated the daily linen changes and enjoyed the chocolates from the cleaning staff, as well as our clean rooms! The Donatello is within walking distance from most anything you'd want to do. It did get a little noisy at night from outside partiers, and we could hear other guests in the hallways.... My only dislike was the service charge that was charged by Donatello if the concierge assisted with purchasing tickets for certain attractions. We didn't feel this should've been an added charge.....

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: sussed_nl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I've decided to book a few nights at the Donatello. The Donatello certainly could use a makeover, the hall and entrance were rather looking tired. The room (a studio) however was spacious and the bed very comfy. The location is perfect and the staff very helpful and friendly. On the last morning, the doorman even gave me a public transport pass for the remaining hours. Eventhough The Donatello is definitely worth your money (and more), however I don't mind spending extra for something more luxurious and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on earth”
Reviews.Author: stairpotato
Reviews.Content: Paper-thin walls, a room next to the ice machine and service elevators, and air conditioning that appears to do nothing. I can think of no redeeming features.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Comfy and Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: jayneym
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived on the doorstep, the staff at this hotel were all so friendly. From the concierge (jesus), Front Desk (jesus,mark), Bar (Derek) and could not have offered any better service. The hotel itself is a lovely charming boutique style with lovely spacious rooms, comfy beds and very quiet. Being visitors from Australia, they offered lots of places to see and eat that may not appear on tourist maps including the best pizza ever at Tony's and a fabulous bike ride over the Golden Gate Bridge. The Club lounge is very cosy and comfortable to collect coffees and hot chocs at leisure or just to sit and have a nice catch up with other guests after a long day. Convenience store up the road offers everything you need for you in house fridge. Beds were comfy and the hotel itself whilst very centrally located in the city was very very quiet. The happy hour every day was a lovely way to recollect with the most delicious chicken skewers and crab cakes ever.. In fact - wish we had time to go thru whole menu at half price. LOVE LOVED LOVED Dontello and will definately be our place to stay on next vist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Service, Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: backeraw
Reviews.Content: The Donatello Hotel is our new favorite hotel in San Francisco. The location is perfect, near Union Square and walkable to Ferry Building and China Town. The rooms are spacious and light. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are great. We are recommending The Donatello to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: abbyjuice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few blocks from Union Square, still in the safe zone, with great spacious rooms. (The windows open, which is nice these days, but it is pretty noisy outside) The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the restaurant in the hotel is excellent. The pool was closed when we were there, so I can't comment on that. The fitness center is about as minimal as you can get and still be called a fitness center, so be warned if this is important to you!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: suntanner1
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located to anything you want to see in San Francisco. Union Square one block away and Great resturant Honey Honey is also one block away. Rooms are spacious. All of the staff was courteous and helpful. Wish they had breakfast but they do have coffee and teas in the Club area. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Satisfied - Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: Jenni_mjt
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our week long stay at The Donatello. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, the staff made us feel very welcome. The service was exceptional and it never faltered, even the wake up calls were pleasant. The location was great, whether we walked right down to the MUNI or needed a cab in a moment's notice. We only had one meal in the restaurant, but it was one of the best we'd had all week. The size of the room was great and the bed was extremely comfortable. Free wifi was a nice plus too. I wasn't a big fan of the shower head or rough water pressure, but this wasn't that big of a deal. I felt very safe and secure in our location, with no worries about our stay. The housekeeping staff was also very courteous and helpful! For the price, this was an amazing value and I would highly recommend it for couples or groups of friends - maybe not families with small children, if you want more to keep them occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Service is five star”
Reviews.Author: carol
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Donatello...the staff is the best. We really enjoyed SF all the more because of this Hotel and staff. We liked having a small kitchen area and plenty of room. Location is great and transportation convenient. (Muni/cable car) We had a balcony room on the 5th floor so we could sit outside in the evening or afternoon. For the most part our stay was perfect. Only negative was the room was stuffy (warm) at times but in the Hotels defense we did not complain...so maybe this could have been corrected. Thanks to the Donatello staff for GREAT service!

Reviews.Title: “everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: baseball_fan_10
Reviews.Content: perfect location .......big rooms .......helpful staff.........great value.........we totally enjoyed our stay at the donatello

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: linglingma
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week at the Donatello which is conviently located in Union Square, walking distance to many attractions, restaruants and shops. Cable cars, trolleys and buses are readily acessible if you need to travel further. Rooms are comfortable, spacious and very clean. Staff were genuienly helpful and very curteous.Housekeeping was especially thoughful, when my neice and nephew stayed for an overnight the housekeeper noticed extra toothbrushes and left extra towels, linens,toiletries!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jahtomjah
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable. The staff was experienced. The establishment is centrally located to all manner of transportation. There are inexpensive restaurants located nearby with delicious cuisine. It is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect get away”
Reviews.Author: mwbohn
Reviews.Content: Flew to SF for a quick get away. This is our second time staying at The Donatello. Nice amenities in the room with coffe bar, fridge and microwave. Exspecially enjoyed the club room on a rainy day. Well located for down town SF. Staff was friendly and professional. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and service”
Reviews.Author: adotan
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, very good service from all the staff. We spent a lovely time at the Donatello, we enjoy very much the revitalizing spa. The only negative point is the expensive parking. We certainly would recommend this hotel! A.D. from Israel

Reviews.Title: “It made our trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: skornbluth
Reviews.Content: Just a block away from the cable cars, Union Square, and a block away from a memorable corned beef hash breakfast at Lefty O' Doul's, the location is great. The Club was wonderful where we could hang out, sip complimentary coffee or tea, and plan our day's activities. Everyone, I mean EVERYONE on the staff was helpful and charming, even to the guys that park the cars. Especially helpful are the little cards that they have to give you directions to just about nywhere. The maid service was wonderful and the room was kept immaculate. The restaurant was a bit pricey but the food was absolutely extraordinary! From now on, anytime we are going back to San Francisco, this will most definitely be our place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice: Comfort at a Reasonable Price and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: carbonyl
Reviews.Content: I attended a 5-day convention at the Moscone Convention Center. The Donatello was a 15-minute walk along safe, busy streets to the Convention Center. There are several restaurants in all price ranges near the hotel, including the Zingari restaurant in the hotel, where the food was excellent but not cheap. My room in the hotel was very pleasant ---spacious with a chair, sofa., small refrigerator, and microwave. The housekeeping service was excellent and accommodating to my schedule. On the top floor, excellent coffee was available all day in a lounge for reading newspapers or playing games on the tables. The service at the front desk was also excellent and very helpful. The price was very reasonable as compared with the larger hotels in the area. I would certainly stay at this hotel the next time I am in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Top for location but not too much more”
Reviews.Author: LGTripper
Reviews.Content: As frequent Tripadvisor users and reviewers, we see twice as many excellent ratings compared to v.g. for the Donatello. We say, then, the Donatello is clearly overrated. Perhaps this has to do with the fact that it is part of a condo-exchange program with Shell Hospitality and some reviews own shares at the Donatello and are trying to encourage trades? The hotel definitely gets high marks for location as it is very close to Union Square right in the heart of S.F. And, yes, the price is reasonable: you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a charming hotel with a certain je ne sais quoi, the Donatello is NOT it. While the staff is more than nice, the hotel is a little run down, tired and dated. It is clean. However the bed sheets were not crisp being a little gray and wrinkled. Don't want to "dis" this hotel as it is more than adequate and a good value. However, excellent really is a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Great Amenities and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: iversonj88
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my stay at the Donatello in San Francisco this past week. They had a variety of "unexpecteds" that made the stay outstanding. To start, the staff at check-in made a fine impression, but then the relatively slow elevator bummed me out (I got over it later). I got to my very clean room, but felt so-so on it- the decor was nice but not particularly luxurious, the view was only decent, and overall it was somewhat forgettable, though very spacious. I will say I really didn't like the shower. But, everyday after returning from perusing the city, our lights were on, the curtains had been drawn, and there were mints on our pillows- it was awesome. HOWEVER, from this initial impression on the stay got better and better. We went to the club house, where they have complimentary wine and cheese tasting opposite their excellent fitness center- it housed updated and slick machines and a beautiful coed hot tub area, coupled with saunas separate for the boys and girls. Further, the concierge can be found on this level and they were all amazing- the best I've come across. We got a variety of recommendations on restaurants and activities that were all enjoyable, plus they got us a reservation to a VERY exclusive restaurant that we had contacted not an hour before and were told it was full. From here we went down to the excellent bar/ Zingari restaurant. Happy hour had very good pricing, and while I didn't get a full meal, the appetizers we tried out were delicious, if slightly small on portions. The bartender made me the best Tom Collins of my life, and as we continued to return over the next few nights, we had great conversation, all my variety of drinks were made fast and better than the last, and I felt like my patronage was truly appreciated- really the bartender was excellent. Further, they had live jazz music scheduled for every single night- maybe not the best singers in town, but they were all very enjoyable and it made a great atmosphere. The location of this hotel is about as good as it comes, very satsified. While the rooms were very comfortable, it was the unparalleled staff that made this stay fantastic. Its not like I sat around the hotel for 6 hours a day, but I spent a good amount of time here and it was one of the highlights of my trip. I travel pretty regularly and this beats most other places I have ever stayed, probably all of them- and the price was phenomenal. I can't recommend it highly enough because you will really feel like an important customer, and also reap a heightened experience of the city because of the resources they make available to you. Go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: thebiv
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this wonderful hotel March 11, 2010. We arrived in the city the day before so we were at the hotel around noon. Not expecting our room to be ready, it was! The people were so friendly, the room was spotless and big! We spent 1 evening at the Hyatt Grand our 1st evening in San Fransico and it's room size did not compare to this wonderful room. The windows open for some nice fresh air. It's location is smack in the middle of Union Square, how close everything was for us. We never needed to rent a car as the cable car was on the next block. Taxi's were always available. The restaurant was handy but the bar and entertainment in the lounge was very nice! Such a nice way to end the day with a cocktail and some Jazz. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, comfortable & clean rooms, wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: BuddhaDad
Reviews.Content: VALUE: One of the things that initially drew me to the Donatello was the price, it was much less expensive than many of the other big name hotels in downtown SF. I was also impressed by the reviews on TripAdvisor, and the location (~1 block from Union square, about 4 blocks from BART). I was not disappointed. LOCATION: I was attending a conference that took place in Moscone center and in several other hotels in the city. The Donatello is about 8 blocks from Moscone center, but it is a nice walk through downtown SF, with lots of high-end shops to look at along the way. The Donatello doesn't have a continental breakfast, but that is OK with me. There are lots of little coffee shops and diners in the area to get breakfast. If you want to get to the Fisherman's wharf area, the Donatello is only a few blocks from the Cable car line. Being close to BART means that you can easily get to and from the airport inexpensively, or travel to other parts of the Bay area (Berkeley, Oakland, etc). ROOM: My room was large with a King Size bed and a Queen size hideaway. There was a separate nook with the closet, a chest of drawers, mirror for dressing. It was nice to be able to keep all of my clothes etc. in this nook rather than clutter up the main part of the room. The closet had a safe that was easy to operate and worked well for storing my laptop. There was also an iron and ironing board. There is no real desk for working, but I set my computer on the coffee table and worked from the couch, which was OK, but someone wanting to do serious long-term work might not be happy. The free-WiFi worked well, if a bit slow. There were also spare outlets around which I appreciated. The TV had a good size screen. I really appreciated the fact that the refrigerator was NOT stocked with anything. That way I could buy a few groceries at a nearby store and use the fridge. There were also a few plates, bowls, glasses, utensils etc., and a small microwave so if you are on a budget and don't want to eat all your meals at a restaurant, you can easily stock in some provisions for breakfast and lunch. BATHROOM: Spotless and well appointed. SERVICE: The staff were all friendly and helpful. I wanted to continue working out while on my trip, so I talked to the concierge. (Somewhat unusually, the concierge is located on the top floor "club". ) The concierge recommended a run along the waterfront which was great -- although you have to run about a mile through town to get down to the waterfront, but after that it is a great running route. GENERAL AMENITIES: There is a nice little workout room on the top floor with a treadmill, stairmaster, and various small weight machines. The "club" on the top floor also has a room with plush chairs/sofas and a wide assortment of teas, hot chocolate, coffee etc. The "business center" is a bit of a joke -- just about the size of a large phone booth containing one computer and a printer. But it was adequate (just barely) for me to get my online boarding pass for my airline flight. OVERALL: Great place to stay when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Karol_mcc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance from the BART station, and the Union Square shopping is one block away. The hotel itself is clean with very curtious and helpful staff. The room was spacious with comfortable beds. I would definitely return on future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the middle of upbeat San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: snazzy66
Reviews.Content: I was on the way to traveling from one coast to another. The staff, just about everyone was very helpful whether it was to offer help or just to chat. Hotel has a good restaurant, a fitness center and offers time shares. It is in an area of many hotels, but the comfortableness of the rooms, the helpful, friendly staff, the business center, fitness center make it a winner. There is no pool, but in the climate of San Francisco that is not a necessity. w

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: ubl
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Close to shopping, restaurants and transit. Complimentary beverages in lounge, kitchenette in room very useful. Abit noisy at night, but if windows closed not too bad. Enjoyed the Friday cheese and wine. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomdations with the added value of courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: pbirds
Reviews.Content: All of my family appreciated the room's accomodations. i.e. coffee, microwave, good reading lights(I suggest a three-way bulb), cloth napkins! From past experience in other motels street noise can always be a problem in SF, but the ability to open windows for fresh air far outweighs that negative. I asked for three rooms together on the highest floor possible and got exactly what I wanted. Staff was helpful and professional. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back!”
Reviews.Author: Husbuzz
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. So clean and spacious rooms. Everyone was so nice and went " above and beyond." We especially enjoyed our morning coffees upstairs. Poldi (hope I spelled her name right) was so nice and so very helpful. Perfect location. Only downside was the noise (from the street)-only on the weekends. Ask for a quiet room and you'll be fine. We will definately return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Very Good”
Reviews.Author: travelsmartOttawa
Reviews.Content: Starting off with the pluses -- as others have said, the location is central (near cable cars, BART, etc.) but right downtown so very busy and can be noisy. But I didn't hear a lot of street noise from the 5th floor. The hotel staff were friendly and responsive. The rooms are large and we lucked out by getting a terrace room. It's not luxurious but it's clean, spacious, and you can't beat the price. My only criticisms would be that my teen son found the sofa bed to be uncomfortable so there was some complaining. I understand that they have cots also, so that might have been better. However, I found the king bed to be comforable. Also, I am surprised it is highly-rated for business as there was no proper business desk and chair which is typical in hotels. You either sat on a low bench at a table, or on the couch with a low table, to work on a laptop. Or you sat with it on your lap. We stayed for five nights so this was bothersome. also, they don't have breakfast anymore which is too bad. we did some breakfasts in the room but also had a few expensive diner breakfasts nearby. I thought the hotel restaurant was a bit expensive - $9 for gelato one night -- but they do have happy hour with half price appetizers. I found SF to be generally an expensive city - restaurants, museums, etc. More expensive than New York and Washington. one place that we liked for a reasonable dinner was Postrio at 545 Post Street, just next door. they had a bar menu that was tasty and perfect for a light meal. Having the microwave, sink and fridge in the room was handly. they should provide dishwashing liquid and dish towels though. I did wonder if dishes were properly cleaned by the housekeeping staff. All in all, if you aren't too fussy and you don't require top notch furniture, linens, etc., you will be happy here. And once again, there is a lot of value for the price, including free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeedsLassNewZealand
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this Hotel and we could not of made a better choice. All the staff were amazingly helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable we had asked for a quiet room and that is exactly what we got. The location was perfect, one block from Union Square and we would recommend this Hotel to anyone. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Canada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in San Francisco for 4 nights. I had a very spacious and well furnished room on the fifth floor. A queen bed and a very comfortable sofa, LCD TV, dvd player, stereo, microwave, small refrigerator and the stuff necessary to prepare a fast meal equipped the room. Efficient and courteous staff. Excellent location just a block from Union Square. The restaurant is a bit overpriced but there are a lot of excellent restaurants nearby the hotel on Post Str. I will certainly return to this place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Big beautiful room, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: lazrgirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time at The Donatello. Our 12 night stay there went very well. We were happy with the quick and courteous service from the front desk and house keeping. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The house keeping staff were great always greeting us when we walked down the hall. They even wash your dishes and give you clean ones every morning. The room was large with a sitting area, a couch and chair. It also had a wide screen LCD TV, fridge, and microwave. Our only trouble was with the internet service but that was minor compared with the rest of the quality of our stay there. We plan on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Runner2010
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at The Donatello on March 3-8, 2010. The front desk staff went above the call of duty to assist us. We reserved 3 rooms (one group was coming in a couple of days later). They made sure all our rooms were together and gave great recommendations for food and attractions. Each room was set-up a little different which we really liked. My husband and I got a corner room that we thoroughly enjoyed. I would strongly recommend The Donatello to anyone visiting San Francisco. The location is great and the staff was excellent. The Club Room was also great for visiting with family that came to visit.

Reviews.Title: “perfection in san Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: slkVisalia_Ca
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Donatello on several occasions and love everything about it!! The staff is friendly,helpful and goes out of its way to assist. The location is perfect for getting to Union Square,Market St, the Financial District,shopping and public transportation. Parking is convenient and very reasonable. The room is beautiful,large and comfortable.The amenitiies are first class. The Club Lounge offers free coffee,etc all the time and consierge service that goes out of its way to please. All in all, we can not recommend the Donatello high enough to either the first time visiter to SF, or the frequent visitor to the City By the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “5 star accomodations with 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaSandie
Reviews.Content: I love the Donatello! I lived in SF for 12 years and now come back once a year or so to visit. I usually stay outside the city because I need parking and like to have a fridge and microwave. The Donatello has a parking package that is great -- the valet parking is quick and friendly. They're studio suites that are quite large and comfortable w/all those amenities and still have 5 star amenities like room service, concierge, turn down service and a great club room on the top floor. I will definitely stay here in the future! The only complaint is the restaurant food is pretty bland and way overpriced for what it tastes like. Too much good food in SF. They need to change restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RobertaNManhattan_NY
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel in the late morning and was greeted by a very friendly and helpful Manuel at the front desk. He had a room available. The room was very large and had a safe (which I like for my laptop); a small fridge, a microwave, sink (in the kitchenette). I usually travel with some food and the fridge was very convenient. The room was large and comfortable. There were two robes in the room. Free internet. It was very clean. It had a large screen TV - a DVD player and a CD/Radio player. There was no good desk chair so if you need to work at a desk for a period of time, you will have to ask them to bring you one or call and ask if they have them. The location was terrific - walking distance from Bart, the Powell Street trolley and Market Street. It was perfect for public transportation if you didn't want to take a cab. I got a great deal on the room ($117 + tax) but based on the other reviews here at Trip Advisor, I was not disappointed. I also heard that the restaurant in the hotel was quite good but I had other plans. The club level has coffee and tea available all day and a lovely fitness center, steam room, jacuzzi and showers. If you want to have breakfast, there is a wonderful place called Lori's right down the block at 336 Mason. They are friendly and they even do room service to the hotel. Avoid the Pinecrest Diner. I went there when it was half empty and they rudely told me that booths were only available for parties greater than one. I was told to sit at the counter. Instead I chose to sit at Lori's. I walked in the door and was greated by a very friendly staff who told me to sit anywhere, immediately asked if I wanted coffee and brought me a lovely breakfast. Service was great and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Claire
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and staff, perfect location, rooms are large and beds very confortable! Best deal! I recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to SF

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Bssmag
Reviews.Content: Researched thoroughly to find hotel in San Francisco. Very happy with our selection of the Donatello. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, from valet to front desk staff. Rooms were very spacious, comfortable and clean. Location, in Union Square, was perfect, with an easy walk to the BART, China Town and the cable car. Would definitely stay again on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- but bad Internet”
Reviews.Author: E_Panama
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed here with a delegation of 10 people, and we had a great experience. I repeated this year for a 5 day stay, and overall I was happy, with some major caveats. On the good side, the staff is very friendly, the rooms are huge, well apointed, and the location can't be beat. 1 block from union square and walking distance to westfield mall and moscone center. The rate is only very good compared to other hotels in the area. One thing to mention, is that last month they eliminated the included continental breakfast they offered. Now it's at least $8 per breakfast. But there's a fridge and sink in the room, so it's easy to go to Walgreens and get breakfast supplies. My MAJOR complaint (and I wouldn't return to the hotel unless I'm guaranteed this is fixed) is that the Internet access was horrible. Slower than a modem, erratic, couldn't do anything. I wasted hours trying to get and send email. I live and die by connectivity, and without it I wouldn't be able to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A night in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: WayneToron2
Reviews.Content: We had been staying in Napa Valley but had an early flight home so decided to stay at the Donatello. All staff were very friendly and helpful. My wife left a bag in the car that the valet had just parked but he was more than happy to run down to the parking lot to retrieve it. They have a Welcome wine and cheese party on Friday nights which was informative and fun. The staff showed us where to catch the cable car to get to Fisherman's Wharf for a fantastic dinner looking out on the Golden gate Bridge. We checked out at 3 AM and although we had a card to show us how to get to the airport, Chris at the front desk took the time to write out directions for a quicker route. A great place to stay in the heart of San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Hotel - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: scrutinizing
Reviews.Content: We booked a great deal through hotwire, and were very pleased with our choice. The Donatello enjoys a good location, friendly staff, very good concierge, although we didn't quite get the concierge up in the club level. The gym is small and dated, however who needs a workout after walking the hills of San Francisco. I would stay there again for the excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CBacha
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed in San Francisco for 6 nights. We had a courtesy early check-in to a very spacious and well furnished room on the seventh floor. A huge double bed and a very comfortable sofa bed where my 19 years old son could sleep very well. LCD TV, dvd player, stereo, microwave, small refrigerator and the stuff necessary to prepare a fast meal equipped the room. Efficient and courteous staff. Excellent location just a block from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: planthenexttrip
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Donatello. Rooms were spacious, clean and well equipped. We were lucky enough to have a room on the 5th floor with a terrace, complete with table and chairs to enjoy some California sunshine outside, whilst listening to the hum of the city. This is not a luxury hotel - unlike the Westin next door, however we paid less than $90 per night (including taxes) via Hotwire, which made the reasonable rates at this hotel even more of a steal - and definitely more personal service/extra touches than the standard Holiday Inn/Marriott type hotels. Location was perfect, one block from Union Square so close to shops, restaurants and transport options. I was slightly concerned when we arrived and I realised it was a time share property - however no one tried to give us a hard sell on anything, and to be honest if I hadn't have seen the brochure in our room I wouldn't have realised at all during our stay. If you are looking for out and out opulence then this is not the place, however if you are looking for a hotel in the middle of the action, that is a step above the standard "chain" hotels, then definitely check out the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine hotel: not a "luxury" property, but a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tuckernyc
Reviews.Content: Set a block from Union Square and amid great restaurants and similarly rated 3 and 3 1/2 star hotels, the Donatello neither "wow'd" nor disappointed. The hotel is well maintained, clean, safe, quiet, and pleasing to the eye, reminding one of a "faux luxury" hotel from the 1980's. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the rooms very spacious and clean (the hotel photos are accurate), and the in-room free wireless excellent. The top floor lounge was especially pleasant and cozy, with terraced views. The rates (mine: $114 average per night) were a bargain, justifying its high rating on TripAdvisor. If you're looking for "luxury" digs, go to the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, and spend 3-4 times more for the gilt and mirrors. But if you want a nice place where you don't feel you're being ripped off, check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: travlrr
Reviews.Content: We were here with young children for 3 nights. The staff was accommodating and polite. The location was fantastic and we walked or took the F line everywhere. Our kids were welcome here and really enjoyed their stay. The lounge on the roof was nice to enjoy or own wine from and take in the city views. For the price I just don’t see how you can stay at a better location. Quiet hotel but remember your are in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel experience! Wonderful hotel, outstanding personal service.”
Reviews.Author: mormorx10
Reviews.Content: A fun overnight with friends—we all live in the Bay Area—was made even better with the surprising extras at the Donatello: large rooms (sitting area with couch, table and chairs) with amenities like refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes, glasses, etc. We felt at home in the heart of SF and could relax and visit comfortably in the room before going out at night. The staff were cheerfully helpful and extended themselves to make us feel important. We couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms for the Union Square area”
Reviews.Author: lulugate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel through Shell vacations so I was not sure what to expect. Hotel is in a great location, about 1.5 blocks from Union Square with tons of restaurants and shops. Close to public transportation and walking distance to China Town and North Beach (long walks, but perfect to sight see along the way). Room was much larger than expected. Most of the hotels in the area have much smaller rooms since they are all quite old and built that way. We had a queen bed and a couch that pulled out to a double and a large dressing area off of the bathroom. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: nadojeff
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel in a fantastic location. The desk was helpful and the trip was pretty flawless. We did book this hotel through Expedia and it appeared to me that they were a little "put off" by the fact that it was not a direct booking. This was never stated directly, but inferred by the statement that "we see that your stay has been paid for in advance". Regardless, there is nothing that I can say that is negative about this hotel. It has a very nice piano bar, nice sized rooms, good amenities and a good staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly met our needs”
Reviews.Author: Randall-Anne
Reviews.Content: We were impressed from arrival to departure. Prompt valet parking assistance, very courteous and efficient greeting and service by front desk personnel. Room was more than spacious and extremely well equipped. Much better than far more expensive S.F. hotels. The only minor complaint was street noise early in the morning . . . the "open-able" (cranked out) windows don't offer the same sound insulation as more modern sealed windows (though we enjoyed the cool air in the late afternoon). We were on the 9th floor . . . try for the 14th for a quieter room (and more sleep in the early morning). Our departure was a courteous, friendly and efficient as our arrival. All of the staff members were extremely helpful with a special nod to Jesus Rodriquez.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello was the perfect choice for an extended business stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lakawana
Reviews.Content: I plan to make The Donatello my home base when in San Francisco. Its convenient location, near Union Station and just around the corner from my SFO office, is perfect. Friendly service and generously sized rooms made staying over several days a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: LesP_Lexington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference held at one of the monster hotels two blocks away. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. The chief concierge, Peter Nasatir, was an incredible asset. From steering me to the right restaurants to finding a wine bar open in the afternoon for a promised celebration, he seemed to know everything going on in the city. The rest of the staff was also superb. The only snafu was that the WiFi signal in my room was very weak. The management knew about the problem but could not seem to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and it doesn't end there.”
Reviews.Author: firstclassforever
Reviews.Content: Okay - you can't beat the location. It's a block off Union Square. Plenty of shopping and dining within one to two blocks. Moscone Center is farther but easily walkable. In fact, if you like to walk, San Francisco is very walkable. The Donatello is a small hotel. Not the mega Marriott or Westin or Hyatt ilk for that matter. If you like big - this ain't it. The restaurant is okay but not world class or anything. The bar area is adequate but loud. This hotel shines at the level of friendliness of the staff. They all make an effort to welcome you, say hello every day, and ask if they can do anything for you. It is a really nice atmosphere. The rooms are nice with lots of conveniences but I did not care for the bed. Just way too soft for me. Somedays getting hot water seemed to be a time thing with certain times of the day not too good. Would I stay here again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello provided everything I needed.”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveller727
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty seasoned hotel-dweller and have seen my share of bad ones but The Donatello was perfect. Just the right amount of service and amenities. I especially appreciated how they made it possible to have a meal or two in my room with a refrigerator (NOT stocked full of mini-bar stuff), microwave, plates, cups, bowls, utinsels. You're not going to prepare a meal there but can heat up your leftovers from one of the great restaurants nearby. The concierge staff is knowledgeable and quite helpful. Their workout room is small but adequate and the sauna was a nice touch. The rooms were a nice size, room to work, nicely decorated and clean. Neighborhood is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great trifecta of value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Redlands_CAFoodie
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers tremendous value, just off Union Square. The rooms, although not luxurious, were spacious and quite comfortable. The staff of the hotel were the real stars, from the front desk, to housekeeping, to the bellman, everyone was courteous, friendly and professional. Overall, it was a great experience that will definitely bring me back again, I hope very soon.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: brissie__kel
Reviews.Content: My husband and i enjoyed 3 nights here and found the location convenient, did not have any trouble with noise. nice little kitchenette with microwave , sink and mini fridge. no complaints - except we had some trouble with the internet dropping in and out, and no main light in the bedroom - just lamps galore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: custer1
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Donatello was some of the most helpful and courteous we have encountered in our stays away from home. The hotel has a great location near public transportation and restaurants downtown. Get a city pass for public transportation. The hotel itself is a little dated but reasonably well maintained. We found an old smell in some of the bedding, just ask to change it out. One other complaint is that the staff come a little to early in the mornings to clean the rooms. The city is very urban, but the architecture is old and beautiful. We stayed a week, took some cruises and tours. I would not rate this hotel 5 stars, maybe 4. My wife and I had a great week in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DesertMonsoon
Reviews.Content: Spent a delightful week at The Donatello Hotel in downtown San Francisco. Within 1-1/2 block you had access to cable car, muni, rental cars, shopping, great bars, saloons, and restaurants. The staff were memorable and we were quite pleased with the size of the rooms and the small fridge and microwave. We often used the Club House & saunas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodation for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: reddogz1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located one block from Union Square. The room was extremely clean and quite large for a hotel in downtown San Francisco. Definitely would recommend it and I plan on staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome hotel in an awesome city!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMommy7
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Donatello. This was my first time visiting San Francisco and thanks to the Donatello it was great! From the moment we checked in, the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Shortly after we arrived, we received complementary champaigne with chocolate covered strawberries just to welcome us and say thanks. It was a very sweet and unexpected gesture! The room was awesome. We had plenty of room for our toddler to run around and play. It was nice and clean, and had all the little extras one could need (microwave, frig, sink, cups, plates, silverware, etc) The bed was extremely comfortable! I had the best nights sleep during my stay. The bathroom was also nice and roomy. I was suprised at how great the water pressure was in the shower. I have stayed at so many other hotels where the water pressure sucked, so this was a pleasant surprise. I would have to say the ONLY thing that I found to me "missing" from the room (which is something so small) is a coat rack. It would have been nice to hang up our coats on when we came in from the rain. :) Also I really liked how close The Donatello was to everything we needed such as shopping, food, drugstore, Starbucks. The concierge, which was also very helpful, gave us maps and suggestions for activities and nearby restaurants. We ate at a couple of those restaurants and the food was wonderful. Although we didn't pay for parking with the hotel, there was another parking structure right next door that was a little cheaper ($27 including tax) for 24 hr parking with in/out priveledges. Lastly, the price that I paid for our room, made this a steal of a deal. I booked/paid in advance at the non-refundable rate of $104 a night! What more can you ask for? I can't wait to visit SF again, and when my I do I'm definitely staying at The Donatello Hotel! ...and I will be recommending this to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Candelisaton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights a few years ago and feel obliged to inform people of how good this hotel is. I stayed in another hotel on a previous trip to san fran and was really disappointed with the size of the room as i was barely able to move in it and on speaking to people about this they informed me that most hotels in the city have small rooms but when i arrived in the donatello i was delighted. the rooms are so spacious and theres a little kitchenette area with tea making facilities which is really nice. Its right in the middle of everything, just off union square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and i wont stay anywhere else on returning to san francisco

Reviews.Title: “A gem in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SportsReporter
Reviews.Content: On the corner of Post and Mason lies a steal of a bargain with luxury amenities. With an ideal location (one block from Union Square, 10 mins to Fisherman's Wharf by cab and six minutes from AT&T Park), you would think this small, European boutique-style hotel would cost an arm and a leg, but it does not. I paid about $125 a night and it felt like a $300 a night hotel. Rooms are very spacious and there is a kitchenette in room. The hotel is very quiet, and the staff bends over backwards to make your stay the very best experience. Free internet is in every room. Wolfgang Puck coffee was a nice choice of coffee. Bathrooms are quite large. Ironing board, iron, blow dryer, coffee maker, microwave, cereal bowls, and a really nice extra comforter are all in the rooms. The bed was very comfortable. Nice touches include a personal wake-up call, not automated. The first wake-up call I received was funny, because I was half-asleep when the phone rang. The front desk called back a few minutes later just to make sure I had woken up! They knew I had not. The hotel has an Italian restaurant down stairs called Zingari, and while I didn't eat there, it was full both nights. There is a continental breakfast every morning, and it's better than most offerings of this type of breakfast. Fresh fruit, hot and cold cereal, eggs, pastries, English muffins, bagels, coffee, tea, an assortment of juices and more await you for ten dollars. For the tourist who is not familiar with San Francisco, here's one important point: the hotel's front entrance is facing Mason, not Post Street. So coming from the East Bay, after you turn left on Geary, you turn right on Taylor, right on Post and when you hit the corner of Post and Mason....turn right on Mason. The hotel's entrance is about 20 feet down with a blue canopy out front. it's confusing- it looks like the hotel is on Mason. Parking at the hotel is $28 per 24 hours with in and out privileges, but here's something to think about: they ran an early bird special both days I was there. In by 9:30 AM, out by 6 PM,and it's $10. That's a steal in San Francisco proper. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. You can't beat the price, the service is fabulous and it's very quiet. I'm guessing there are only ten rooms per floor, so you don't hear a lot of people in the hallways. The location is superb--you are walking distance from some great restaurants, including Morton's The Steakhouse which is a half a block down on Post on the left side. What a wonderful gem to find in a city known for overpriced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The outstanding staff went above and beyond to assist me when they were full and I wanted to extend my stay.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: The service oriented staff at The Donatello is terrific. When space is available, the rates for rooms and parking are reasonable. The rooms are ideal for business or leisure travel and include a microwave and refrigerator. There are plenty of shops, galleries, and restaurants within walking distance for guests without a car. It also has convenient access to major highways and bridges. I hope to stay at The Donatello again when I return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello Hotel is close to everything in Union Square and the amenities with in the hotel are great!”
Reviews.Author: Jilliantrent
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay because you have a kitchenette and you are close to all the stores.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sueray21
Reviews.Content: The Donatello hotel was so clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, located close to Union Square, Bart, shopping and a short walk to Chinatown. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco and I'll stay there again whenever I go back. I loved the warm comfy complimentary robe too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice quiet rooms with all the amenities you need!”
Reviews.Author: schoolgirl77
Reviews.Content: Like my title suggests, my friend and I had a great one-night stay. We were able to check-in early at noon, and the clerk called our room and asked if we needed help setting up the sofa bed because of the room set-up. When I requested a razor, it was brought up for free within 10 minutes. The concierge recommended several dining options nearby and the two we tried had such great food and service. The main thing I noticed was how ready the staff was to help you. If two of them were chatting behind the desk and they saw a guest, they would stop talking and face the guest just in case they were approached. Since I booked online, check-in and check-out took a total of less than 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location with spacious, well-equipped rooms”
Reviews.Author: rshorens
Reviews.Content: The spacious, well-appointed room is more like a studio apartment with microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, stereo system, and dishes. You can't get a better location for enjoying museums, shopping, dining, and theater in San Francisco. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. Try to get a rate that includes parking if you have a car. You can walk to many places of interest, or drive/take cab or public transportation to Golden Gate Park, Civic Center, etc. Great value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location but horrible street parking”
Reviews.Author: jungie86
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly service, and large rooms! I reserved this hotel for my family who was visiting me in the city, and they thoroughly enjoyed it. Because it's owned by a timeshare company, it's nicely furnished with bright colored and comfortable furnitures. In addition it's fully utilized with the sink, silverware, cups, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dvd player, plentiful closet space, full length mirror, and even a stereo! The only minor minor thing I would complain is the bathroom, it works perfectly (well the toilet, never used the shower since I wasn't technically staying there) and everything you need is provided (travel size), but just seems a little outdated, definitely next thing that needs to be renovated. Hotel is awesome, the service was very friendly, the rooms seem very modern and up-to-date, but the rest of the hotel is a bit outdated looking. Regardless, it was a great place to stay and very comfortable/homey. Parking was a bit of problem because I did not want to pay ridiculous amounts for it, but we got by. Lots of great restaurants nearby! Definitely check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: jazzNevada
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, parking on site with in and out privileges, very clean and comfortable. The absolutely best part was the location. We could walk to restaurants and art galleries, took a taxi to and from "Wicked", and walked to shopping. Easy to get to The Jazz Heritage Museum. Even the rain didn't detract from a wonderful stay at the Donatello - they even loaned us an umbrella! We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay ...Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Passions61
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for 5 nights in early Jan10. There were 4 of us and we stayed in 1 room with 1 king size bed and pull out sofa. Despite that , there were enough room for us and our bags. The bathroom was also big. The ambience was great and the location was very close to Union Square and the transportation required. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: xxroaddog
Reviews.Content: Despite looking at reviews, one is always slightly skeptical when staying someplace new. The Donatello exceeded our expectations in all respects. Incredibly helpful and friendly staff and the room was clean, fresh and very nicely appointed. Our room overlooked Post Street and, admittedly, it was a bit noisy, but hey, this is in the heart of San Francisco, so that is to be expected. Ate dinner at the restaurant and it was excellent as well. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I hate to let others in on this best kept secret, but The Donatello and its wonderful staff deserve better, so here it is: if you are planning a trip to San Francisco (business or leisure) and you are looking for the most spacious and well designed rooms in town, central location (one block off Union Square), if you appreciate being treated like a guest (compared to the number treatment you get at most other hotels), and if you want the best value you can get The Donatello is the hotel for you. I usually stay at five star hotels, and have stayed at many hotels of that category in San Francisco before business brought me to The Donatello, and it will definitely be my hotel in San Francisco from now on - this is the best hotel in San Francisco!
