It was large, like an apartment, with a dining room and a living room, but no kitchen, two large bedrooms and two baths. The decor was very out dated, but comfortable. The bathrooms were very small, dingy and seemed like they didn't belong, in proportion to the rest of the suite, more like they belonged in motel six. The towels were substandarderd,as were the shampoos and soaps. It should have been a great room, but really needed up-dating!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with great location and service”
Reviews.Author: dolcas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for one week at the start of July and we were very impressed. The room was large, very clean and well equipped. Staff were very attentive and helpful. Having breakfast included was a bonus. We would recommend this hotel for anybody travelling with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - But a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: sunluvva
Reviews.Content: ROOM 502: Large bed. Cool room. Small bath. Steamy mirror. Poor shower. No shower gel. Coffee machine available (no tea), plus fridge, microwave and toaster. Big TV. Poor lighting. Noisy city at night. SERVICES: Conceirge extremely helpful with booking tours. Breakfast choice was poor as well as the crowded seating area. AREA: Cable cars are slow with huge queues. Bus tours available (until 5pm) to Fishermans Wharf then on to Alcatraz and access towards Golden Gate Bridge. Sonoma wine country tour is worthwhile. I WOULD RECOMMEND STAYING IN A HOTEL NEAR FISHERMAN'S WHARF.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ballyhack5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Donatello for 4 nights at the start of a holiday in California. A great hotel, good sized rooms, friendly staff and good value. Within easy walking distance of Union Square. I would certanly have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: darav3
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderful and had a great sense of humor! We were contacted by the concierge within a few hours of checking, they wanted to find out how they could help us during our stay. It was located in a central area and close to so much. The rooms felt welcoming and comfortable. We had enough room for my sister-in-law to drop in and spend the night. The bathrooms show the hotels age but were clean and well stocked. I did like that we were provided a bathrobe. We only were there two nights and it was quite a nice stay. The continental breakfast was light but there. I loved that there was FREE wireless internet in the rooms! Though the 30 some odd dollars for parking was no fun the hotel was close enough to walk to get public transit so we did not have to pay more for parking.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Start, Nicely Handled”
Reviews.Author: RouteBound
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Donatello based upon nice reviews here on TripAdvisor. Walked in and was told that the hotel was oversold (guess the economy isn't hurting everywhere). To their credit, we were comped a room over at their sister hotel; the Intercontinental. They handled the situation very nicely, and provided a reference person to talk to and a letter for us to provide to that person verifying the freebie. The Intercontinental handled the other end very graciously, and we were provided with a very nice room on the 24th floor. While we were disappointed with the situation, we were very impressed with the result, and we would certainly book another room at either hotel. Side note: The breakfast downstairs at the Intercontinental is very good, and its' location at the base of Mission Street is perfect for accessing various sites in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; helpful friendly staff; and good rates”
Reviews.Author: fn820
Reviews.Content: 5 night stay with the family to attend a conference. Everything in the room worked as it should; the bed and the pullout were comfortable; and there was plenty of shelving and storage space for our assorted gear. Our room looked almost exactly like the one on their website. Breakfast room is very relaxing but get there early or the best fruits will be gone. It even a wrap-around balcony for the hard-core smokers.... We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sized Room - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MikeC52
Reviews.Content: We stayed three weeknights in The Donatello on family vacation with two teenagers. The room was great size for the four of us. We read the tips on the pullout couch and was semi-worried going in - but it was perfect! The room rate was reasonable and the location is the best - Union Square. So much walkable and accessible nearby. The service was top notch and front desk very helpful and friendly. The only knock was the workout room - very subpar. One treadmill and bike won't cut it at a major hotel property. Did find an outstanding three mile run downtown through Union Square area - excellent! The breakfast area was also crowded and was confusing if it was complimentary or you needed to pay. Didn't matter as two of the best breakfast places are very close and walkable - Dottie's and Crepes. Overall - very favorable stay and would recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the greatest city!”
Reviews.Author: ckori
Reviews.Content: Close to Union Square shopping and the China Town culture, the Donatello Hotel is a great value in San Francisco! A good restaurant, Happy Hour, piano music in the Lobby and a knowledgeable, exceptional staff! Won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kildare08
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but was really impressed with the hotel, large rooms, friendly & helpful staff. Only complaint was the spa area. The hot tub was only large enough to fit 2-4 people (which would be cramped then). Was looking forward to a soak to relax after a day of shopping/sightseeing but it just wasnt possible given the amount of people waiting to use. Sauna was the same, it wasnt turned on (takes 20mins to heat up) and was large enough for 2/3 people only. although in fairness to the hotel everything else was really good. Located just off Union Square so was really handy for good shopping/food/transport. Staff were very friendly and when i arrived back with my girlfriend after a day of shopping/sightseeing it was a really nice touch to find the curtains drawn and lamps on, with after dinner mints on the bedside. A really easy thing to do but a really nice touch from the staff. Room had a coffee machine, fridge, microwave, cutlerey (basically everything you need if your stay was longer and you fancied saving a few dollars by making lunch in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ktingirl
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay at the Donatello in Union Square was wonderful. Chinatown was just a few blocks away as were two of the cable car routes. We enjoyed walking around and found wonderful places to eat and drink. The staff were very helpful and our room was located on a quiet side street so we could rest well in the afternoon and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great C0mbination of price, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: estates4sale
Reviews.Content: My wife and i make regular treks to SF for a change of pace and have tried out dozens of hotels over the years. The Don fits us best. One block to Union Square, nice clean room with everything you expect but hardly ever get ... comfy king-sized bed (better than home!), clean room with nice furnishings, flat screen, dvd player, a little boom box, fridge, safe, coffee machine or Club room in the am for complimentary coffee, parking for 20 bucks if you ask for the combo package. What else? Little stuff like a robe, ironing board, hair dryer, queen-sized pull out. And the windows open, at least in our room, so you don't feel like you're in a hermetically sealed cage. And the service was top rate. We're going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a cozy/romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PaulRehob
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at The Donatello several times and enjoy its excellent central location in Union Square, within walking distance to the Starlite Night Club, several varieties of restaurants, trolley service etc. etc. The hotel's 2nd floor bar & lounge is very cozy/romantic with jazz singer & pianist to complete the setting. Hotel staff have always been very service oriented and no problem with the cozy, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CARoute66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to Union Square & public transportation. Staff was friendly & helpful. The hotel room was large & came with a microwave, minifridge, & dishes. Room was a little dated & the carpet could use a cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: barsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as Shell Vacation members. Their customer service is excellent. The front desk and bell caption service was very helpful. Room service was great with very good prices. Dinner at the Italian Restaurant at the hotel was 1st class. We will definitely stay here again. Location was perfect to take public transportation anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and enjoyable stay with great top-floor Concierges!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanSymonds
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 comfortable days at the Donatello while my partner was in SF at a conference, and found the rooms spacious and comfortable. They look somewhat dated, but one warms to that, and the convenience of having the space and a fridge and kitchen area is appreciated. Breakfast was limited but pleasant, not least for the opportunity to chat and pick the brains of the wonderful concierges - Poldi and Peter. They were a mine of information, and have extensive files of the same to hand to assist you in your sight-seeing and restaurant booking! Don't bother with the hotel restaurant - very average - go across the road to Fino's for good Italian food! (And don't forget the 'Cheesecake Factory' at Macey's - what a find!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: Heatherpdx
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a fantastic hotel. We really enjoyed the Friday night wine tasting.. The staff was very helpful in offering tips on navigating the city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdp62
Reviews.Content: Great location with good size rooms, friendly service, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvbuz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only one night, but wish I could have stayed longer. The value for the price is excellent. I traveled with my husband and my brother and the room was spacious enough to accommodate all three of us. The location could not have been better, a short walk to Union Square and the cable car lines. Our room was very clean (the bathroom was a bit dated, but clean). We stayed on the fifth floor and were not bothered by any city noise. I would highly recommended staying at the Donatello!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: KAMCE
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was a great place to stay! The rooms were very clean and were very spacious! We had great service from the concierge, Carlos, he was great! The bed was really comfortable and we had no street noise in our room! And the location was excellent. The trolley stop is only 1 block away and it gets you right to Fisherman's Wharf and Lombard Street. And it's fun to ride! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at The Donatello Hotel was one of the most memorable experiences of our trip.”
Reviews.Author: Judy1953
Reviews.Content: The room was huge, lots of storage space, very neat and clean. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was, perfect location, easy in and out. The concierge was very helpful, she made reservations for us for dinner and for some of the attactions, no additional fees. The happy hour was always the perfect way to the end of a wonderful sightseeing day. All of the hotel staff made us feel very welcomed. The restaurant was great. The waitstaff were very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and convenient downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tempetraveler66
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Donatello. The concierge was most helpful, the room was clean and more than adequate. It is easy to get to tourist sites, financial centers, Union Square and public transit from the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele
Reviews.Content: Large, comfortable rooms. Great location. Everyone in our group of nine loved this hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: bm93travel
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a 4 year old is never easy and one of the things we were looking for when planning to goto San Francisco was easy access to all the city has to offer without a car. The Donatello is literally 1 block away from Union Square where you can hop on and off the trolleys to Fisherman's Warf. The rooms at the Donatello are getting a little dated, especially in the bathrooms, but there was nothing gross about it. The living area was very spacious for the 3 of us and the noise level (floor 9 in front of the elevator) was actually quite minimal. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful and made us feel very welcome. The only less than ideal part of the hotel is the small breakfast area and the very limited food inluded in the continental breakfast (just an assortment of muffins and donuts). We ended up taking the food back to our rooms. Overall the it served as the perfect base of operations for our 5 day trip and for $99/night, this was the best bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Miaterry
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located, just a block away from Union Square and easy access to public transportation, which was important, as it made it easy to move around. I was travelling with my 13 year old grandson, and everyone at the Donatello made us feel right at home from the minute we arrived until our departure. Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the city and attractions. Rooms are very spacious, clean and well appointed. Beds are VERY comfortable. Breakfast (continental) was included and very good. High Speed internet was offered and free. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rutha33
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very accomodating and efficient. The suites were beautifully furnished and super clean-quite upscale and modern. Boutique style hotel right in the middle of terrific shopping and restaurants to walk to. Numerous art galleries all around. Easy access to the cable cars and tour buses. The consierge was extremely helpful the valet parking were top notch and very speedy to take our luggage and car. Never had such a fast and uncomplicated check in. Entrance very classy with marble and wood. The best was an Italian restaurant on the 2nd floor and a cosy piano bar.You must stay there it was a real treat to be so taken care of.next time I will plan to stay longer and take advantage of the spa and fitness areas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Kerrymonkey
Reviews.Content: Very large clean and modern rooms. Great value in superb central location. You're only a short hop from union sq and all the shopping etc. You're also very close to the trolleys that head up to the wharf. The breakfast is not really worth bothering with but there are some great places near by. We will return

Reviews.Title: “spacious, clean room, good location”
Reviews.Author: uncle_kyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Room was very clean, staff courteous. The amenities are great - it's spacious, almost like a studio suite. The microwave, sink, plates and mini fridge (not minibar!) let you do a bit of in-room cuisine, which saves on cost and lets you control more of what you eat (for the health-conscious). TV gets a ton of movie channels, wireless internet is free and there's a little desk for your laptop. Room gets street noise - especially thursday and friday night - people on the streets below were partying pretty loud. Didn't try the continental breakfast, but it's part of the amenities. This is a great deal. I'd stay here again if I traveled back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance to Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: SoTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel because we were out sightseeing a lot, but the fact that it had a fridge and small kitchen area was impressive. We didn't need to use our car to get to all the places we wanted to go. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: QPRTR
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Very good value. Our room had an outdoor terrace which was fantastic (only some rooms have this). I would stay there again if going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaKobeJapan
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Donatello from May 23-28 was truly wonderful! The hotel staff were pleasant, efficient and friendly. The hotel room was spacious, homey and well equipped.Internet was fast and free. The hotel is centrally located, just a short walk to Union Square-the transportation center, shops and restaurants. It is a gem. We intend to stay in Donatello whenever we go to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “a steal for the price”
Reviews.Author: njgirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. I was satisfied in every way. Great location, could walk everywhere in San Fransisco and it was in a great upscale area. The staff was very pleasant, room was large, clean, well equipped and very comfortable. It felt very upscale. The concierge gave us some great tips on Napa and places to eat in the city. I would most defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, Spacious and Reasonably Priced!”
Reviews.Author: rlgreenindiana
Reviews.Content: We were 2 adults with our 2 "20 something" kids on a family vacation for 5 days. Read a lot of nice reviews here and went for it. Requested room away from street and got what we wanted. Service was wonderful and quick for any request we made. We were within walking to all major shopping, nice resturants, and street cars. It was much nicer staying downtown instead of in commercialized Wharf area. Room were VERY spacious and clean and nice furnishings. Shower head was the only complaint. Bathroom was clean, but a little dated. Would stay here again any time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quality services - value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sarantis010
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel at the very center of the city (close to Union square), easy to approach, close to the commercial center (Union square) and to all main means of city transport. The services provided to us were very good. The hotel staff was very prompt to serve us well and immediately. The room, the WC (and the beds) were big and continuously kept very clean. The price of the room was very good. Many fittness services were provided free of charge. The "continental" breakfast, which was also included in the room price, was not very rich but acceptable. The room ("Club") in which the breakfast was provided (self-service) was rather small, but we never experienced any problem in finding a table.In general the value for money of this hotel is very high.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel in the US”
Reviews.Author: LisaHDK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights in the Donatello whilst on our honeymoon in the US.  We booked the Donatello based on previous trip advisor reviews and it lived up to the reputation.  The hotel is excellent, rooms are large, comfortable and well furnished with sofa/bed, plasma tv, fridge, coffee, kitchen sink, plates and cutlery.  Because we were on our honeymoon we were upgraded to a balcony room and given complimentary champagne upon arrival.  Jesus, along with all the staff at reception did everything they could to make us feel comfortable and welcome at this hotel.  Location is excellent just 1 block back from Union Square and so close to everything.  Free internet computer in the lobby for those without a laptop is great also.  We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: btsca99
Reviews.Content: We are Shell Resort Elite owners (from New Jersey) and have been to several Shell resorts and upscale destinations. We are regulars at The Donatello whenever we are in San Francisco. This hotel is not the most posh but for the location, comfort, amenities, and the super friendly, courteous staff, this hotel ranks up there. As soon as we walked in, the front desk welcomed us warmly. Our room was not ready because we got in early. So we went out for a quick lunch and when we returned our room was all ready with our luggage inside. We were given a room in the upper floor so we did not hear the city noise. The rooms and the hallways though could use an upgrade to make this hotel really outstanding. Their concierge staff has been superb and accommodating. Morgan worked with us on our dining tastes and she hit a 'home run' on every recommendation. The housekeeping staff always smiled and greeted us. The hotel is in Union Square right by the theater district and there are lots of galleries to see. The cable car, shops, restaurants, and a nice mall are all walking distance. This is a hotel that should be on everyone's list. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the midst of Union Square!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLuxuryone
Reviews.Content: The Donatello will far exceed your expectations. The rooms are large for San Francisco, clean and classy. The decor is trendy and the beds & linens are super cozy. From the moment you walk in, the staff at the Donatello seems eager to welcome you and to make your stay and visit to the City amazing. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value for money and central”
Reviews.Author: NoTack
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a brilliant location, and is great value for money. A nice safe, central, clean and tidy hotel. We had just come from pretty much a five star hotel in Vegas so were a bit nervous about what this hotel would be like. The rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable. Everything was in good condition. The hotel rooms were nice and quiet, and the staff friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was less than ten minutes walk to the main shopping area on Market Street, and the gorgeous Union Square was about five minutes walk, if that. So many lovely restaurants around to choose from, and not far from the central cable car route. We hada great time in San Francisco, no doubt made more enjoyable by staying in a lovely cosy hotel. I felt very at home here, both in the hotel and San Fran. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in ideal location with good services, and we would like to go back in the future.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler452
Reviews.Content: This hotel's staffs are very friendly and helpful. We stayed in Donatello for 3 nights and found that the location is perfect for taking public transportation. So a rental car is not needed. We didn't use all the available facilities but the daily complimentary breakfast is nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello lived up to its Tripadvisor hype.”
Reviews.Author: realjewell
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a two-night stay at The Donatello. I had read the many positive reviews, and the experience lived up to my expectations. The staff was unfailingly polite, cheerful, helpful, and downright friendly--particularly Ed at the reception desk. We arrived 2-1/2 hours before the 3 p.m. check-in time, so Ed took my cell phone number and called to tell us when our room was ready. The room was large, clean, comfortable, and very light, with large windows that afforded a view of the SF skyline, and side windows that actually opened, providing welcome fresh air. We had asked for a quiet room, and our 10th floor location provided just that. Several fifth floor rooms shared a common terrace, but we were afraid that the street noise at that level might be more of a problem. The concierge (Peter) suggested we eat at Colibri, a wonderful restaurant serving Yucatan specialties, rather than the more typical fare one finds at most Mexican restaurants. The food was delicious, and the restaurant is located just around the block. Zingari, the hotel's second-floor restaurant-lounge, offers half-price appetizers and $5 house wines from 4-7 p.m. The portions were sufficiently large to serve as dinner for us the night we arrived. The continental breakfast provided excellent orange juice along with oranges, apples, muffins, croissants, breakfast pastries, tea, and coffee in the Club Room on the hotel's top floor. Surrounding the Club Room is an outdoor terrace area that provides great views of The City. The complimentary wi-fi was a definite plus. A computer is available in the lobby for those who are not traveling with a laptop. All in all, ours was an entirely positive experience at The Donatello, and I recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “People at The Donatello go above and beyond expectations.”
Reviews.Author: grandpaPhoenix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located to some of the best restuarants, shopping and transportation. Ed and Jesus at the front desk will make you feel special and right at home. Any tour, restuarant and attraction you want to see Moises is the person that will make sure you have an excellent experience. We have stayed at The Donatello before and loved our stay so much we decided to bring our friends so they too could experience the best customer service oriented destination possible. We had a choice of going anywhere but knew they would experience something magical in San Francisco and expecially at The Donatello because of the warm, caring people who work there. I highly recommend The Donatello and I know we will be visiting again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: salsa42Leeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a two week holiday in California to enjoy the sites and sounds of San Francisco. Located just minutes from Union Square the location is excellent. Value for money also very good, with very competative rates for the area. Good links with local transport, a BART just down the road at Powell, and buses and cable cars to other interesting parts of the city, including Fishermans Wharf and Ocean Bay. Room is equipped with microwave, fridge, sink, cutlery and crockery, and coffee maker. Excellent free wifi for internet access and large telly with lots of channels, although our son wanted to watch the Stanley cup (ice hockey) on a channel that was not available.... Only one minor gripe, our booking included continental breakfast, and on one day there was nothing left when we arrived. The continental breakfast just consists of coffee tea in thermos, orange juice (very nice) and muffin. Some days there were some croissants which made a nice change. Also fruit, apples, oranges, and bananas. Not much room to sit down to eat, so we normally took what was available back to the room to eat. Despite being in the middle of the city, our room on the 10th floor was very quiet. We were not disturbed by traffic noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: DJay55
Reviews.Content: Rubbing shoulders with some of the expensive hotels around Union Square, the prime location at a very good price is the best reason for staying at the Donatello. The room was spacious, well appointed and fairly attractive. It was also spotless, being kept in good order by very friendly room staff. The bed was good, but not the best. I thought too much street noise filtered through the windows during the night from street cleaners and various garbage trucks which always seemed to be around. Noise from adjacent rooms, however, was no worse than other hotels. The newspaper outside your door each morning was nice, but the complementary "breakfast" was less appealing. While the orange juice was fresh and coffee pretty good (both in paper cups), the high-fat, high-sugar pastries on offer were definitely not my idea of a nutritious breakfast. But at least they were fresh, gave you lots of energy... and who am I to look a gift horse in the mouth? Quibbles aside, I think the Donatello Hotel offers a great combination of amenities and location for the price (I paid less than $100 USD per night before taxes), and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Rooms, Good Location. Breakfast?”
Reviews.Author: Bowlweb
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of a 2 week vacation, a three night say in early May. This was our first time in SF, so I cannot compare to other places. The room (King, standard) was of sufficient size (400 sf) which I hear is a rarity in the city. The location is downtown amid the tall buildings. It is very close to Union Square and all methods of public transit. I chose the deal that included parking. I highly recommend this unless you are familiar with SF and know "where" to park already. Otherwise, Donatello is part of a property network that offers comps if you to listen to their sales pitch for an hour. Parking was one of the comps. We didn't do it, since I had parking in the deal already. In a city of this size, night time noise is expected and SF does not disappoint. We were 10th floor though I'm sure we could have been 1000th floor and it wouldn't have mattered. No biggie for me, I hope I didn't disturb the street life with my snoring. The city is busy and safety was of no real concern until dusk and later. When the throngs of people with permanent residences thin out, things looked a little tough a couple of times. There are some begging homeless, but I found them no more of a nuisance than the people that hand out girl cards in Las Vegas. Don't make eye contact and keep moving. In their defense, I saw a number of them giving directions. This is a characteristic of the city - not the hotel. I did not see anyone "living" near the hotel at night. You want service? You got it! We were immediately checked in and dished off to the concierge for a warm welcome and some useful information. Special mention of Ed (It's always Monday at the Donatello) at the desk, Sarah the concierge, and Joe the bellman. I'm sorry I don't remember the valet, but top notch there, too. Sarah was spot on with restaurant recommendations two out of three times (Fino's downtown and Alioto's on the wharf). Even the third was good - just not "San Francisco" good. The room also included a complimentary continental breakfast, available from 7:00 to 9:30. We were 0-2 on finding anything other than a muffin or a banana / apple. This was a bit of a disappointment (which I have also seen in other reviews). Sheesh, get a big fridge, have some cereals, pastries, jams, jellies, fruits, bagels, cream cheese - you know, the standards - and have enough to last the entire 2 1/2 hours. A little more attention to this and there will be precious little negative to say about the Donatello. I'm glad I stayed and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: PinballSeeker68
Reviews.Content: This was our first overnight stay in San Francisco, so although we have been there before on day trips, I have no other hotel experiences in SF to compare it to. That being said, we travel frequently as a family so I am familiar with similar such options in general. The valet parking package for an extra $20 a day is simply unbeatable in THIS city and there were no issues in that regard. I found other places charging $30-$50+ per night, so as "locals" making the trip from Monterey, we really had no options other than bring the car and were pleasantly surprised with it. The room itself was fairly spacious, but the layout a bit inefficient. This may have been due to being next to the elevator, but for the amount of space, separate living and sleeping areas would have been nice. The sofabed was located in the same room as the bed, so no luck in being able to put the kids to sleep at a different time. The furnishings are in a modern blue and tan decor, and the tv was nice so we still enjoyed the room and found it a pretty good value. Free wireless internet was also included and worked without issue. A small fridge and microwave were also included. We stayed on the sixth floor on a Friday -Sunday on Mother's Day weekend and found outside/street noise to be very prevalent at night with Saturday noise levels being enough to disturb sleep repeatedly. This may be common for hotels at Union Square as there are several night clubs in the area. I don't blame the hotel for this, but may be a consideration for travelers. Within hotel noise was not really an issue, even by the elevator, with only a rare loud grouping passing by. Other than the night noise, everything about this hotel was pleasant. Staff was friendly and attentive, the property clean, and the value for the space is outstanding. I would definitely come back if it was just my wife and myself, but might look for the quieter financial district when bringing children or perhaps insist on a higher floor to see if that alleviates the issue. Finally, a few notes about the trip itself to help others. First, skip the cable cars. Yes, I know that they sound like a romantic experience but the reality is long lines and packed cars, so you are far more likely to be viewing another rider's behind than parts of the city. For the same price ($5 a person) you can get a limo from Union Square to Fisherman's Wharf. If you absolutely must get on one, you will likely need to get on at either end of the line as we saw people repeatedly be told no room at each stop. Second, go to touristy spots early. We went to Pier 39 at opening (10 AM) and without the crowds, is actually a great place for sightseeing and to take the kids. By 1-3, the crowds are there and expect waits for a lot of stuff. Same goes for the Exploratorium. We got there at 10 on a free day expecting the worst, and again, not too bad for the first hour or two. Then the crowds commence. From a practical standpoint, we found 2-3 hours sufficient to view each. We also did the 1 hour Bay Cruise and found that enjoyable. Bring your jacket though. All in all, a very nice stay-cation and well worth the weekend. Thanks SF!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location”
Reviews.Author: AndersonB
Reviews.Content: Only 1 block from Union Square and very near the Powell Street Tram terminal and BART/Muni station, this was an ideal location for our holiday. The rooms were a very good size with a sofabed if required and well maintained. Guest services responded very quickly when required. All the staff were very polite, coutious and efficient. The only downside was the breakfast was only a small selection of muffins, pastries and apples. The breakfast room was small with few tables so it can be difficult getting a table to sit at. Overall a very good hotel and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: dennisvandenhoek
Reviews.Content: - Like: price, room size, location, staff, . - Dislike: Breakfast (only sweets), Internet (extremely slow), room furniture (not new and small workdesk) and bathroom (outdated), noisy airco's outside.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable elegance, top notch rooms.”
Reviews.Author: The_Rock_Lady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a sister's weekend package. It was exactly what we were hoping for and more. Wine glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. all at the ready for the wine and cheese brought back in the evening. Close to publice transportation if you choose to use it. Walking distance to many things. I would definitely stay here again. The staff is superb. I couldn't get the TV to work and called the front desk only to realize that I had the DVD player remote after I hung up the phone! I called them back to let them know my mistake but within 2 minutes a maintenance person was there to correct the problem. This is representative of all the service.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vpvlabod
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a delightful place to stay one block from Union Square in San Francisco. It is central to almost anything you want to see or do in San Francisco. Recently I stayed one week and thoroughly enjoyed being pampered. Everything was perfect and the customer service was excellent. The beds, the Club Room, the front desk and concierge assistance could not have been better. The only negative was the noise from the nightclub from Mason St at 12 and 2 AM, but what do you expect from popular downtown San Francisco? I plan to return soon. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: redi2go2
Reviews.Content: Hotel scale is more intimate than grand, it is located one block from Union Square and the cable cars, and the parking package rate was very reasonable. The Donatello's strongest point is it's staff, all of whom were friendly and obviously focused on serving the guests. The room was very pleasant, with modern decor, lots of storage space, a microwave and small fridge. Included is access to a lounge on the top floor, where you can get coffee, tea and hot chocolate anytime, and juices, bagels, muffins and danish in the morning. We were totally comfortable here, and loved this hotel. (P.S. One of us is a light sleeper, but not bothered by the very popular club across the street!)

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: maitevf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in San Francisco downtown area, on a walking distance to many attractions and with bus line just one block away and good restaurants around it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first time stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: mainemini
Reviews.Content: My wife has been trying to get me to San Fran for years now. Finally went and wound up at the Donatello Hotel and had a wonderful 7 day stay there. Rooms were comfy. Shower nozzle could take your skin off and I didn't want to get out of it. Views were neat considering we were in a city. Staff was excellent and seemed genuinely pleased to see us. They made us feel comfortable and welcome. The breakfast was just muffins and sweet rolls and coffee, but the place we all shared was intimate and unless we wanted to sit on the floor we asked to sit with strangers. THAT was great and we shared some time with people from all over. We would stay there again in a heartbeat and will. We have no clue as to the on site restaurant as we were out all the evenings we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: mazetravel
Reviews.Content: Great rooms great service! I so wanted to try the spa but we had to leave early for my meeting at the other side of the bay =(

Reviews.Title: “Great SF find”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Donatello before, and remembered it as a nice, comfortable hotel with great value. Sure enough - it still is. We had recently stayed at the JW Marriott across the street and wondered why for twice the price. The Donatello is a smaller hotel but with nice ammenities, good service, comfortable rooms (nice to have microwave, refrigerator and dishes). It is clean and comfortable. The beds are too hard. But that is the only negative I can come up with. It is in a great location, within easy walking distance of shopping, cable cars & restaurants. We had a nice little terrace too! Don't spend more - this is still a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Partiz
Reviews.Content: Location, service, accommodations and staff are excellent. Treat yourself and plan a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities and staff”
Reviews.Author: tntpdx
Reviews.Content: Had two suites for a recent girl's weekend. The hotel is very convenient to BART which really saves on ground transportation costs. The location to shopping and sites can't be beat. We walked to the Ferry Building Farmer's Market and it was a quick cab ride to the War Memorial Opera House for the ballet. The rooms are exactly like the photos on the Web site. It was great having the bar sink, fridge and microwave in the room since we could snack while we visited. The rooms are very spacious with nice big windows which let in lots of natural light. One night we brought in food and just watched movies. The hotel has a huge selection of premium movie channels: HBO, Showtime, etc. The complimentary morning breakfast is a nice touch as is the club level lounge and terrace and the complimentary WiFi. Housekeeping was excellent and the front desk and the concierge really went out of their way to be friendly and attentive. This place gets a big thumbs up from us and we're a picky group!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shuggah
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel and in a great location, close to everything. The staff is extremely accommodating and it's a great value. Loved the free breakfast too. The free internet was great to have too. Will surely stay there again! (And for anyone who wants a great place to eat when there check out Lori's Diner, it's so reasonably priced for the area and the food is tasty!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Pefect Location”
Reviews.Author: Shnew
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Donatello with our two young children. It is in a perfect location 1 block from Union Square and the Powell Street cable car line. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean and very large. We had a king size bed with a pull out couch and still had plenty of floor space. The room also had a nice plasma tv and a dvd which was nice for the kids after a long day exploring SF. There was also a continental breakfast with fruit, bagels, muffins, donuts and juice which made it easy to get an early start to the day. When I return to SF I am definitely statying at the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: krinker29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello recently with our 6 year old son. We had the studio suite with a king bed and sofa bed. The room was huge, clean, had a great area with sink, coffee-maker, fridge, microwave & toaster - plus some basics such as salt & pepper, plates, wine glasses & wine opener. The staff was fabulous and extremely helpful! Highly recommend for great room, great location & great staff!

Reviews.Title: “good location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ldjm
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a nice place because of its location in Union Square and cleanliness of hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, though the pillows could be better. They were very flat, but large enough to fold over to have adequate fluff. The housekeeeping staff was pleasant and helpful. They offered extra towels/linens and turn down service daily, though we did not ask for it to be more environmentally responsible. The continental breakfast provided was convenient as we preferred to sleep in and eat in our rooms each morning. We appreciated the perk, though the woman concierge was quite rude. She did not smile and watched over us with her arms crossed. She even had the nerve to ask me what room I was in even though she saw me sign in! The front desk staff and others were friendly and courteous. They acknowledged us with a smile or greeting every time we passed through the lobby. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Donatello and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: dahmac1410
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay close to the cable cars and transportation, easy to get to everything from the donatello, like union square fishermans wharf the castro and other sight seeing places. The staff were very friendly and helpfull and the rooms very spacious and clean. buffet breakfast that was a bonus as well as we wern't expecting that. you are given a welcome pack when you arrive which helps you decide on any tours or sight seeing trips you might like to plan

Reviews.Title: “Giant rooms, contemporary feel, great service, INEXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: JarJar319
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a room here -- the "Recession Special" for $101/night. I booked a stay here largely because of the large room size-- all their rooms are over 400 square feet -- we were traveling with our 14 month old, and I wanted lots of room since we were putting up a pack and play. I also liked the location next to Union Square, a safe, nice shopping area in San Francisco and central to all neighborhoods. The rooms are HUGE. Our room (708) just happened to be laid out perfectly for a baby... there was a small enclave as you walked in that was the perfect size for the pack and play, and slightly removed from our section of the room. So when we put him to bed at 8pm, we didn't have to sit in a dark, silent room. My parents had a room next door, and theirs was laid out a little differently, but also very cool. The rooms are decorated very contemporary and stylish. I liked it a lot. There was a fridge where we could store all of our baby food, a microwave, coffee maker, second sink (right next to the bed, which I loved in the middle of the night), and utensils (!). You could live here and cook all your meals if you wanted to! The room was so huge, there was room for 2 chairs and a sofa. Also, there was a continental breakfast that was free every morning on the top floor. Nothing fancy, but a nice, unexpected bonus. Get there early because they did run out of things. We loved, loved this hotel. The people there were INCREDIBLY friendly and accommodating. I can't recommend this place enough, especially for the value and if you're traveling with a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Good location. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Vivagold
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Excellent location. Nice big clean comfortable rooms. Very friendly helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast & tea & coffee anytime in a comfortable sitting room which overlooks the city. Enjoyed a nice meal in the restaurant as well. If coming from the airport it's a cheap ride on the Bart Train to Powell Street Station & then a short walk to the hotel. Same going back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RolmarMiamiBeach
Reviews.Content: I have been to SF a number of times and have stayed in a number of hotels. I was impress with the Donatello Hotel First in centrally located, an step away from restaurant, cable cars, Union Square, and best fashion store in town. Rooms were spacious and clean, staff very friendly and the Restaurant AAA+ I would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: karinbc
Reviews.Content: We had a great rate for the off-season which always allows for overlooking certain things, although the room was just fine. The front desk staff are very hospitable. The location, just a block from Union Square, is convenient. A detail I appreciate is that the windows can be open for fresh air. I brought my 6 year old with me on this business trip and it was perfect for her. I've stayed at the established hotel and the entitled quaint inn in the Union Square area and I will opt for this hotel first the next time I have to travel to San Francisco because of the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great service and a bargin as well”
Reviews.Author: pkdw2byrds
Reviews.Content: We stay the Donatello when ever we go into San Francisco. It is just a block off Union Sq. and 1 to 2 blocks to a number of theaters as well as great restaurants and clubs. The rooms are really large with plenty of room to spread out. The hotel has valet parking right on the premises and getting your car takes no more than 5 min. or so. The staff is great, friendly and helpful. Since we lived in SF for 35 years until 2005 we don't usually take advantage of the Concierge services. We have eaten in the Zingari Restaurant in the past and it is top notch. One of the many things we like about the Donatello is the fact it has nice bar with live jazz and a happy hour. All in all it is the best deal in town!! We have stayed at two other hotels of similar size, price and location, but you can not beat the Donatello. This is our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello is a great San Francisco hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoSFFan
Reviews.Content: Whenever we take a trip to San Francisco and need to stay in the Union Square area, we select The Donatello. It is just a few blocks from Union Square, the major department stores and great restaurants are an easy walking distance. The personnel at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and are equipped with microwaves, refrigerator and dishes plus the usual TVs and CD/radios. Since my husband is handicapped, we have received extra, friendly help from the bellmen and since we frequent often, they are most gracious to us. The hotel is not fancy but it is attractive, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: BCersCanada
Reviews.Content: We found the location great and the staff were so helpful. Only negative would be the noise outside but hard to avoid in the location.

Reviews.Title: “very good option among so many offers”
Reviews.Author: pecinha
Reviews.Content: I've been to many san francisco hotels to attend medical meeting but this isw by far the best quality-money. very well located, very good rooms and staff perfect. one day they forget to clean the room and as soon as we call, a girl came (unfortunately she did his job in one minute). we also have a complimentary breakfast (we didn´t expect so).

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: bluediamond22
Reviews.Content: This is a great place and with a good location. Walking distance to downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: adteacher
Reviews.Content: San Francisco hotels are just too pricey in today's economy, but The Donatello is a real find. My wife and I didn't know what to expect and we were so delighted, we've already booked rooms for May ( Mother's Day) and July ( a birthday). The room was large, clean, quiet and comfortable. And, in addition to the fridge, microwave and coffee maker, there was a free Continental breakfast in their top floor Club room, with a great view of the city. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions, which, combined with the super room charge, made our 3 night stay affordable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chuang007
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great, close to Union Square, a few blocks from Market Street.10-12 minutes walk to Convention Center. Room is large with King-size bed and Sofa-bed but still is roomy. A little annoying is the tables/desks, small and a few. Wireless works well; a little annoying is need to log in if idles for 10-15 minutes. Breakfast on the top level/club is great. Nice (and big) donut, multiple choice of coffee, plenty of fruits. Wireless and breakfast are the most important things for us to select this hotel. A little annoying is the breakfast stars at 7am not earlier and room is small, sometimes too crowdy. Hotel staffs are friendly and helpful, taxi driver waiting for you in the lobby after you reserved. We stayed at this hotel at the cost of $155 per night in average. A great rate even considering the convention has a “special rates” on several nice hotels: an average of $100 more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: SymphKeys
Reviews.Content: Despite all the wonderful reviews of The Donatello, we were unprepared for the reality upon arriving at the hotel and our room. The view was overlooking Post Street toward another hotel (not a bad thing!) and within easy walking distance to Union Square and the cable car line. The room was large, apparently recently remodeled, with a "kitchenette" area containing coffee pot, microwave, mini-fridge, toaster, selection of coffees, cups, saucers, silver ware, and glassware. Also, the standard clock-radio along with an LCD TV and mini-stereo. Sharing the room with the king-size bed was a sofa, upholstered chair, end table and floor lamp. As someone else mentioned, this was a great spot to return to after a day of sight-seeing. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: anaira
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was great, especially the concierge located on the top floor (i can't think of his name right now!) The location is a block away from Powell Street and the cable car lines. There are quite a few restaurants open pretty late just down the street on Post. I felt pretty safe walking around at night in this neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “A Haven within the Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: john_harriman
Reviews.Content: Great experience. The location is in the heart of San Francisco near Union Square. The staff were universally attentive, knowledgeable and informed. The room was comfortable, cozy and clean. The restaurant was convenient, intimate and served very tasty fare. The Club on top floor, with gym and spa, was an added bonus. The ONLY area for improvement would be the speed of the wireless internet...a little slow...perhaps due to multiple guests using at the same time of day.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello is cheerful and unpretentious and is a perfect jumping off point for walks to almost all points in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: kiwisan
Reviews.Content: The room was generously sized and nicely appointed. The staff was friendly without being solicitous (except for the back door solicitation from the concierge to encourage a trip to their time sharing sales department which we were able to easily deflect). We stayed over a Friday and a Saturday night. There is a club on Mason across from the hotel and a garage on Mason adjacent to the hotel (on the south side of the hotel)that caused more than typical urban street scene noise both nights into the wee hours. (The noise from the exuberant queue waiting to get into the club, the constant buzz of the garage pedestrian warning alarm as cars came and went and the clanking of the 5:00 am clean up team apparently responsible for dumping huge amounts of glass bottles from one container to another.) I would stay at this hotel again, but i would make arrangements for a room on the north side of the building facing on to Post.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Nice Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kdsv
Reviews.Content: The room was large, clean and nicely furnished. There was a nice terrace outside the room. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The location is terrific. Parking was easy. The lounge is very nice and the singer and piano player were very talented. This place was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: johnagui
Reviews.Content: Great service; comfortable rooms, great location/amenities. A very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money, but Noisy !”
Reviews.Author: MrSunset
Reviews.Content: I was there overthe Valentines long weekend, and asked in advance for a quiet room with a view. I got a room on the 5th floor with a little terrace, but in Feb it was of no use. It was too close to street level (the noise was too much), and I didn't have a very good sleep that night. When I walked into the room I found it to be tiny, and the carpet and bathroom a bit tired. I asked at the front desk if I could get another room, and the the girl left a note for the day staff to set me up with a *better* room (she claimed there would be none available until the next morning) . The next morning I headed downstairs and talked to Jesus (yes that's his name) and he was very nice, and relocated me and my bags (while I was out) to the 10th floor. The room there was mich nicer, however the noise was still problematic, but not as bad. There was some kind of shrill that kept coming from across the street, and it occurred to me on my last night that it's the doorman (I think) of the hotel across the street, using a whistle to hail cabs. It was rather annoying, but if you kept all the windows closed I managed to get some sleep. The cleaning staff kept opening the windows every day, so I had to keep closing them. Oh yeah...the maids knock on your door at 8:00 a.m. !!! which is incredibly stoopid...so you need to leave the "Do Not Disturb" sign out, or expect to be waken up, and they will come in unless you go to the door to tell them to go away ! The shower-head was a disaster. You cannot adjust the pressure, and instead of a nice "shower", it bolted out like a firehose, and I literally had to get on my hands and knees in the tub to keep my scalp from blowing off from the water pressure (it was the same type of shower-head in both rooms I was in, so I suspect it's the same all over the hotel). It was also too low vertically. If you're 6 feet or taller, you'd have to be bending over regardless. Either way...you'll be on your hands and knees to shower, so good luck with that ! The breakfast room on the "Club Level" (same floor as the gym) was nice enough, and the continental style food was fine. Good coffee, bagels and pastries ! There is only seating for about 10 people though, and the hotel has about 20 floors...so you do the math. After one attempt, I just took the food to go after that. Once I just went up to get it and came right back down to my room with a paper plate of food. The front desk staff and the doormen were great though, they were very accomodating in listening to concerns, and orfering airport shuttles. They also have a map pad that is handy for when you're heading out at the strart of your day. I got a new sheet every day, and never managed to get lost ! The beds are hard to describe, but they are very comfortable, and linens were good. The rooms have FREE Wi-Fi, so I was happy about that. I could check my email and FaceBook every night without getting gouged with extra fees ! The price I paid was based on a "recession special" and for San Fran it was pretty good ($620. for 5 nights), so there is value for the money ~ I was happy once I got the 2nd room, otherwise my stay there would of been a negative one I think. It's at a good downtown location, just a block from Union Square, and a couple from Market St. (major shopping). You need transportation down to the wharf (waterfront) area, but that's Ok. I pre-bought a 2 day "On/Off" double-decker tour bus ticket, and it's main stop is at Union Square, so my transporation around town was taken care of, and I got the narration as I went ! All the "On/Off" tour bus companies stop at Union Square, so all good there - I hightly recommed them !..they only stop at the major tourist stops/areas all over town (including both sides of the Golden Gate Bridge), and you get a narration as you go...I only took cabs at night after the tour bus's stopped (after 5 p.m.). They service each stop every 30 minutes or so (although there was one cheap company I read about that only did it once an hour - so shop accordingly ! Anyway, I digress. The Donatello would likely get my business again, but keep in mind the above, and the fact that the actual rooms do not look as nice as their website. But San Francisco is an expensive town for accomodation, and their rates are competitive, so unless you're made of cash, it's a good option to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great in many ways, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lemalle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 day stay at the Donatello. The location is great for a city visit. The rooms were immaculate, the staff was friendly and helpful (with one exception). Our room had a plumbing problem and the maintenance staff was up to fix it, even before I returned from the front desk. Even though the literature promised wireless internet in the rooms, none was available in ours. There was a lot of noise in the room. Some from the water pipes and other from some sort of loud machinery that was run somewhere in the hotel. The staff were great and went out of their way to be helpful. The one exception was a woman who saw her job, at the club room, as a rather grim customs inspector, making sure we all signed in and that my wife not steal the 4 grapes that she was bringing to her daughter, who was not feeling well. The bottom line is, I would definitely stay there again. The charm and service outweighs the few draw backs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/value”
Reviews.Author: WaffieNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days. The staff was wonderful. Great value- we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: roscoetheotter
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Donatello. We have stayed there a few times before and the standard was excellent. The studio room with the microwave, fridge and small kitchen area is perfect for us. The Union Square location is perfect and is so convenient for the cable cars. The bed was just so comfy. We got a really good deal and had the parking packag e as well. What more can I say????I would not stay anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful Club room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is in an excellent location at Union Square and perfect for business and fun. Our room was a corner room with lots of light and a sofa bed to sit on and relax. We loved the Club room with the fresh bagels, cold orange juice and hot coffee. It is our place to stay when we come to SF and will recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “One Word: Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: YYCGuy
Reviews.Content: On the Presidents day weekend a few friends & I headed to San Francisco for the weekend & we elected to stay at the Donatello. Although the hotel is part of the Shell Vacations Club, anyone can stay there. The staff at the hotel were friendly, courteous, accommodating (E.G. Late Check Out), overall “Awesome”. The hotel was very clean & well kept. Both our rooms were Hugh compared to some rooms I have stayed in San Francisco & included a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, coffee, utensils, etc. The room had a pull out sofa which was larger than normal & the king size bed was awesome. There is lots of storage space for your clothes, either in drawers or in a closet. The bathrooms were a good size which I think could accommodate someone in a wheelchair, but if you are someone who needs wheelchair access I would suggest you contact the hotel just to make sure. All rooms have flat screen TV's, CD & DVD players. There are windows in the room that do open just enough so that a child can't fall out, which I like as I prefer fresh air over a ventilation system, however it did have both. With the windows open I did sometime notice the noise at night but I did have the option of closing the window plus you are in San Francisco what can one expect. The hotel provides a FREE, yes free, continental breakfast every morning, which included bagels, muffins, pastries, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, orange juice which was good enough to get you through the morning. On Friday afternoons they also provide a FREE, yes free, 2 hr wine & cheese tasting on the Club floor which is at the top of the hotel where the continental breakfast is provided each morning & where there is a small but adequate gym, co-ed whirlpool & sauna’s in each of the change rooms, which also have showers. The Gym, whirlpool, sauna's & change rooms were VERY well kept. The hotel is conveniently located about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the BART's Powell St station, which is San Francisco’s light rail subway system that runs from San Francisco International Airport & only costs a mere $5.35 US per person one way & takes approximately 35 to 45 minutes to get from the airport to the Powell St station, which I highly recommend as its quick & cheap plus I think the BART is the cleanest public transit system I've been on in years, in fact there were people walking through the train on our way to the hotel picking up garbage, talk about impressive. The overall location of the hotel was great, close to Union Square for those who like to shop, lots of restaurants, China town was a few blocks away & access to the BART, MUNI, buses & street cars were only a few minutes away. I took a street car (not a Cable car, they are $5.00 per person) from one of the many stations located on Market St ( which is which is about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel) to Fisherman's Warf & it was only $1.50 per person one way & the transfer I was given was good for almost 3 hrs. At the hotel both the Concierge desk on the main floor or the one on the Club floor can make arrangements for all your travel needs (Tours, Restaurants, etc) & at reasonable prices. One thing to keep in mind parking in San Francisco is not cheap, so if you can get by without renting a car try using there transit systems, it’s awesome. This hotel was great for me (a 46 yr old professional male) & my friends, in short, if you want a clean, friendly, well located & reasonably priced hotel, try The Donatello. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did. Cheers, Christopher Calgary, Canada

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ryourinosensei
Reviews.Content: The staff was so wonderful and friendly, always there to assist in any way. Our room was very large and comfy and the location was terrific. We went in the hot tub and that was nice and the continental breakfast was most adequate. If you are a pastry lover.....you'll have quite a selection to choose from! Best of all, the price was very reasonable for the quality and location. Next time we won't bother shopping around---hello Donatello!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, complimentary breakfast, and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBusymom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Donatello. Very impressed by the size of the room, comfortable king sized bed, mini kitchen, complimentary breakfast with wide range of good quality baked goods and fruits served on top floor overlooking the city, and work out room. Super location jusf off Union Square, easy walking to various sites and food. I found the deal on the Internet and was very pleased with everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: hfba
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to San Francisco and booked The Donatello after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. It was better than the reviews, the room was clean, large and had evrything you could want including wet bar, coffee maker, microwave etc. Its location so close to Union Square, the cable cars and the shopping district is igeal, and the tourist areas are easily reached by a short cable car ride or tram. Breakfast excellent in the Club lounge on top floor (15th) and Gym and spa pool available for use. Also good Itlaian restaurant on 2nd floor called Zingari. Most impotant however were the staff all of whom could not have been more helpful or friendly. If you go to San Francisco this is the hotel to go for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Would stay at no other hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mran89
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay in San Francisco. A colleague had recommended another nearby hotel in the city....but that other place did not have air conditioning nor a refrigerator in the room. Since I was staying in the city for two weeks, I definitely wanted both those things. So after reading the reviews here and at other sites, I decided on The Donatello. It was great! My room was huge! And while some other reviews recommended asking for a room away from the street to reduce the noise.....my room was on the 8th floor and facing the street and I only heard noise outside at night a few times (more so during the weekends than during the week.) The bed was extremely comfortable, the pillows were great (two things I'm very picky about!) Turn-down service each night with chocolates left at your bed side. I did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel because there were so many wonderful restaurants to choose from within one or two blocks from the hotel. Great location...near Union Square....about four blocks from the BART station at Powell street. There was only one thing that I had an issue with....and that was the wireless internet service. The signal in my room was too low to ever connect to my laptop. However I was able to use the hotel guest computer the few times that I needed it.....plus I used my computer all day long at my work location so not having a computer in my room was not a huge issue - although it would have been nice to have during the weekend when I was planning my stops at some of the tourist spots. I only went to the breakfast buffet on the weekend. Not much there other than pastries, bagels, juice and coffee.....but again, plenty of restaurants close by and if you're there on a Saturday morning, the best bet for breakfast is the Farmer's Market at Ferry Plaza. Not sure if my travels will take me back to San Francisco but if I do go back, I will stay at no other hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable room. We'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: naniksik
Reviews.Content: We liked the location near Union Square. We walked to the ACT Theater and ate dinner at the Daily Grill about a block away. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Francisco & The Donatello”
Reviews.Author: ElviraCL
Reviews.Content: When I was offered an exchange from my sharetime advisor all I asked it was the city, San Francisco, they recommended the hotel, The Donatello. What a great choice! It is located only one block from the main Square and from there only two blocks to the Cable cars station. I absolutely loved San Francisco and I loved the hotel too; it is comfortable, great service from everyone, well located, elegant, and good prices for what they offer, stay and food. My only regret is that I could not stay a little longer to enjoy the hotel a little more since I was out almost all day trying to see as much as I could during my brief stay. Mérida, Yucatán, México

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: hogandonall
Reviews.Content: As original owners of The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf, we wanted to experience a stay in the downtown area, so booked with The Donatello to celebrate our Anniversary of 44 yrs. Unfortunately, our stay was not a good experience! We were awakend at 1:30am by loud singing and talking which continued until 3:45am - this made for a very long night! The bed pillows were very uncomfortable (too hard)! On a positive note, Room 511 was a lovely room with an outside patio & the amenities (soft drinks, chocolates & candy) to help celebrate our 44th Anniversary were very much appreciated. Thank you for that touch of kindness! D Hogan

Reviews.Title: “donatello hotel”
Reviews.Author: shazb25
Reviews.Content: very spacious rooms ,excellent service fantastic position- loved it

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: constanttraveller50
Reviews.Content: Ideal location. Spacious room. Amenities well above the norm (complimentary breakfast, internet access, even premium cable channels). The nicest and most accommodating personnel. The "hard" parts of the rooms (tiles, etc.) are showing their age, but everything else is new-ish and rigorously clean. An exceptional value for a low price.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worthy of many more stays”
Reviews.Author: COtravelers2and2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a wonderful location--one block from cable car and other metro connections--no need to mess with a car!! Staff was very welcoming and accomodating, rooms were large and sunny. A great month to visit the city--no big crowds, crab season and the home of Irish Coffee!! We visit San Francisco twice a year, first time at the Donatello--we will return!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful SF”
Reviews.Author: myjugo
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL is very nice, clean and centrally located. It's perfect and not so expensive in comparison to the other hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: quarryhaus
Reviews.Content: This was a trip for my mom who had to go to UCSF for some cancer testing....I wanted a nice place where she would feel comfortable and enjoy the trip. Well....the Donatello surpassed any expectations I had....the hotel is well located in the theater district and near Union Square...ALL the staff were exceptionally professional, friendly, helpful and curteous....the hotel was warm and very clean...the rooms were large especially for San Francisco and they were clean and fun and very nicely appointed. We ate at the restaurant - Zingari - in the hotel because my mom could not walk far.....what a find! The food was amazing and the staff were right there when needed and very helpful....The morning continental breakfast was perfect and the receiving the morning paper was a nice extra touch....My mom loved the whole experience and I will certainly return as often as I can.....What a jewel in among the large less personal hotels.....I have no suggestions for improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: JanesSal
Reviews.Content: The location of the Donatello was perfect for celebrating the 83rd birthday of my dear friend. We wanted to visit Union Square, ride the cable car and once again enjoy the old San Francisco we knew from 40 years ago. Our room at the Donatello was spacious, comfortable and gave us easy access (while on foot.) to all the sights and the cable cars. After checking out various restaurants during the day, we decided the Zingari was comparable in price and menu to the other resturnents near by. It was so convinent to the hotel that it was our best choice. We were not disappointed. My friend wants to bring other family members to San Francisco this summer and hopes to once again stay at the Donatello. It was a great birthday get away for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: wguy00
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Donatello was awesome! My g/f and I got there late (about 1am). Valet came right out and greated us. We checked into the room and had no problems. The room was good sized and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The Donatello is also right in the middle of where I wanted to be. My only gripe is I was called the first morning of my stay by the concierge and asked to attend a 90 minute presentation by their owners (Shell Resorts) and they would comp my valet parking or give me a $100 shopping spree to Macy's. Uhh, what? I'm here for a weekend of sight seeing, not to attend some sales pitch. If it weren't for that, I would have given them 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Spacious Rooms, and Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: mjf365
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my visit to The Donatello. We booked through priceline and when we were assigned The Donatello I was excited to see the quality and reviews that I got for the price ($65 a night) The reality of the hotel far exceeded those online reviews from other travelers. We arrived very late (1 am) and Michelle was at the front desk smiling and greeted us when we arrived. Michelle did a wonderful job getting us a quiet room on the side of the hotel opposite of the noisy club. She also had a bottle of wine delivered up to our room once she found out that it was our anniversary. The concierges gave us excellent directions as well as an excellent map that we used throughout our trip. They also assisted us with information on getting day passes for the cable cars and the best and most efficient routes to get places. The Powell line of cable cars stop only one block from the hotel. The continental breakfast was delicious, plentiful, and was only rivaled by the beautiful view from the rooftop tables. Every one that I saw walk into the hotel was greeted immediately either by the concierge, the housekeeping staff, or the people at the front desk. They truly put the guests first in every aspect. The only minor complaint was that the wireless signal in my room was weak and I had to reposition myself several times to get online. This was probably because we were at the end of the hall. I really can't complain though because the wireless access as well as the Overall though, it was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had during all of my vacation trips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: evad5
Reviews.Content: Kind, attentive staff; roomy, well located, quiet and would stay again. The attached restaurant has a happy hour with half off the appetizers. Well worth your time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for four nights, and while parking was a little pricey this hotel was excellent value. We had a corner studio room which was very spacious with a seating area and flat screen tv. There was a fridge and microwave as well as some crockery and cutlery. The bathroom was a little small but had everything you would need. Great view from the hotel room down Post St to Union Square which was a five mintue walk. The jacuzzi and gym is a bonus providing a nice place to relax after a day trekkign round the city. The breakfast was a little basic but there are plenty of restaurants and diners nearby to grab brunch. There is also a jazz lounge with a pianist and singer and bar area providing afforable tapas during happy hour. A great base for your San Francisco trip.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms great location & amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Simons4
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the Donatello to see the new Academy of Science in Golden Gate Park. Best Deal was to call them directly and book through Shell Resorts who own the property. We stayed in a King Deluxe with a foldout sofa bed. It had some nice extra ammenities, like a little mini stereo, microwave, fridge, a wet bar with plates, glasses, as well as some basic cutlery, bottle opener, cereal bowls, etc. The room had space and was very comfortable. The head concierge, Peter was just GREAT and seemed well connected with most of the wonderful S.F. restaurants. He recommended 2 in the area that were very unusual and superb (Saha & another Asian fusion restaurant). The continental breakfast on the top Club floor is very adequate and there is the Club balcony to sit out on for the great S.F. air, As other travellers have noted, the location is ideal--a block from Union Square, a block from the cable car line, and a few blocks from Chinatown by foot. We took the #71 bus to Golden Gate park and then took the "N" trolley car back ; received a discount at the Academy of Science for taking public transportation.All of the staff helped make our stay very pleasant, and we remarked as we were driving home over the Bay Bridge today that we had a truly exceptional stay in the City. I also want to thank Rolando for the printed directions to get us over the Bay Bridge. Again, another great idea!

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_Aussie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Donatello in Jan 2009 on a business trip to San Francisco.
